original: // / gang 'dir bsod nams ma yin pa de ni mi ldog pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad du gsungs so //
analyzed: // / gang 'dir bsod nams ma yin pa de ni mi ldog pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad du gsungs so //
translated: Non-meritorious action is said to be of eight types, by nature irreversible.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa las ldog pa mi byed pa'i sdom pa rnam pa brgyad nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa las ldog pa mi byed pa'i sdom pa rnam pa brgyad nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the restraint of non-performance of non-meritorious action is of eight types.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa ma yin pas bsod nams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa ma yin pas bsod nams su rig par bya'o //
translated: It is known as meritorious because it is not afflicted.🔽Moreover,

original: yang / lus kyi rnam gsum de dang yang //
analyzed: yang / lus kyi rnam gsum de dang yang //
translated: The three types of bodily action and that,

original: ma bsdus pa dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: ma bsdus pa dang de bzhin du //
translated: Not included, and likewise,

original: ngag gi rnam pa bzhi rnams kyi //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam pa bzhi rnams kyi //
translated: The four types of verbal action,

original: bsod min las ldog bsod nams so //
analyzed: bsod min las ldog bsod nams so //
translated: Are non-meritorious action and its cessation is meritorious.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said.

original: de bzhin du ldog pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa brgyad dang de las skyes pa nye bar skye ba dag nyin mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ldog pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa brgyad dang de las skyes pa nye bar skye ba dag nyin mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the eight types of restraint morality and the eight types of morality arising from that arise day and night.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa yang ngo //
translated: And also in enjoyment.

original: rnam par ldog pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad yin pa de bzhin du rnam par spong ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par ldog pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad yin pa de bzhin du rnam par spong ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: Just as the eight types of nature of cessation, likewise the eight types of abandoning morality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / @220b 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las ldog pa dang / ma bsdus pa las ldog pa dang / brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa dang / phra ma las ldog pa dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / @220b 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las ldog pa dang / ma bsdus pa las ldog pa dang / brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa dang / phra ma las ldog pa dang /
translated: The ten wholesome courses of action are the opposite of the ten unwholesome courses of action:🔽the opposite of killing, the opposite of taking what has not been given, the opposite of sexual misconduct, the opposite of harsh speech, the opposite of divisive speech, the opposite of idle chatter, the opposite of covetousness, the opposite of malice, the opposite of wrong views, and the opposite of taking up what is not Dharma.🔽The opposite of killing is the intention to abstain from killing, and so on up to:

original: tshig rtsub po las ldog pa dang / ma 'brel pa'i brjod pa las ldog pa'o //🔽gang zhig 'dod pas bsdus pa'i sems kyis tshul khrims ngan pa thams cad las so sor ldog par bgyi'o zhes yang dag par blangs pa nas /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po las ldog pa dang / ma 'brel pa'i brjod pa las ldog pa'o // gang zhig 'dod pas bsdus pa'i sems kyis tshul khrims ngan pa thams cad las so sor ldog par bgyi'o zhes yang dag par blangs pa nas /
translated: the opposite of taking up what is not Dharma is the intention to abstain from taking up what is not Dharma.🔽The ten wholesome courses of action are the opposite of the ten unwholesome courses of action:

original: de'i 'dod pas bsdus pa brgyad dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa lus kyis ma bsdus pa dang / ngag gis ma 'brel pa'i las rnam par ldog pa sde rnam par spong ba bcu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas bsdus pa brgyad dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa lus kyis ma bsdus pa dang / ngag gis ma 'brel pa'i las rnam par ldog pa sde rnam par spong ba bcu'o //
translated: the opposite of killing, the opposite of taking what has not been given, the opposite of sexual misconduct, the opposite of harsh speech, the opposite of divisive speech, the opposite of idle chatter, the opposite of covetousness, the opposite of malice, the opposite of wrong views, and the opposite of taking up what is not Dharma.🔽The opposite of killing is the intention to abstain from killing, and so on up to:🔽the opposite of taking up what is not Dharma is the intention to abstain from taking up what is not Dharma.

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i sems kyi de ma thag so sor nyin mtshan du nye bar skye ba nyid skad cig skad cig la skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i sems kyi de ma thag so sor nyin mtshan du nye bar skye ba nyid skad cig skad cig la skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that has taken up the vow arises in each moment, day and night, immediately after the mind that has not taken up the vow.

original: ci srid du yi dam ma spangs pa'am /
analyzed: ci srid du yi dam ma spangs pa'am /
translated: As long as one does not abandon the vow,

original: ci srid 'tshe ba'am 'dod chags dang bral ba thob kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ci srid 'tshe ba'am 'dod chags dang bral ba thob kyi bar du'o //
translated: or as long as one does not attain the state of non-desire.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par 'jog pa dang / yang dag par rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par 'jog pa dang / yang dag par rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: Similarly, there is the vow of the fast, and the vow of the bodhisattva.

original: lhag par spyod pa yang lhag par spyod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lhag par spyod pa yang lhag par spyod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And there is the vow of the practitioner, as long as he practices.

original: yang / sdig pa khrims ngan las ldog pa //
analyzed: yang / sdig pa khrims ngan las ldog pa //
translated: And again,

original: de yi sdom pa brgyad dang gnyis //
analyzed: de yi sdom pa brgyad dang gnyis //
translated: The vow of the eight and two precepts,🔽is the turning away from sin and bad conduct.

original: brgyad nyid yang yang nyin mtshan du'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brgyad nyid yang yang nyin mtshan du'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The eight are taken for one day and night.

original: de la srog gcod pa las ldog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa las ldog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The turning away from killing is of three kinds:

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa'i phyir bsam pa dang / srog gcod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir bka' 'god pa dang / srog gcod pa las ldog pa'i phyir rjes su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa'i phyir bsam pa dang / srog gcod pa las bzlog pa'i phyir bka' 'god pa dang / srog gcod pa las ldog pa'i phyir rjes su gnas pa'o //
translated: The intention to turn away from killing, the teaching to turn away from killing, and the practice of turning away from killing.

original: bsam pa la rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam pa la rnam pa gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention is threefold:

original: 'dod pa dang / byed du 'jug pa la 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la mgu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / byed du 'jug pa la 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la mgu ba'o //
translated: the intention to refrain from killing, the intention to refrain from causing others to kill, and the intention to rejoice in the abstention from killing.

original: bka' 'god pa la yang rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bka' 'god pa la yang rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The teaching is threefold:

original: drangs te 'dzud pa dang / nges par sbyor ba dang / rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: drangs te 'dzud pa dang / nges par sbyor ba dang / rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: the teaching to refrain from killing, the teaching to refrain from causing others to kill, and the teaching to rejoice in the abstention from killing.

original: rjes su gnas pa la rnam pa gsum ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su gnas pa la rnam pa gsum ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The practice is threefold:

original: lus kyis rjes su sgrub pa dang / ngag gis rjes su sgrub pa dang / yid kyis rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis rjes su sgrub pa dang / ngag gis rjes su sgrub pa dang / yid kyis rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: the practice of abstention from killing, the practice of abstention from causing others to kill, and the practice of rejoicing in the abstention from killing.

original: sngon bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //🔽yang / ldog pa bsam dang bka' 'god dang // de dag rjes su sgrub pa nyid //
analyzed: sngon bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o // yang / ldog pa bsam dang bka' 'god dang // de dag rjes su sgrub pa nyid //
translated: As before, this should be applied in the appropriate manner.

original: re re la yang rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: re re la yang rnam gsum mo //
translated: The intention to turn away, the teaching to turn away, and the practice of turning away from killing, each of these is threefold.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, lying and so on should be applied in the same way.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan gyis srog gcod pa las ldog pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan gyis srog gcod pa las ldog pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, the four types of turning away from killing are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa la ldog par bya'o zhes yang dag par len @221a * //🔽pa dang / srog gcod pa las ldog pa la gzhan dag yang dag par 'jog pa dang / gzhan rnams la srog gcod pa las ldog pa yang dag par rjes su gnang bar 'gyur ba dang / rang nyid chu 'dzag pa la sogs pa srog gcod pa yongs su spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la ldog par bya'o zhes yang dag par len @221a * // pa dang / srog gcod pa las ldog pa la gzhan dag yang dag par 'jog pa dang / gzhan rnams la srog gcod pa las ldog pa yang dag par rjes su gnang bar 'gyur ba dang / rang nyid chu 'dzag pa la sogs pa srog gcod pa yongs su spong bar byed cing /
translated: one correctly takes up the vow, “I will turn away from killing,”

original: srog chags rnams 'tsho byed las skyob pa'o zhes de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags rnams 'tsho byed las skyob pa'o zhes de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: one correctly establishes others in turning away from killing, one correctly praises the turning away from killing of others, and one oneself completely abandons killing, such as killing by water, and so on, and one protects living beings from killing.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma las ldog pa yang dag par len pa dang / gzhan yang dag par 'jog pa dang / yang dag par gnang par 'gyur ba dang / lhag par spyod pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma las ldog pa yang dag par len pa dang / gzhan yang dag par 'jog pa dang / yang dag par gnang par 'gyur ba dang / lhag par spyod pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the opposite of the remaining four should be called “taking up the correct practice,” “correct placement,” “correct permission,” and “correct practice.”

original: de ltar brgyad tshan bzhi 'di ni tshul khrims sdom pa sum cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brgyad tshan bzhi 'di ni tshul khrims sdom pa sum cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these four sets of eight are the thirty-two aspects of the vow of morality.

original: 'di nyid de rang bzhin rnam par nyams pa las skyes pa'i gnyen po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'tsho ba'i gnyen po sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di nyid de rang bzhin rnam par nyams pa las skyes pa'i gnyen po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'tsho ba'i gnyen po sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: These are the thirty-two antidotes to the degeneration of the nature of the vow, and the thirty-two antidotes to the degeneration of livelihood.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis pa gnyis ni //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis pa gnyis ni //
translated: The thirty-second of each

original: sdom pa rnam pa drug cu rtsa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa rnam pa drug cu rtsa bzhi yin no //
translated: are the sixty-four aspects of the vow.

original: sdom pa thams cad las de ma thag tu nye bar skye ba nyin mtshan du nye bar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdom pa thams cad las de ma thag tu nye bar skye ba nyin mtshan du nye bar 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From all of these vows, the next one arises immediately, and it increases day and night.

original: ci srid du ma spangs kyi bar du zhes pa la sogs pa sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: ci srid du ma spangs kyi bar du zhes pa la sogs pa sngon bzhin no //
translated: As long as it is not abandoned, and so on, as before.

original: sdom pa de rnams dge ba'i sems kyis yang dag par blangs na dge bar 'gyur ba dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: sdom pa de rnams dge ba'i sems kyis yang dag par blangs na dge bar 'gyur ba dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba yang ngo //
translated: If one undertakes them with a virtuous mind, they become virtuous and they also arise by day and night.

original: sgrib min gyi sems kyis blangs pa ni sgrib min du 'gyur ba dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: sgrib min gyi sems kyis blangs pa ni sgrib min du 'gyur ba dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba yang ngo //
translated: If one undertakes them with a neutral mind, they become neutral and they also arise by day and night.

original: 'o na sbyin pa'i sdom pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sbyin pa'i sdom pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What about the vow of giving?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be stated:

original: dge ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa byin pa las lus kyi sdom pa nyid skye ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa byin pa las lus kyi sdom pa nyid skye ba'o //
translated: The vow of giving arises from giving gifts with a virtuous mind.

original: sbyin bya yongs su gtong bar byed pa nas yongs su longs spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni bsod nams yin cing dge ba nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin bya yongs su gtong bar byed pa nas yongs su longs spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni bsod nams yin cing dge ba nyid do //
translated: The merit and virtue of giving gifts is the giving of the object to be given, and the subsequent enjoyment.

original: dge ba'i sdom pa las skad cig so so la 'phel lo //
analyzed: dge ba'i sdom pa las skad cig so so la 'phel lo //
translated: The vow of virtue increases in each moment.

original: de dag kyang lus kyis tshul khrims ma bsdus pa las ldog pas bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang lus kyis tshul khrims ma bsdus pa las ldog pas bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: They are also included in the vow of virtue because they are included in the restraint of body.

original: yang / dngos gzhi nyon mongs med sbyin skye //
analyzed: yang / dngos gzhi nyon mongs med sbyin skye //
translated: The vow of giving arises from the main part, which is the absence of affliction.

original: de las yongs su longs spyod skye //
analyzed: de las yongs su longs spyod skye //
translated: From that, the vow of enjoyment arises.

original: sbyin bya longs spyod pa nyid na //
analyzed: sbyin bya longs spyod pa nyid na //
translated: When one gives, one is happy;

original: dger gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dger gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: when one gives, one is said to be virtuous.

original: de la sbyin pa la rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three kinds of giving:

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: giving of material things, giving of fearlessness, and giving of the Dharma.

original: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni bza' btung la sogs pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni bza' btung la sogs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving of material things is giving food, drink, etc.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni 'jigs pas gzir ba rnams yongs su skyob pa dang / 'jigs pa'i rgyu las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni 'jigs pas gzir ba rnams yongs su skyob pa dang / 'jigs pa'i rgyu las ldog pa'o //
translated: Giving of fearlessness is protecting those who are frightened and turning them away from the causes of fear.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni @221b gzhan don du gnyer ba la dge ba'i sems kyis mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i chos de nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni @221b gzhan don du gnyer ba la dge ba'i sems kyis mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i chos de nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: Giving of the Dharma is teaching the Dharma of the high rebirths and of definite goodness to those who seek it, with a virtuous mind.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa ni dge bar 'gyur ba'am sgrib pa min pa'i lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pa ni dge bar 'gyur ba'am sgrib pa min pa'i lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Giving of fearlessness and giving of the Dharma are virtuous or neutral, not being obscurations.

original: dge ba de las sdom pa dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba de las sdom pa dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba ni dge ba'o //
translated: The virtue that arises from that virtue, and that arises day and night, is virtue.

original: sgrib pa min pa'i lung du ma bstan pa las sdom pa dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba ni sgrib min gyi lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa min pa'i lung du ma bstan pa las sdom pa dang nyin mtshan du 'byung ba ni sgrib min gyi lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: From neutral actions that are not obscurations, vows arise and they arise day and night.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa yang sdom pa dang lhan cig pas mtha' gcig tu dge ba'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa yang sdom pa dang lhan cig pas mtha' gcig tu dge ba'o //
translated: Generosity of material things is virtuous since it is concomitant with vows.🔽Merit does not increase through the twelve causes of generosity, such as the recipient, since the recipient is neutral, the giver is virtuous and the object given is virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: de las yongs su longs spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang bsod nams dge ba nyid nye bar 'phel ba'o zhes rgyu bcu gnyis kyis yongs su longs spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bsod nams 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las yongs su longs spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang bsod nams dge ba nyid nye bar 'phel ba'o zhes rgyu bcu gnyis kyis yongs su longs spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bsod nams 'phel bar mi 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve causes of the increase of merit through enjoyment are as follows:

original: kun du longs spyod pa la sbyin pa dang / bcings pa la sogs pa grol ba'i don du sbyin pa dang / dus ci lta bar sdom pa skyed pa dang / rang nyid nye bar longs spyod pa dang / log par yongs su longs spyod pa dang /
analyzed: kun du longs spyod pa la sbyin pa dang / bcings pa la sogs pa grol ba'i don du sbyin pa dang / dus ci lta bar sdom pa skyed pa dang / rang nyid nye bar longs spyod pa dang / log par yongs su longs spyod pa dang /

original: ma gnang bar longs spyod pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa dang / gzhan du longs spyod pa dang / phrogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la bgrod pa dang / shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma gnang bar longs spyod pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa dang / gzhan du longs spyod pa dang / phrogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la bgrod pa dang / shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: to enjoy it without permission, to enjoy it completely, to enjoy it elsewhere, to steal it, to cut off the roots of virtue, to go to a place where there are no monks, and to die.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams bshad do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams bshad do //
translated: The contaminated actions have been explained.

original: zag pa med pa'i las ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i las ni rnam pa gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The uncontaminated actions are of three kinds:🔽the morality of the path, the morality of the antidote, and the morality of restraint.🔽The morality of the path is that which is practiced by one who has entered the path.

original: lam gyi tshul khrims dang / gnyen po'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lam gyi tshul khrims dang / gnyen po'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of the antidote is that which is practiced by one who has not entered the path, but who is cultivating the roots of virtue conducive to liberation.🔽The morality of restraint is that which is practiced by one who has not entered the path, but who is cultivating the roots of virtue conducive to penetration.

original: lam gyi tshul khrims ni /🔽mngon du byed pa'i spyad bya spyod pa dag skye bar 'gyur te /🔽'dod pa'i khams sam gzugs kyi khams su skye ba thams cad byang chub yan lag gi sems te /
analyzed: lam gyi tshul khrims ni / mngon du byed pa'i spyad bya spyod pa dag skye bar 'gyur te / 'dod pa'i khams sam gzugs kyi khams su skye ba thams cad byang chub yan lag gi sems te /

translated: The morality of the path is that which is practiced by one who has entered the path.🔽The

original: de yang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa ci ltar gsungs pa rnams rang bzhin rnam par nyams pa las skyes pa brgyad dang / 'tsho ba'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad de rnam pa bcu drug du 'gyur ro //

translated: Moreover, the sixteen types are the eight that arise from the degeneration of the nature of killing and so on and the eight that are the cause of livelihood.

original: de rnams rab tu spangs pa la //
analyzed: de rnams rab tu spangs pa la //
translated: The restraint of morality arises from abandoning those.

original: yang de rnams mi bya'o zhes de @222a * //
analyzed: yang de rnams mi bya'o zhes de @222a * //
translated: One should not do those again.

original: rnams spangs pa las tshul khrims sdom pa bcu drug skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams spangs pa las tshul khrims sdom pa bcu drug skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: From abandoning those, the restraint of morality arises in sixteen types,

original: 'di ltar / rang bzhin nyams pa las skyes pa'i gnyen po brgyad dang / 'tsho ba'i gnyen po brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang bzhin nyams pa las skyes pa'i gnyen po brgyad dang / 'tsho ba'i gnyen po brgyad do //
translated: because there are eight antidotes to those that arise from the degeneration of the nature and eight antidotes to those that are the cause of livelihood.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa re re la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa re re la shes par bya'o //

translated: By this aspect, the sixteen types of immorality are also abandoned. This is the sixteenth.

analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa re res skyed pa'i nyes spyod kyi gnyen pos nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i dbang las bcu drug pa sum cu'o //

original: lam gyi tshul khrims bcu drug pa sum cu gcig skye bar te /
analyzed: lam gyi tshul khrims bcu drug pa sum cu gcig skye bar te /

analyzed: de ltar lam gyi tshul khrims dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya phrag bzhi ru 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are four hundred and ninety-six moralities of the Path.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa la'o //
translated: In the same way, in the knowledge of the investigation of suffering,

analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni // gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i bag la nyal dgu dang bag la nyal ma yin pa bcu gcig ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyi shu rab tu spangs pa'o //

analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa so so la nye bar spyod pa gnyis 'byung ste /

analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i rigs nyes spyod gnyis tshan spong ba ni gcig go //

analyzed: nyes spyod nyi shu tshan gnyis kyi gnyen po nyi shu tshan gnyis te /

analyzed: gnyis tshan nyer gcig sdom pa skye ba'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes lhag ma dang sgom pa'i sa dag la ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: de srid de ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims brgyad nye bar bstan pa'o //

analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho  ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyang /

original: 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i /

original: nyi shu lhag pa'i bzhi brgya'o //
analyzed: nyi shu lhag pa'i bzhi brgya'o //

analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi de rnams la phal cher ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The precepts of the bhikshus are mostly the morality of avoiding the wrongdoings that are prohibited by the Buddha.

original: sems kyi skad cig dus kyis yang dag par 'phel ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig dus kyis yang dag par 'phel ba ste /

original: ma spangs kyi bar du'o zhes so //

analyzed: rgyu bcu gnyis kyis skye ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: snyoms pa'i snyoms 'jug de gang zhe na /
analyzed: snyoms pa'i snyoms 'jug de gang zhe na /

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de yang g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi skyon te /

original: de yang rnam pa bdun no //🔽'di lta ste /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par spyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / 'jug pa dang / byung ba'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa ni de rnams kyis bskyod par bya ba ma yin pas na mi g-yo ba'o //

original: mi g-yo sems pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: mi g-yo sems pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: The unshakable ones are considered to be of the same type.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med /🔽mtshungs ldan de 'dra'i stobs nyams kyis //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med / mtshungs ldan de 'dra'i stobs nyams kyis //
translated: The fourth meditative concentration and the formless

analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: gang 'dir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i las de rnams gsungs so //
translated: The above passage explains the non-defiled karma.

original: bsod nams kyi las de las /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las de las /
translated: From among those karmas of merit,

original: gling bzhi la gnas pa'i mi rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi la gnas pa'i mi rnams su skye'o //
translated: one is born as a human being in the four continents.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ma chags pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i bsod nams las byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi'o //

analyzed: des na 'di ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / nye bar longs spyod pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, this continent is the one in which there is no private property and in which all enjoyments are perfect.

analyzed: zhe sdang med pa yongs su bsgoms pa las shar gyi lus 'phags pa'o //
translated: The eastern continent is Purvavideha, “those who wear clothes made of tree bark.”

analyzed: de nyid kyis na de rnams ni srog chags rnams mi gsod do zhes so //
translated: It is because of this that the people there do not kill living beings.

analyzed: nga rgyal med pa @224b yongs su bsgoms pa'i bsod nams las nub kyi ba lang spyod pa'o //
translated: The western continent is Godaniya, “those who enjoy cattle.”

original: de nyid kyis na de ru rigs gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de ru rigs gcig nyid do //
translated: It is because of this that there is only one caste there.

original: de rnams ni tshad dang gzugs mnyam pa nye bar ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni tshad dang gzugs mnyam pa nye bar ldan pa'o //

analyzed: ma rmongs pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i bsod nams las 'dzam bu gling pa'o //
translated: The southern continent is Jambudvipa, “the Rose-Apple Land.”

original: de nyid kyis na de rnams ni dran pa dang blo phun sum tshogs shing sems pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de rnams ni dran pa dang blo phun sum tshogs shing sems pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is because of this that the people there are endowed with perfect memory and intelligence and are reflective.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug go //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug go // 'di lta ste /
translated: The six gods of the realm of desire are🔽the gods of the Caturmaharajakayika

original: rgyal chen ris nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du /
analyzed: rgyal chen ris nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du /
translated: up to the Paranirmitavasavartin heavens.

original: de ni yang ma rmongs pa mang du yongs su goms pa las lha'o //
analyzed: de ni yang ma rmongs pa mang du yongs su goms pa las lha'o //
translated: It is born from the gods, from the many complete cultivations of the roots of good, and from the non-delusion.🔽From the meritorious action, the shape, the seat, the palace, etc.

original: bsod nams kyi las las dbyibs dang gdan dang gzhal yas khang la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las las dbyibs dang gdan dang gzhal yas khang la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arise.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi bsod nams bsgrubs pa las /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi bsod nams bsgrubs pa las /

original: bsam gtan dang pa'i dman pa dang 'bring dang gya nom pa'i sa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pa'i dman pa dang 'bring dang gya nom pa'i sa gsum ste /
translated: there are three stages of the first absorption, inferior, middling and superior.

original: rim pa bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi lha dang / tshangs ris kyi lha dang / tshangs 'khor gyi lha rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi lha dang / tshangs ris kyi lha dang / tshangs 'khor gyi lha rnams su skye'o //
translated: In order, one is born among the Brahmakayika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, and the Brahmaparsat gods.

original: de kho na bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gsum du /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gsum du /
translated: In the same way, from the three of the second absorption,

original: 'od chung gi lha dang / tshad med 'od kyi lha dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od chung gi lha dang / tshad med 'od kyi lha dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is born among the Parittashubha gods, the Apramanashubha gods, and the Shubhakrisna gods.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i gsum du /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i gsum du /
translated: In the same way, from the three of the third absorption,

original: dge chung dang / tshad med dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: dge chung dang / tshad med dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams su skye'o //
