analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa dang so sor ldan pa'i dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog las 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams so //
translated: The action that is unshakable is the action that is associated with the fourth meditation, and which has a lesser, middling or greater fruit, namely, the gods of the Brahmapurohita heaven, the Brahmakayika heaven and the Great Brahmä heaven.🔽The gods of the Sudarsana heaven are born from the action that is unshakable and associated with the fourth meditation, and from the action that is associated with the practice of the members of enlightenment, and from the action that is associated with the faculty of faith.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las bsam gtan bzhi pa dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams goms pa dang 'khor dad pa'i dbang po las kyang gya nom snang gi lha'o //🔽de nyid dang 'khor brtson 'grus kyi dbang po las shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams so //🔽de nyid 'khor dran pa'i dbang po las mi che ba'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las bsam gtan bzhi pa dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams goms pa dang 'khor dad pa'i dbang po las kyang gya nom snang gi lha'o // de nyid dang 'khor brtson 'grus kyi dbang po las shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams so // de nyid 'khor dran pa'i dbang po las mi che ba'i lha rnams so //
translated: The gods of the Sudarsana heaven are born from the action that is unshakable and associated with the fourth meditation, and from the action that is associated with the practice of the members of enlightenment, and from the action that is associated with the faculty of faith.🔽The gods of the Akanistha heaven are born from the action that is unshakable and associated with the fourth meditation, and from the action that is associated with the practice of the members of enlightenment, and from the action that is associated with the faculty of mindfulness.

original: de nyid dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i 'khor las mi gdung ba'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i 'khor las mi gdung ba'i lha rnams so //
translated: The gods of the Akanistha heaven are born from the action that is unshakable and associated with the fourth meditation, and from the action that is associated with the practice of the members of enlightenment, and from the action that is associated with the faculty of concentration.

original: de nyid dang 'khor shes rab kyi dbang po las 'og min gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid dang 'khor shes rab kyi dbang po las 'og min gyi lha rnams so //
translated: The gods of the Akanistha heaven are born from the action that is unshakable and associated with the fourth meditation, and from the action that is associated with the practice of the members of enlightenment, and from the action that is associated with the faculty of understanding.

original: so so'i skye bo ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang ldan pa'i mi g-yo ba las 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skye ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang ldan pa'i mi g-yo ba las 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skye ba'o //
translated: The beings of the Asamjnika heaven are born from the action that is unshakable and associated with the fourth meditation, and from the action of the ordinary man.

original: nam mkha' rnam shes cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched dang so sor ldan pa'i mi g-yo ba'i @225a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' rnam shes cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched dang so sor ldan pa'i mi g-yo ba'i @225a * //
translated: The meditative attainment of infinite space, the meditative attainment of infinite consciousness, the meditative attainment of nothingness and the meditative attainment of neither discrimination nor non-discrimination.🔽

original: las las rim pa bzhin du gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: las las rim pa bzhin du gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four formless states are the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum po ni las las skyes pa'i lus can rnams skye ba'i rten yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum po ni las las skyes pa'i lus can rnams skye ba'i rten yin no //
translated: The three realms of desire, form, and formlessness are the bases for the birth of embodied beings born from karma.

original: yang / de phyir bsod nams las mi kun //
analyzed: yang / de phyir bsod nams las mi kun //
translated: Thus, all humans are born from merit.

original: 'dod na spyod pa'i lha drug dang ; / de bzhin dang po'i bsam gtan gsum //🔽mi g-yo ba las lhag ma'i lha //
analyzed: 'dod na spyod pa'i lha drug dang ; / de bzhin dang po'i bsam gtan gsum // mi g-yo ba las lhag ma'i lha //
translated: The six gods of the desire realm and the first three concentrations

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: are born from the karma of the unshakable ones.

original: 'o na ci ltar gsungs pa'i las de rnams ci thams cad thams cad kyi skye ba skyed par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gsungs pa'i las de rnams ci thams cad thams cad kyi skye ba skyed par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, do all of those karmas produce birth in all realms?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they do not.

original: de yang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i las bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa mi g-yo ba de ni yang srid skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i ni khams mthun pa ru'o //
analyzed: de yang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i las bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa mi g-yo ba de ni yang srid skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ni khams mthun pa ru'o //
translated: the karma of one who is attached, whether meritorious, non-meritorious, or unshakable, becomes the cause of rebirth.🔽The karma of one who is detached becomes the cause of rebirth in the realm that is similar.

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i las 'dod par gtogs pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i las 'dod par gtogs pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: The karma included in the desire realm is the cause of rebirth in the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyis bsdus pa gzugs su gtogs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyis bsdus pa gzugs su gtogs pa'i 'o //
translated: The karma included in the form realm is the cause of rebirth in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa gzugs med pa'i 'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa gzugs med pa'i 'o //
translated: The karma included in the formless realm is the cause of rebirth in the formless realm.

original: bgrod pa 'phel ba'i las de ni yang srid skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa 'phel ba'i las de ni yang srid skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: The karma that increases the path is the cause of rebirth.

original: gegs de srid pa'i las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gegs de srid pa'i las ni ma yin no //
translated: The karma that is an obstacle is not the cause of rebirth.

original: yang / bgrod pa 'phel dang chags bcas pa'i //
analyzed: yang / bgrod pa 'phel dang chags bcas pa'i //
translated: Moreover,🔽the karma of one who is attached

original: las de mtshungs pa'i khams rnams su //
analyzed: las de mtshungs pa'i khams rnams su //
translated: in the realms that are similar

original: yang srid ljon shing sa bon rgyu //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang srid ljon shing sa bon rgyu // zhes gsungs so //
translated: is the seed of the tree of rebirth.

original: las la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: las la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste //
translated: Karma is twofold:

original: yang srid skyed pa la nus pa nyid kyis bgrod pa 'phel ba'i las dang / phal cher bya ba'i dus nyid du rnam par smin pa phyung nas yang srid mngon par 'du byed pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir gegs de srid pa'i las so //
analyzed: yang srid skyed pa la nus pa nyid kyis bgrod pa 'phel ba'i las dang / phal cher bya ba'i dus nyid du rnam par smin pa phyung nas yang srid mngon par 'du byed pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir gegs de srid pa'i las so //
translated: The action that obstructs existence is the action of obstruction.

original: de la bgrod pa 'phel ba'i las ni brgyad de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bgrod pa 'phel ba'i las ni brgyad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: The action that increases the progress is eightfold:🔽The virtuous action included in the desire realm,🔽the non-obscuring action,🔽the non-virtuous action,🔽the obscuring action,

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i dge ba dang / sgrib pa ma yin pa dang / mi dge ba dang / sgrib pa dang / gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i dge ba dang / sgrib pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i dge ba dang / sgrib pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i dge ba dang / sgrib pa ma yin pa dang / mi dge ba dang / sgrib pa dang / gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i dge ba dang / sgrib pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i dge ba dang / sgrib pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: the virtuous action included in the form realm,🔽the non-obscuring action,🔽the virtuous action included in the formless realm,🔽and the non-obscuring action.

original: yang / 'dod skyes bzhi dang gzugs skyes gnyis //
analyzed: yang / 'dod skyes bzhi dang gzugs skyes gnyis //
translated: Also, four arise in the desire realm, two arise in the form realm,

original: gnyis ni gzugs med skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni gzugs med skyes pa'o //
translated: and two arise in the formless realm.

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽gegs de srid pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // gegs de srid pa ni brgyad de /
translated: It is said.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The action that obstructs existence is eightfold:

original: rmi lam nang gi las dang / srid pa bar ma'i las dang / byas pa'i gnas skabs su byas pa dang / yongs su shes pa skyes pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis lung ma bstan dang / @225b chags bral gyis nye bar bsags pa dang /
analyzed: rmi lam nang gi las dang / srid pa bar ma'i las dang / byas pa'i gnas skabs su byas pa dang / yongs su shes pa skyes pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis lung ma bstan dang / @225b chags bral gyis nye bar bsags pa dang /
translated: karma in a dream, karma in the intermediate existence, karma in the state of action, karma that arises with complete knowledge, uncontaminated karma, karma that is naturally neutral, karma that is accumulated through freedom from attachment,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i las so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i las so //
translated: and karma that is neither the nature of meditation in the form realm nor the formless realm.🔽Moreover, it is said:

original: yang / rmi lam bar srid rnam mi shes //
analyzed: yang / rmi lam bar srid rnam mi shes //
translated: The dream state, the intermediate state, and the state of no awareness,🔽the state of complete knowledge, the uncontaminated,

original: yongs shes skyes dang zag med dang // rang bzhin lung med ma chags bsdus //🔽gzugs dang gzugs med lam ma yin ;
analyzed: yongs shes skyes dang zag med dang // rang bzhin lung med ma chags bsdus // gzugs dang gzugs med lam ma yin ;
translated: the naturally neutral, and the accumulated through freedom from attachment,

original: / zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the path that is neither form nor the formless realm.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las mi g-yo ba'i las rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las mi g-yo ba'i las rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu pa'o /
translated: The great paṇḍita Daśabalaśrībhadra composed this chapter twenty, “Ascertaining Immovable Karma,” from Ascertaining the Compounded and the Uncompounded.

original: // /'dod chags la sogs skyon rnams 'dis //
analyzed: // /'dod chags la sogs skyon rnams 'dis //
translated: This ascertains the faults of attachment and so on.

original: las so de las yang srid do //
analyzed: las so de las yang srid do //
translated: From that action, there is rebirth.🔽

original: yang srid las ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang srid las ni skye ba'o //
translated: From action, there is birth.

original: de nas rga shi kun du 'byung //
analyzed: de nas rga shi kun du 'byung //
translated: From birth, there is old age and death.

original: de las mya ngan sogs de las //
analyzed: de las mya ngan sogs de las //
translated: From that, grief and so on.

original: yang ni nyes rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang ni nyes rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, there is the arising of all faults.

original: de nas de bzhin 'khor 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin 'khor 'gyur ba'i //
translated: From that, there is the arising of the cycle of existence.

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod pa min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod pa min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, there is no beginning.

original: 'di'i don ni de ltar yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i las ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni de ltar yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'i las ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Thus, the action that arises from the afflictions of sentient beings is meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable.

original: de las skye ba'o //
analyzed: de las skye ba'o //
translated: From that, there is birth.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa de las bdag dang gzhan gyi nye bar 'tshe ba las skyes pa dang / grang ba dang rlung la sogs pa'i khams las skyes pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde min sdug min tshor ba nyams su myong ba nyid ma rig pa'i dbang du gyur pas bde bas kun du rmongs pa rnams /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa de las bdag dang gzhan gyi nye bar 'tshe ba las skyes pa dang / grang ba dang rlung la sogs pa'i khams las skyes pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde min sdug min tshor ba nyams su myong ba nyid ma rig pa'i dbang du gyur pas bde bas kun du rmongs pa rnams /
translated: From that action, there is the experience of the results of action, which are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feelings, arising from the harm of self and others, and arising from the elements of cold, wind, and so on. Those who are confused by pleasure, due to being under the influence of ignorance,

original: bde ba dang phrad par sred pa dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar sred pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang phrad par sred pa dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar sred pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: The craving for union with pleasure and the craving for not being separated from pleasure arise.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyis kun du rmongs pa rnams sdug bsngal dang bral bar sred pa dang / sdug bsngal dang mi phrad par srod pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyis kun du rmongs pa rnams sdug bsngal dang bral bar sred pa dang / sdug bsngal dang mi phrad par srod pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: In the same way, the craving for being separated from suffering and the craving for not being united with suffering arise in those who are confused by suffering.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ma yin bde ba ma yin pa'i tshor bas kun du rmongs pa rnams srid pa'i sred pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ma yin bde ba ma yin pa'i tshor bas kun du rmongs pa rnams srid pa'i sred pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: In the same way, the craving for existence arises in those who are confused by the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de las lta ba rnams dang the tshom rnams nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: de las lta ba rnams dang the tshom rnams nye bar skye'o //
translated: From that, the afflicted views and doubt arise.

original: de las yang las so //
analyzed: de las yang las so //
translated: From that, action again.

original: de las skye ba dang sdug bsngal skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las skye ba dang sdug bsngal skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, birth and suffering arise.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i rgyud dang / sred pa'i sbyor bar byed pa las sems can rnams ni zo ba drug gi 'khrul 'khor la zhon te 'khor ba ni sngon gyi mtha' med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i rgyud dang / sred pa'i sbyor bar byed pa las sems can rnams ni zo ba drug gi 'khrul 'khor la zhon te 'khor ba ni sngon gyi mtha' med pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, beings, mounted on the wheel of the six destinies, revolve in the cycle of existence without beginning, by the power of the stream of the afflictions, which is the cause of the obscuration of ignorance, and of the craving which is the condition of the connection with action.

original: de yang / dmyal ba rnams su sreg pa dang gcod pa la sogs pa myong ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dvags rnams la @226a * //
analyzed: de yang / dmyal ba rnams su sreg pa dang gcod pa la sogs pa myong ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dvags rnams la @226a * //
translated: Moreover, the sufferings of the hells are the experiences of burning, cutting, and so on;

original: bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams la skyo ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lha ma yin rnams la nga rgyal gyi sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams la tshol ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams rga ba dang shi ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams la skyo ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lha ma yin rnams la nga rgyal gyi sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams la tshol ba'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams rga ba dang shi ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: the sufferings of the hungry ghosts are hunger and thirst; the sufferings of the animals are stupidity; the sufferings of the demigods are pride; the sufferings of humans are seeking; and the sufferings of the gods are old age and death.

original: gang las de ltar nyon mongs pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang las de ltar nyon mongs pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: From what do these sufferings arise? They arise from the afflictions.

original: las las skye ba'o //
analyzed: las las skye ba'o //
translated: They arise from karma.

original: skye ba las sdug bsngal lo //🔽de las yang nyon mongs yang las /
analyzed: skye ba las sdug bsngal lo // de las yang nyon mongs yang las /
translated: From birth come the sufferings.🔽From the afflictions come karma.

original: skye ba kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: From birth come the sufferings.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'khor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'khor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the principal cause of cyclic existence is the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon du gyur pa ni bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon du gyur pa ni bag la nyal lo //
translated: The seeds of the afflictions are the latent propensities.

original: bag la nyal med pa las /
analyzed: bag la nyal med pa las /
translated: From the absence of latent propensities

original: las dang skye ba zad par 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las dang skye ba zad par 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the karma and birth will be exhausted, and one will be liberated from suffering.

original: bag la nyal zad par bya ba'i don du bag la nyal zad pa'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa brten par bya'o /
analyzed: bag la nyal zad par bya ba'i don du bag la nyal zad pa'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa brten par bya'o /
translated: For the purpose of exhausting the latent tendencies, one should rely on the faculties, etc., which are the cause for exhausting the latent tendencies.

original: dbang po la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du thabs dang rim pa ni 'di'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du thabs dang rim pa ni 'di'o //
translated: For the purpose of attaining the faculties, etc., this is the method and sequence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dang po dang lta ba rnam par dag par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po dang lta ba rnam par dag par bya'o //
translated: First, one should purify the view.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: mos pa can de lta mod kyi tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang po nyid rnam par dag par bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa can de lta mod kyi tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang po nyid rnam par dag par bya'o //
translated: One who is devoted, in order to abide in pure conduct, should first purify the view.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the first in order to abide in pure conduct?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba drang po'o zhes ci skad du gsungs pa'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba drang po'o zhes ci skad du gsungs pa'o ;
translated: Pure morality and upright view.

original: / de bzhin du rta la dkyus sa ston pa'i rigs pas rnam par dag pa'i lta ba dang tshul khrims dang ldan pas bden pa bzhi'i nye bar spyod par gyur pa /
analyzed: / de bzhin du rta la dkyus sa ston pa'i rigs pas rnam par dag pa'i lta ba dang tshul khrims dang ldan pas bden pa bzhi'i nye bar spyod par gyur pa /
translated: Likewise, by the method of showing the race track to a horse, one who has the pure view and morality, by the practice of the four truths,🔽

original: bzod pa'i rnam pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i rnam pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, by the method of showing the race track to a horse, one who has the pure view and morality should practice the four kinds of patience.🔽And again:

original: yang // de phyir bag nyal med pa las //
analyzed: yang // de phyir bag nyal med pa las //
translated: Therefore, from the absence of latent tendencies,

original: las skye zad pa don gnyer bas //
analyzed: las skye zad pa don gnyer bas //
translated: one who seeks the cessation of the arising of karma

original: rnam dag lta ba tshul khrims ni //
analyzed: rnam dag lta ba tshul khrims ni //
translated: should first rely on the pure view and morality

original: brten bya dang por bzod pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brten bya dang por bzod pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and then on patience.

original: des na bzod pa dpyad pa'i don du bden pa la 'jug pa'i sgo brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na bzod pa dpyad pa'i don du bden pa la 'jug pa'i sgo brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to analyze patience, the door to enter into the truth should be stated.

original: de la bden pa ni bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bden pa ni bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four truths:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o ;
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: / de la bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: / de la bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The establishment of the truths is twofold:

original: chos rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the establishment of the teaching and the establishment of the characteristics.

original: de la chos kyi dbang gis tha dad du nges par 'gyur ba de ni chos rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbang gis tha dad du nges par 'gyur ba de ni chos rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The determination of the dharmas is the determination of the dharmas by the power of the dharmas.

original: gang mtshan nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa nges pa de ni mtshan nyid rnam par @226b gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gang mtshan nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa nges pa de ni mtshan nyid rnam par @226b gzhag pa'o //
translated: The determination of the characteristics is the determination of the characteristics.

original: de la chos kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The determination of the dharmas is as follows:

original: sred pa spangs pa'i khams gsum gyi zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sred pa spangs pa'i khams gsum gyi zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates of the three realms, which are the abandonment of craving, are suffering.

original: khams gsum gyi sred pa ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi sred pa ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The craving of the three realms is the origin of suffering.

original: sred pa dngos po med pa ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dngos po med pa ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of craving is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni lam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni lam mo //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the path.🔽Moreover,

original: yang / sred spangs zag bcas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yang / sred spangs zag bcas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The abandonment of craving is the suffering of the contaminated.

original: 'di'i rgyu sred pa gcig pu ste //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu sred pa gcig pu ste //
translated: Its cause is craving alone.🔽The cessation of craving and the contaminated is cessation.

original: sred pa zag pa 'gog pa dang // yan lag brgyad ni de thob lam //
analyzed: sred pa zag pa 'gog pa dang // yan lag brgyad ni de thob lam //
translated: The eightfold path is the path to attain that.

original: 'di ni chos su rnam gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni chos su rnam gzhag go //
translated: This is the determination of the dharmas.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The determination of the characteristics is as follows:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal lo zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal lo zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: All conditioned things, whether impure or pure, are suffering because they are impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal gyi don ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don ni /
translated: The meaning of suffering is

original: mi rtag pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don nyid do //
translated: the meaning of impermanence.

original: ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: As the Lord said, “Monks, form is impermanent.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: What is impermanent is suffering.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: So it is with feeling and the other aggregates.🔽”

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And again:

original: kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste //
translated: Alas, all conditioned things are impermanent;

original: skye dang 'gag pa'i chos can ni //
analyzed: skye dang 'gag pa'i chos can ni //
translated: Their nature is to arise and cease.

original: skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having arisen, they cease.

original: zhes so // de bzhin du zag pa bcas pa'i 'du byed skyed par byed pa'i phyir kun 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin du zag pa bcas pa'i 'du byed skyed par byed pa'i phyir kun 'byung ste /
translated: So too, the origin of suffering is the cause of the arising of impure conditioned things.

original: kun 'byung gi don ni skyed byed kyi don to //🔽ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi don ni skyed byed kyi don to // ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: The meaning of origin is the meaning of cause.

original: gang 'dir rgyu nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: gang 'dir rgyu nyid do zhes so //
translated: As the Lord said, “What is the truth of origin? It is the cause. ”

original: 'du byed thams cad 'jug pa med cing skye ba med pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad 'jug pa med cing skye ba med pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of all formations, which is the non-occurrence and non-arising of them, is cessation.

original: ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du ming dang gzugs ma lus par nye bar 'gags pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du ming dang gzugs ma lus par nye bar 'gags pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: As the Lord has said: “Where name-and-form ceases without remainder, there is only cessation, the calming of all conditioning, the casting aside of all burden, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, nirvana.”

original: thams cad kyang nges par 'byung ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i phyir lam mo //
analyzed: thams cad kyang nges par 'byung ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i phyir lam mo //
translated: The path is so called because it leads to the transcendence of all suffering, to nirvana.

original: ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang su dag dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang su dag dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: As the Lord has said: “Those who practice the wholesome factors of enlightenment go forth to the deathless.”

original: de la nges par 'byung ba'i chos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung ba'i chos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The factors of transcendence are as follows:

original: byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: The four close applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of the supernormal powers, the five spiritual faculties, the five strengths, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: mya ngan las 'das @227a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das @227a * //
translated: Nirvana🔽

original: par bgrod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: par bgrod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path is the path leading to the cessation of suffering because it is the nature of the path that leads to nirvana.

original: gzhan yang bden pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bden pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the definition of the truths is established in two ways:

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / so so'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / so so'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: as a general definition and as an individual definition.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The general definition is

original: thams cad bdag med pa nyid dang // mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag med pa nyid dang // mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: that all are selfless, impermanent, and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second is

original: sdug bsngal mi rtag pa nyid dang / kun 'byung ni rgyu nyid dang / 'gog pa ni rtag pa nyid dang / lam ni nges par 'byin par byed pa nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi rtag pa nyid dang / kun 'byung ni rgyu nyid dang / 'gog pa ni rtag pa nyid dang / lam ni nges par 'byin par byed pa nyid do zhes so //
translated: that suffering is impermanence, origin is the cause, cessation is permanence, and the path is the nature of deliverance.

original: yang so so'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang so so'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the individual definition is in two ways:

original: drang po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / drang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: drang po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / drang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: as the definition of the untrue and the definition of the true.

original: de la drang po min pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la drang po min pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of the untrue is🔽that suffering is impermanent, origin is the cause, cessation is permanent, and the path is the nature of deliverance.🔽The definition of the true is🔽that suffering is impermanent, origin is the cause, cessation is permanent, and the path is the nature of deliverance.

original: sdug bsngal ni nad dang 'bras dang zug rngu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni nad dang 'bras dang zug rngu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Suffering is like a disease, a boil, a thorn, etc.

original: kun 'byung ni rkyen dang rab tu skye ba dang khungs nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni rkyen dang rab tu skye ba dang khungs nyid do //
translated: Origination is like a cause, a source, a spring, etc.

original: 'gog pa ni gnas nyid dang 'dren pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni gnas nyid dang 'dren pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Cessation is like a calm, a bliss, etc.

original: lam ni sgo dang theg pa dang stegs dang sman la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lam ni sgo dang theg pa dang stegs dang sman la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Path is like a road, a vehicle, a raft, a medicine, etc.

original: mtshan nyid drang po ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid drang po ni /
translated: The straightforward characteristic is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Suffering is impermanent.

original: kun 'byung ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni rgyu'o //
translated: Origination is a cause.

original: 'gog pa ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni rtag pa'o //
translated: Cessation is a calm.

original: lam ni nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: The Path is a definite release.

original: gang las de ltar bden pa'i rang bzhin dngos su bzung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las de ltar bden pa'i rang bzhin dngos su bzung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of the Truths is directly grasped.

original: de nyid kyi na mtshan nyid drang por bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pas rang bzhin bzung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi na mtshan nyid drang por bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pas rang bzhin bzung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the straightforward characteristic is the direct grasping of the nature of the Truths by the knowledge of the realization of the Truths.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some think that

original: 'gog pa ni skye ba med par yang blta'o zhes sems so //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni skye ba med par yang blta'o zhes sems so //
translated: cessation should be seen as non-arising.

original: gang las thar pa 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang las thar pa 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who desire liberation are of two kinds:

original: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: fear of suffering and fear of the afflictions.

original: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal bden pa'i gnyen po 'gog pa zhi bar 'du shes par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal bden pa'i gnyen po 'gog pa zhi bar 'du shes par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the first is the perception of cessation as peace, which is the antidote to the truth of suffering.

original: des na des 'gog pa de rtag pa nyid du lta ba'o //
analyzed: des na des 'gog pa de rtag pa nyid du lta ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he views that cessation as permanent.

original: gnyis pa ni kun 'byung bden pa'i gnyen po 'gog pa zhi bar shes cing /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun 'byung bden pa'i gnyen po 'gog pa zhi bar shes cing /
translated: The second is the knowledge of cessation as peace, which is the antidote to the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa de skye ba med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa de skye ba med par lta ba'o //
translated: He views that cessation as non-arising.

original: gang las mtshan nyid drang po 'dis bden pa rnams mngon du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las mtshan nyid drang po 'dis bden pa rnams mngon du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: By this straightforward characteristic, the truths are directly realized.

original: de nyid kyis na grol ba 'dod pas bzod pa drang po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na grol ba 'dod pas bzod pa drang po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who desires liberation should cultivate straightforward acceptance.

original: gal te chos rnam par gzhag pas yid la byed pa rab tu sbyar bas bden pa mngon par rtogs sam /
analyzed: gal te chos rnam par gzhag pas yid la byed pa rab tu sbyar bas bden pa mngon par rtogs sam /
translated: If one realizes the truths by applying attention through the establishment of phenomena,

original: 'on te mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pas she na /
analyzed: 'on te mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pas she na /
translated: or by the establishment of characteristics?

original: brjod par @227b bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par @227b bya ste /
translated: It should be said:

original: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: By the establishment of characteristics.

original: gang tshe de lta na chos rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang tshe de lta na chos rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe ci bya zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, what is the use of positing the dharmas?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gdul bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gdul bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of disciples:

original: dbang po zhan pa dang / dbang po rnon po'o //
analyzed: dbang po zhan pa dang / dbang po rnon po'o //
translated: those with dull faculties and those with sharp faculties.

original: de la dbang po zhan pa rnams mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma 'dres par shes pa dang ma rmongs par bya ba'i don du chos rnam par gzhag pa gsungs so //🔽chos rnam par gzhag pa bzung bas //
analyzed: de la dbang po zhan pa rnams mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma 'dres par shes pa dang ma rmongs par bya ba'i don du chos rnam par gzhag pa gsungs so // chos rnam par gzhag pa bzung bas //
translated: The dharmas are posited for those with dull faculties so that they may understand and not be confused about the distinct characteristics of the dharmas.

original: bde bar mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that those who grasp the dharmas will also grasp the characteristics of the dharmas.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa la skrag pa spangs pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa la skrag pa spangs pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: It is also to avoid frightening those who fear the statement, “All formations are suffering.”

original: blo gsal ba yang mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa la skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo gsal ba yang mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa la skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: Those with clear minds are frightened by the positing of the characteristics.

original: 'du byed 'di rnams tsam zhig gis ci ltar yongs su shes par nus /
analyzed: 'du byed 'di rnams tsam zhig gis ci ltar yongs su shes par nus /
translated: How can one understand these mere formations?

original: de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad kun 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa la bdag gis 'du byed 'di tsam zhig ci ltar spong bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad kun 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa la bdag gis 'du byed 'di tsam zhig ci ltar spong bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Likewise, when it is said that all formations originate, one might wonder, “How can I abandon just these formations?”

original: des na dbang po zhan pa rnams ma rmongs par bya ba'i don dang mi skrag par bya ba'i don du chos rnam par gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dbang po zhan pa rnams ma rmongs par bya ba'i don dang mi skrag par bya ba'i don du chos rnam par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma was taught in order to prevent the weak-minded from becoming confused and in order to prevent them from becoming frightened.🔽Moreover,

original: yang / chos rnams gzhag pa dman pa rnams //
analyzed: yang / chos rnams gzhag pa dman pa rnams //
translated: The teaching of the inferior arrangement of the Dharma

original: skrag pa spang ba'i don du bstan //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skrag pa spang ba'i don du bstan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Was taught in order to eliminate fear.

original: 'o na rnal 'byor pas bden pa'i don du sgo gang nas 'jug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor pas bden pa'i don du sgo gang nas 'jug par bya zhe na /
translated: Now, through which door should the yogi enter into the meaning of the truths?🔽It is said:

original: brjod de / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: brjod de / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo ni bzhi ste /
translated: The door for entering into the realization of the truths is fourfold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: phung po'i sgo dang / skye mched kyi sgo dang / khams kyi sgo dang / ming dang gzugs kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: phung po'i sgo dang / skye mched kyi sgo dang / khams kyi sgo dang / ming dang gzugs kyi sgo'o //
translated: The door of the aggregates, the door of the sense spheres, the door of the constituents, and the door of name and form.

original: sgo ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgo ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Door means the principal.

original: kha cig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas 'jug go //
analyzed: kha cig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas 'jug go //
translated: Some enter through the door of dependent origination, others through the door of the four establishments of mindfulness, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo nyid nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo nyid nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: All bodhisattvas enter through the door of dependent origination.

original: spungs pa'i don gyis phung po ste //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don gyis phung po ste //
translated: The meaning of “aggregate” is “heap.”

original: 'bras phung bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras phung bzhin no //
translated: It is like a heap of grain.

original: 'byung gnas kyi don gyis na skye mched do /
analyzed: 'byung gnas kyi don gyis na skye mched do /
translated: The meaning of “source” is “sense base.”

original: gser gyi 'byung khungs bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi 'byung khungs bzhin no //
translated: It is like a mine of gold.

original: skye mched ni sgo'i don te bzo'i gnas khang bzhin no //
analyzed: skye mched ni sgo'i don te bzo'i gnas khang bzhin no //
translated: The sense bases are the doors, like the doors of a house.

original: khams kyi don ni rang bzhin gyi don te sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhin no //
analyzed: khams kyi don ni rang bzhin gyi don te sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of “constituent” is “nature,” like the earth constituent and so on.

original: rang bzhin zhes pa ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: “ Nature” means “own nature.”

original: de nyid kyis rnam par nyams par byed pas 'di ni khams so //🔽myong bar bya ba'i dngos po de la 'dud pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyis rnam par nyams par byed pas 'di ni khams so // myong bar bya ba'i dngos po de la 'dud pa'am /
translated: It is a constituent because it is that which is damaged.🔽The name is that which bows to that object to be experienced,

original: sems can la 'dud pas ming ngo //
analyzed: sems can la 'dud pas ming ngo //
translated: or it is that which bows to sentient beings.

original: gzugs ni gzugs par bya bas na @228a * //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs par bya bas na @228a * //
translated: Form is that which can be made into form.

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form.

original: gang gis gzugs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gzugs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what is form made?

original: dbyug pa reg pas rdeg pa la sogs pa thams cad rnam par bya ba yin pas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbyug pa reg pas rdeg pa la sogs pa thams cad rnam par bya ba yin pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By all the actions of striking with a stick, touching, etc.

original: ming zhes pa dang gzugs zhes pa ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: ming zhes pa dang gzugs zhes pa ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Name and form are name and form.

original: 'o na gzugs la sogs pa de rnams chos du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs la sogs pa de rnams chos du yin zhe na /
translated: How many dharmas are there in those forms, etc.?

original: brjod de / dbang po lnga dang yul lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: brjod de / dbang po lnga dang yul lnga ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: It is said: The five sense faculties and the five sense objects are the form aggregate.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa'i tshor ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa'i tshor ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain are the feeling aggregate.

original: khyad par gyi rnam pa rnams so sor 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can chos ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rnam pa rnams so sor 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can chos ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The grasping of the various aspects is the perception aggregate.

original: sems pa la sogs pa'i chos ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa'i chos ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The dharmas of volition, etc. are the formation aggregate.

original: mig gi rnam shes la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Eye consciousness, etc. are the consciousness aggregate.

original: 'di ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: These are the five aggregates.

original: dbang po drug dang yul drug ni skye mched bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dbang po drug dang yul drug ni skye mched bcu gnyis so //
translated: The six sense faculties and the six sense objects are the twelve sense bases.

original: dbang po drug dang yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug ni khams bco brgyad do //
analyzed: dbang po drug dang yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug ni khams bco brgyad do //
translated: The six sense faculties, the six sense objects, and the six consciousnesses are the eighteen elements.

original: ming dang gzugs zhes pa ming ni chos bsdu ba bar ma las chos brgya dang bdun cu rtsa brgyad du gsungs te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs zhes pa ming ni chos bsdu ba bar ma las chos brgya dang bdun cu rtsa brgyad du gsungs te /
translated: Name-and-form. Name is the one hundred and seventy-eight dharmas of the second collection of dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: consciousness, feeling, etc.

original: gzhung mang bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas bdag gis ma bris so //
analyzed: gzhung mang bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas bdag gis ma bris so //
translated: Fearing prolixity, I will not write.

original: gzugs ni gang cung zad bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa'o //🔽de la 'dod chags la spyod pa phal cher ni sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa nyid yin pas phung po'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gang cung zad bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa'o // de la 'dod chags la spyod pa phal cher ni sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa nyid yin pas phung po'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Form is whatever is demonstrable or not demonstrable.🔽Those who are mostly given to passion enter by way of the aggregates, because they are afraid of the suffering of the aggregates.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa phal cher ni kun nas nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa nyid pas skye mched kyi sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa phal cher ni kun nas nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa nyid pas skye mched kyi sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who are mostly given to hatred enter by way of the sense bases, because they are afraid of the defilements.

original: des na des thog mar kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i skye mched kyi sgo nas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des na des thog mar kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i skye mched kyi sgo nas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should first cultivate patience by way of the sense bases, which are defiled.

original: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa phal cher ni sdug bsngal dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis 'jigs pas khams kyi sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa phal cher ni sdug bsngal dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis 'jigs pas khams kyi sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The one who practices evenly enters by way of the realm, because he is afraid of suffering and of defilement.

original: de'i phyir des na thog mar sdug bsngal dang kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa khams kyi sgo nas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir des na thog mar sdug bsngal dang kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa khams kyi sgo nas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first of all, he should cultivate acquiescence in the realm of suffering and of defilement.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ming dang gzugs kyi sgo nas dang por bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ming dang gzugs kyi sgo nas dang por bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The one who practices through delusion should cultivate acquiescence by way of name-and-form.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni'ang rmongs shes ches pas sems spang ba chung ba dang dbang po zhan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni'ang rmongs shes ches pas sems spang ba chung ba dang dbang po zhan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one who practices through delusion has a very confused understanding, and so his mind is of little rejection and his faculties are weak.

original: de ni ming dang gzugs tsam nyid shes pa dang spong ba dang / mi dngang  ba dang mi rmongs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ming dang gzugs tsam nyid shes pa dang spong ba dang / mi dngang  ba dang mi rmongs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He should understand and reject only name-and-form, and he will not be frightened or confused.

original: sems pa @228b dang dbang po rgya che ba srid pa tha ma'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mchog tu zab pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo nas 'jug cing bzod pa gcad pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa @228b dang dbang po rgya che ba srid pa tha ma'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mchog tu zab pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgo nas 'jug cing bzod pa gcad pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva in his final existence, whose mind and faculties are keen, enters the profoundest stage, that of the acceptance of the noncreation of things, by way of dependent origination.

original: de la phung po'i sgo nas bzod pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: de la phung po'i sgo nas bzod pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: The yogin who cultivates acceptance by way of the aggregates

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la so sor sum cu rtsa gcig sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa'i bden pa la so sor sum cu rtsa gcig sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: should apply the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation to each of the thirty-one.

original: ci ltar sbyar zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: ci ltar sbyar zhe na brjod de /
translated: How is it applied? It is said:

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Acceptance is cultivated in two ways.🔽What are the two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa'o //
translated: the extensive and the concise.

original: de la so so ni dang po nyid du re zhig rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: de la so so ni dang po nyid du re zhig rnal 'byor pas //
translated: In this regard, the individual is the yogin who, at the very outset,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu'i stobs kyis rnam par gnas pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba skyes pas dang / byung ba rnam par nyams pas dang / rdul phran bsags pa yin pas dang // yan lag du ma ma bsdus pas dang /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu'i stobs kyis rnam par gnas pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba skyes pas dang / byung ba rnam par nyams pas dang / rdul phran bsags pa yin pas dang // yan lag du ma ma bsdus pas dang /
translated: because it has the nature of arising and ceasing, because it endures by the power of its cause, because the non-arisen arises, because the arisen deteriorates, because it is a collection of atoms, because it is not a collection of many parts,

original: skye ba gnas pa mi rtag pa'i rjes su bgrod pa'i phyir gzugs ni mi rtag pa'o zhes nges pas bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba gnas pa mi rtag pa'i rjes su bgrod pa'i phyir gzugs ni mi rtag pa'o zhes nges pas bsam par bya'o //
translated: and because it follows the arising, enduring, and impermanence of form.

original: tshor ba yang ma byung ba skye bas dang / gsum nyid nye bar dmigs pas dang / gcig nyams su myong ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa dang / spyod yul dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis skye bas dang / 'gag pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba yang ma byung ba skye bas dang / gsum nyid nye bar dmigs pas dang / gcig nyams su myong ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa dang / spyod yul dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis skye bas dang / 'gag pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should also practice with regard to feeling, thinking that it is impermanent because the non-arisen arises, because the three feelings are observed, because one experiences the single feeling, because it arises by the power of conceptualization that has form, etc., as its object, and because it has the nature of ceasing.

original: 'du shes ni nye bar mtshon pa dka' bas tshor ba'i rgyu'i dmigs pa'i rnam par khyad par 'dzin pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir dang / tshor ba dang grub bde gcig pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'du shes ni nye bar mtshon pa dka' bas tshor ba'i rgyu'i dmigs pa'i rnam par khyad par 'dzin pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir dang / tshor ba dang grub bde gcig pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Since the perception is difficult to illustrate, it is illustrated by the fact that it holds the form of the object-cause of sensation, and since it is the same as the pleasure of accomplishment.

original: tshor ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since it is related to the arising and passing away of sensation, it should be cultivated as impermanent.

original: de nas 'du byed ni sems kyi 'du byed so sor 'brel pas /
analyzed: de nas 'du byed ni sems kyi 'du byed so sor 'brel pas /
translated: Then, the formations are the mental formations that are related to each other.

original: sems kyi 'du byed skye ba dang nyams pa'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / sems kyi 'du byed ni tshor ba dang 'du shes so //
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed skye ba dang nyams pa'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / sems kyi 'du byed ni tshor ba dang 'du shes so //
translated: Since the mental formations are related to the arising and passing away of sensation and perception, and since the mental formations are sensation and perception,

original: lhag ma mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni de dag dang so sor 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag ma mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni de dag dang so sor 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: the remaining formations that are associated with them are related to each other.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du mi rtag pa'o zhes bde bar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du mi rtag pa'o zhes bde bar spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, like sensation and perception, they should be cultivated as impermanent.

original: des na rnam par shes pa ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams kyi sngon du yid 'gro bas gang las yid gyur pa de las de rnams so //🔽rnam par shes pa rtag pa na mi rtag pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa mi 'tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams kyi sngon du yid 'gro bas gang las yid gyur pa de las de rnams so // rnam par shes pa rtag pa na mi rtag pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa mi 'tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since consciousness precedes feeling, perception, and the formative forces, they are derived from that which is the mind.🔽If consciousness were permanent, impermanent feeling, etc. would not be derived from it.

original: des na rnam par shes pa de yang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa'o zhes mi brtson par skye'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa de yang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa'o zhes mi brtson par skye'o //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is impermanent like feeling, etc.

original: phyis ni rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bsam @229a * //
analyzed: phyis ni rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bsam @229a * //
translated: Later, he should reflect that consciousness is impermanent.

original: par bya'o // de ltar de rnams la re re nas mi rtag pa nyid do zhes dga' ba byung ba na /
analyzed: par bya'o // de ltar de rnams la re re nas mi rtag pa nyid do zhes dga' ba byung ba na /
translated: When he has thus generated delight in the impermanence of each of them,

original: yang gnyis gnyis mi rtag pa nyid do zhes kyang sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang gnyis gnyis mi rtag pa nyid do zhes kyang sgom par byed do //
translated: he should also meditate on the impermanence of two of them together.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: gzugs ni tshor ba dang / gzugs ni 'du shes dang / gzugs ni 'du byed dang / gzugs ni rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba ni 'du shes dang / tshor ba ni 'du byed dang / tshor ba ni rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs ni tshor ba dang / gzugs ni 'du shes dang / gzugs ni 'du byed dang / gzugs ni rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba ni 'du shes dang / tshor ba ni 'du byed dang / tshor ba ni rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: Form is impermanent in relation to feeling, form is impermanent in relation to perception, form is impermanent in relation to volitional factors, and form is impermanent in relation to consciousness.🔽Feeling is impermanent in relation to perception, feeling is impermanent in relation to volitional factors, feeling is impermanent in relation to consciousness,

original: 'du shes ni 'du byed dang / 'du byed ni rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed ni rnam par shes pa dang mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bsam mo //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'du byed dang / 'du byed ni rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed ni rnam par shes pa dang mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bsam mo //
translated: perception is impermanent in relation to volitional factors, volitional factors are impermanent in relation to consciousness, and volitional factors are impermanent in relation to the impermanence of consciousness.

original: yang gsum gsum mi rtag par bsam mo 'di lta ste /🔽gzugs tshor ba 'du shes dang ; gzugs tshor ba 'du byed dang / gzugs tshor ba rnam shes dang / gzugs 'du shes 'du byed dang / gzugs 'du shes rnam shes dang / gzugs 'du byed rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed dang /
analyzed: yang gsum gsum mi rtag par bsam mo 'di lta ste / gzugs tshor ba 'du shes dang ; gzugs tshor ba 'du byed dang / gzugs tshor ba rnam shes dang / gzugs 'du shes 'du byed dang / gzugs 'du shes rnam shes dang / gzugs 'du byed rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed dang /
translated: Again, one should contemplate the impermanence of each triad, as follows:🔽Form is impermanent in relation to feeling and perception, form is impermanent in relation to feeling and volitional factors, form is impermanent in relation to feeling, perception, and volitional factors, form is impermanent in relation to feeling, perception, and consciousness, form is impermanent in relation to perception and volitional factors, form is impermanent in relation to perception and consciousness, form is impermanent in relation to volitional factors and consciousness,

original: tshor ba 'du shes rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du byed rnam shes dang / 'du shes 'du byed rnam shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba 'du shes rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du byed rnam shes dang / 'du shes 'du byed rnam shes so //
translated: feeling is impermanent in relation to perception and volitional factors, feeling is impermanent in relation to perception and consciousness, feeling is impermanent in relation to volitional factors and consciousness, and perception is impermanent in relation to volitional factors and consciousness.

original: yang bzhi bzhi mi rtag pa nyid du bsam mo 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang bzhi bzhi mi rtag pa nyid du bsam mo 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, one should contemplate the impermanence of four things:🔽form, feeling, perception, and volitional formations;🔽form, feeling, perception, and consciousness;🔽form, feeling, perception, consciousness, and volitional formations;

original: gzugs tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed dang / gzugs tshor ba 'du shes rnam shes dang / gzugs tshor ba 'du byed rnam shes dang / gzugs 'du shes 'du byed rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed rnam shes so //
analyzed: gzugs tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed dang / gzugs tshor ba 'du shes rnam shes dang / gzugs tshor ba 'du byed rnam shes dang / gzugs 'du shes 'du byed rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed rnam shes so //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: yang lnga ni mi rtag pa nyid du bsam mo //
analyzed: yang lnga ni mi rtag pa nyid du bsam mo //
translated: Again, one should contemplate the impermanence of five things:

original: gzugs tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed rnam par shes pa rnams mi rtag pa nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed rnam par shes pa rnams mi rtag pa nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa de mi rtag pa'i don dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa de mi rtag pa'i don dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: When the yogin generates joy in the meaning of impermanence in this way,

original: so sor thams cad la yang bzod pa shes par brjod do //
analyzed: so sor thams cad la yang bzod pa shes par brjod do //
translated: it is called the acceptance of each and every one.

original: gang gi tshe phung po lnga char yang de rnams bsdus te mi rtag pa'o zhes dga' ba 'byung ba de'i tshe spyi nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i bzod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe phung po lnga char yang de rnams bsdus te mi rtag pa'o zhes dga' ba 'byung ba de'i tshe spyi nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i bzod par rig par bya'o //
translated: When joy arises in the thought that the five aggregates are impermanent, subsumed within them, then it should be known as the acceptance that focuses on the truth of suffering in general.

original: so sor bzod pa nas phyi'i bzod par 'pho ba na bcos pa'i 'gron bu dang / rku ba khan te dang srin bu'i bug pa dang rkan nag po'i dpe brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor bzod pa nas phyi'i bzod par 'pho ba na bcos pa'i 'gron bu dang / rku ba khan te dang srin bu'i bug pa dang rkan nag po'i dpe brjod par bya'o //
translated: When one passes from the acceptance of the particular to the acceptance of the universal, one should cite the examples of the artificial shell-necklace, the thief, the worm, the hole, and the black palate.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal ni mi rtag par nges pa na /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal ni mi rtag par nges pa na /
translated: Thus, when one has ascertained that suffering is impermanent,

original: phyis sdug bsngal 'di gang las 'byung zhes rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis sdug bsngal 'di gang las 'byung zhes rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: one should investigate from where this suffering arises later on.

original: de nyid kyis na phung po lnga las sdug bsngal 'byung ba'o zhes nges pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na phung po lnga las sdug bsngal 'byung ba'o zhes nges pa rnyed nas /
translated: By that very [reasoning], one should ascertain that suffering arises from the five aggregates.

original: kun 'byung la so so dang spyi nas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung la so so dang spyi nas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should cultivate the acceptance of the universal and the particular with regard to the origin [of suffering].

original: 'di la yang sum cu rtsa gcig sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang sum cu rtsa gcig sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here too, the thirty-one [points] should be applied.

original: @229b dang po re zhig gzugs ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: @229b dang po re zhig gzugs ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: First, one should consider that form is the cause of suffering.

original: gang las 'byung ba chen po'i rdul phran rnams ni phan tshun rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: gang las 'byung ba chen po'i rdul phran rnams ni phan tshun rgyu nyid do //
translated: The atoms of the great elements are mutually the cause.

original: de bzhin du nang gi skye ba la sogs pa'i bdun gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi skye ba la sogs pa'i bdun gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Similarly, the seven internal [links] beginning with birth are the cause.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gzugs ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dang yang dag par 'tshogs pa dang / rga ba dang log pa'i rnam grol dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa rnams kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dang yang dag par 'tshogs pa dang / rga ba dang log pa'i rnam grol dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa rnams kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Form is the cause of birth, of duration, of impermanence, of the collection of the aggregates, of the collection of the elements, of the collection of the sense spheres, of old age and death, of the non-liberation of the perverted, and of the non-liberation of the non-perverted.

original: log pa'i rnam grol dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa spangs te /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam grol dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa spangs te /
translated: The non-liberation of the perverted and the non-liberation of the non-perverted are excluded.

original: gzhan lnga po rnams nyid kyi rnam par smin pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul khrims rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan lnga po rnams nyid kyi rnam par smin pas mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul khrims rnams kyi'o //
translated: The other five are the causes of the ripening of the associated morality.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang gang gi rgyu yin pa'i chos de ci rigs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang gang gi rgyu yin pa'i chos de ci rigs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Feeling, etc. should be understood as causes in the same way, as appropriate.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Feeling is the cause of suffering.

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Formation is the cause of suffering.

original: rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Consciousness is the cause of suffering.

original: de bzhin du lnga po rnams re re nas rgyu nyid du dga' bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lnga po rnams re re nas rgyu nyid du dga' bar gyur pa na /
translated: Similarly, each of the five should be understood as causes.

original: yang gnyis gnyis kyang rgyu nyid du dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gnyis gnyis kyang rgyu nyid du dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Also, the causes of each pair should be examined.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: gzugs tshor ba ni mi rtag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs tshor ba ni mi rtag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Form and feeling are the cause of impermanence.

original: de bzhin du gzugs 'du shes dang / gzugs 'du byed dang / gzugs rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'du byed dang / tshor ba rnam shes dang / 'du shes 'du byed dang / 'du shes rnam shes dang / 'du byed rnam shes dang //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs 'du shes dang / gzugs 'du byed dang / gzugs rnam shes dang / tshor ba 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'du byed dang / tshor ba rnam shes dang / 'du shes 'du byed dang / 'du shes rnam shes dang / 'du byed rnam shes dang //
translated: Similarly, form and perception, form and volitions, form and consciousness, feeling and perception, feeling and volitions, feeling and consciousness, perception and volitions, perception and consciousness, volitions and consciousness,

original: rgyu yin no bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yin no bsam par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as causes.

original: gzhan yang gsum yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, there are three [sets of causes].

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung la sogs pa la ci rigs par sngon bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
