original: ci'i don du bzod pa rnam pa gnyis bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du bzod pa rnam pa gnyis bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: For what purpose should the two types of acceptance be cultivated?

original: brjod de / gang las bsdus sam shes pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod de / gang las bsdus sam shes pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the realization of the truths is through the two types of knowledge that summarize.

original: @231b des na bden pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun par bya ba'i don du bzod pa rnam pa gnyis kyang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: @231b des na bden pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun par bya ba'i don du bzod pa rnam pa gnyis kyang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the two types of acceptance should be cultivated for the purpose of conforming with the truths.

original: 'o na bsdus nas bzod pa bsgom pa'i rtags ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bsdus nas bzod pa bsgom pa'i rtags ci zhe na /
translated: If so, what are the signs of cultivating acceptance through summarizing?

original: brjod de / bzod pa rnam pa bzhi sngom  pa'i rtags de ni /
analyzed: brjod de / bzod pa rnam pa bzhi sngom  pa'i rtags de ni /
translated: It is said that the sign of cultivating the four types of acceptance is

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: phung po ni mi rtag pa'o zhes sred pa dang / phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o zhes sred pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni rtag pa'o zhes sred pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa bgrod pa'i lam ni ma nges par 'byin pa'o zhes dregs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po ni mi rtag pa'o zhes sred pa dang / phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o zhes sred pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni rtag pa'o zhes sred pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa bgrod pa'i lam ni ma nges par 'byin pa'o zhes dregs pa'o //
translated: Craving is: The aggregates are impermanent, The aggregates are the cause of suffering, The cessation of suffering is permanent, and The path that leads to the cessation of suffering is the definite release.

original: yang / de ltar goms pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: yang / de ltar goms pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who is thus habituated

original: bzod pa'i spyad pa legs goms pas //
analyzed: bzod pa'i spyad pa legs goms pas //
translated: and well-trained in the practice of forbearance,

original: kun nas skyo dang brtson pa dang // 'khor lo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: kun nas skyo dang brtson pa dang // 'khor lo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with the four wheels of thorough disenchantment, diligence,

original: dus gsum la ni mkhas pa dang // sgrib pa thams cad ni grol zhing //
analyzed: dus gsum la ni mkhas pa dang // sgrib pa thams cad ni grol zhing //
translated: expertise in the three times, and liberation from all obscurations,🔽accumulating his own collections, always engaging in the holy Dharma,

original: bdag gi tshogs rnams sogs pa dang // rtag tu dam pa byed ldan dang // mchog tu nges par 'byung 'dod pa'i //
analyzed: bdag gi tshogs rnams sogs pa dang // rtag tu dam pa byed ldan dang // mchog tu nges par 'byung 'dod pa'i //
translated: and desiring supreme definite emergence,

original: gsal ba'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: will give rise to the clear forbearance.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag zhes //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag zhes //
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal rnam par gzhil ba yi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam par gzhil ba yi //
translated: and the truth of suffering is to be eliminated.

original: bden pa mngon rtogs mngon du byed //
analyzed: bden pa mngon rtogs mngon du byed //
translated: One should actualize the realization of the truth.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de rnams kyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of these is as follows.

original: bzod pa'i spyad pa legs goms pas //
analyzed: bzod pa'i spyad pa legs goms pas //
translated: By well-practicing the practice of patience,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: is said.

original: gang gis bzod pa'i don du shin tu goms par gyur pa de la /
analyzed: gang gis bzod pa'i don du shin tu goms par gyur pa de la /
translated: By whom patience is well-practiced,

original: kun du skyo ba zhes pa ni //
analyzed: kun du skyo ba zhes pa ni //
translated: is said.

original: gang la yang dag par skyo ba yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang la yang dag par skyo ba yod pa ste /
translated: He who is truly weary

original: mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba bzhin no //
translated: is like one whose head is on fire.

original: brtson pa ni khur ma bor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni khur ma bor ba'o //
translated: Diligence is not casting off the burden.

original: 'khor lo bzhi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi zhes pa ni /
translated: The four wheels are said.

original: 'khor lo chen po bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po bzhi ste /
translated: The four great wheels are as follows:🔽Dwelling in a suitable place,🔽relying on holy people,🔽one's own pure aspiration,

original: 'di ltar / mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa dang // skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / bdag gi smon lam yang dag pa dang / sngon bsod nams byas pa de dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa dang // skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / bdag gi smon lam yang dag pa dang / sngon bsod nams byas pa de dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: and being endowed with previously created merit.

original: dus gsum la ni mkhas pa zhes pa ni //
analyzed: dus gsum la ni mkhas pa zhes pa ni //
translated: Skilled in the three times is said.

original: dus gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three times are as follows:🔽The time of śamatha,🔽the time of thorough training,

original: zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu bslab pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus so //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu bslab pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus so //
translated: and the time of equanimity.

original: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa'i dus dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i dus so //
analyzed: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa'i dus dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i dus so //
translated: Or else, the time of entering into meditative absorption, the time of abiding in meditative absorption, and the time of rising from meditative absorption.

original: gsum po la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in these three.

original: sgrib pa thams cad ni grol zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad ni grol zhes pa ni /
translated: “All obscurations are freed” means

original: bden pa mthong ba'i sgrib pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i sgrib pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: the obscurations to seeing the truth are four.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: las kyi sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang / 'gro ba'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang / 'gro ba'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscuration of karma, the obscuration of afflictions, the obscuration of ripening, and the obscuration of migration.

original: de las grol ba'o //🔽bdag @232a * //
analyzed: de las grol ba'o // bdag @232a * //
translated: He is freed from those.

original: gi tshogs ni 'tshogs pa dang // zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gi tshogs ni 'tshogs pa dang // zhes pa ni /
translated: “My assembly is gathered” means

original: tshogs ni gnyis te 'di lta ste //
analyzed: tshogs ni gnyis te 'di lta ste //
translated: the assembly is twofold.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: They are the assembly of merit and the assembly of wisdom.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni /
translated: The assembly of merit

original: sbyin pa tshul khrims bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan no //
analyzed: sbyin pa tshul khrims bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan no //
translated: is the qualities of the nature of generosity, discipline, and meditation.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni thos bsam bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan dang / sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni thos bsam bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan dang / sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is the qualities that have the nature of hearing, reflection, and meditation, and the wisdom that arises from the ripening of former karma.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan no //
translated: These are the qualities that have the nature of wisdom.

original: yang tshogs la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang tshogs la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, the accumulations are twofold:

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i tshogs dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i tshogs dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa'i tshogs so //
translated: the accumulation of pure morality and the accumulation of pure view.

original: de la gzhan la nye bar mi gnod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la gzhan la nye bar mi gnod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: Therein, morality has the characteristic of not harming others and the characteristic of caring for others.

original: de bdag bden pa dang spong ba rnam par dag pa yis //
analyzed: de bdag bden pa dang spong ba rnam par dag pa yis //
translated: Through the purity of the truth of the self and the purity of abandonment,

original: gang zhig rnam par dag pa 'di ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par dag pa 'di ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: that which is pure is the purity of morality.

original: nye bar zhi ba dang shes rab dag gis lta ba rnam par dag pa'o //🔽shes rab med la bsam gtan med //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang shes rab dag gis lta ba rnam par dag pa'o // shes rab med la bsam gtan med //
translated: Through tranquility and wisdom, there is the purity of view.🔽Without wisdom, there is no meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan med na shes rab min //
analyzed: bsam gtan med na shes rab min //
translated: Without meditative concentration, there is no wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs de ni byin rlabs rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs de ni byin rlabs rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, that side is established as the four kinds of blessings.

original: 'di ltar / tshul khrims rang bzhin yon tan ni bden pa'i byin rlabs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshul khrims rang bzhin yon tan ni bden pa'i byin rlabs so //
translated: Thus, the qualities of the nature of morality are the blessing of truth.

original: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin yon tan ni spong ba'i byin rlabs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rang bzhin yon tan ni spong ba'i byin rlabs so //
translated: The qualities of the nature of generosity are the blessing of abandonment.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rang bzhin yon tan ni nye bar zhi ba'i byin rlabs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rang bzhin yon tan ni nye bar zhi ba'i byin rlabs so //
translated: The qualities of the nature of all meditative stabilizations are the blessing of pacification.

original: thams cad shes pa'i rang bzhin yon tan ni shes rab kyi byin rlabs so //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa'i rang bzhin yon tan ni shes rab kyi byin rlabs so //
translated: The qualities of the nature of all-knowing are the blessing of wisdom.

original: tshogs de rnams dman pas nyan thos kyi byang chub po //
analyzed: tshogs de rnams dman pas nyan thos kyi byang chub po //
translated: Those collections, when practiced by those of lesser capacity, bring about the enlightenment of the śrāvakas.

original: 'bring gis rang rgyal gyi byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis rang rgyal gyi byang chub pa'o //
translated: When practiced by those of middling capacity, they bring about the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: khyad par du 'phags pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par byed do //
translated: When practiced by those of superior capacity, they bring about the accomplishment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽They are always holy,

original: rtag tu dam par byed pa dang // mchog tu nges 'byung tshor ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dam par byed pa dang // mchog tu nges 'byung tshor ba'o //
translated: and they are the supreme feeling of definite release.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: rnam par chad pa med par nges 'byung tshol ba dang / gus pas nges 'byung tshol ba dang / mchog tu zhes pa ni gong du 'phags pa'i nges 'byung tshol ba'o zhes rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa med par nges 'byung tshol ba dang / gus pas nges 'byung tshol ba dang / mchog tu zhes pa ni gong du 'phags pa'i nges 'byung tshol ba'o zhes rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the following in order: “seeking renunciation without interruption,” “seeking renunciation with respect,” and “seeking the noble renunciation” as the highest.

original: gsal ba zhes pa ni bden pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par rno ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes pa ni bden pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par rno ba'o //
translated: “Clear” means sharp in realizing the nature of the truths.

original: bden pa mngon rtogs mngon du byed //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: bden pa mngon rtogs mngon du byed // ces pa ni /
translated: “One should manifest the realization of the truths” means

original: bden pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni so sor nges pa'o //
translated: the realization of the truths is individual.

original: ci ltar nges she na /
analyzed: ci ltar nges she na /
translated: How is it ascertained?

original: brjod de / 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag zhes pa dang // sdug bsngal rnam par @232b gzhil pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: brjod de / 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag zhes pa dang // sdug bsngal rnam par @232b gzhil pa zhes smos te /
translated: It is expressed: “All conditioned things are impermanent,” and “one should destroy suffering.”

original: sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'don pa ste sdug bsngal gyi rnam par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'don pa ste sdug bsngal gyi rnam par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means “one should completely extract from suffering,” or “one should destroy the form of suffering.”

original: 'dir bzod pa dpyad pa nges par byed pa kun du spyod pa 'jug na 'du shes gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir bzod pa dpyad pa nges par byed pa kun du spyod pa 'jug na 'du shes gsum ste /
translated: Here, if one engages in the practice of ascertaining the investigation of patience, there are three perceptions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dngos po'i 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the notion of a thing, the notion of origination, and the notion of cessation.

original: sdug bsngal yang dag par gzhil ba'i bzod pa la ni 'gag pa'i 'du shes gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang dag par gzhil ba'i bzod pa la ni 'gag pa'i 'du shes gsal ba'o //
translated: In the acceptance that completely eliminates suffering, the notion of cessation is clear.

original: cig shos 'du shes gnyis ni zhan pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos 'du shes gnyis ni zhan pa'o //
translated: The other two notions are weak.

original: ming gi 'du shes la ni skye ba'i 'du shes ni med de /
analyzed: ming gi 'du shes la ni skye ba'i 'du shes ni med de /
translated: In the notion of name, there is no notion of origination,

original: 'gag pa'i 'du shes kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i 'du shes kho na'o //
translated: only the notion of cessation.

original: 'gag pa ni dngos po la brten pa'i phyir dngos po 'du shes ni rjes su 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: 'gag pa ni dngos po la brten pa'i phyir dngos po 'du shes ni rjes su 'jug pa'o ;
translated: Since cessation is based on a thing, the notion of a thing follows.

original: / de bzhin du mtshan ma'i 'du shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du mtshan ma'i 'du shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: The same applies to the notion of a sign, etc.

original: de ltar de'i sdug bsngal yang dag par gzhil ba'i bzod pa de dag bsgoms pa na /
analyzed: de ltar de'i sdug bsngal yang dag par gzhil ba'i bzod pa de dag bsgoms pa na /
translated: Thus, when he cultivates those acceptances that completely eliminate suffering,

original: zhi gnas dang gzengs bstod pa dang btang snyoms kyi dus la mkhas pa ches mang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang gzengs bstod pa dang btang snyoms kyi dus la mkhas pa ches mang du 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes very skilled in the times of serenity, encouragement, and equanimity.

original: de yang / sems rgod pa na mi rgod par bya ba'i ched du 'di ni zhi bar gnas pa'i dus so zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang / sems rgod pa na mi rgod par bya ba'i ched du 'di ni zhi bar gnas pa'i dus so zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, when the mind is excited, he should know that it is the time for serenity in order to calm the excitement.

original: rgod pa nye bar zhi ba'i don du shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rgod pa nye bar zhi ba'i don du shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to pacify agitation, one should cultivate pliancy and concentration.

original: sems bying bar gyur pa'am som nyir gyur pa na /
analyzed: sems bying bar gyur pa'am som nyir gyur pa na /
translated: When the mind becomes slack or doubtful,

original: 'di ni rab tu gzengs bstod pa'i dus so zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu gzengs bstod pa'i dus so zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: one should understand that this is the time to uplift the mind.

original: sems gzengs bstod pa'i don du chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga' ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems gzengs bstod pa'i don du chos rnam par 'byed pa dang brtson 'grus dang dga' ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to uplift the mind, one should cultivate the discernment of phenomena, effort, and joy.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa na zung 'jug gi rgyu ba rtag tu bsgoms pas gnyi ga rengs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa na zung 'jug gi rgyu ba rtag tu bsgoms pas gnyi ga rengs par gyur pa na /
translated: When one attains mental balance, one should always cultivate the flow of unification, and when both [slackness and agitation] are suppressed,

original: 'di ni btang snyoms kyi dus so zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni btang snyoms kyi dus so zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: one should understand that this is the time for equanimity.

original: btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate equanimity.

original: de las phyogs gnyi ga rtsol ba med cing myur bar dmigs pa mngon du 'gyur ba dang rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las phyogs gnyi ga rtsol ba med cing myur bar dmigs pa mngon du 'gyur ba dang rab tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, without effort in both directions, the object quickly appears and one becomes clear.

original: dran pa ni dus thams cad du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dus thams cad du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate mindfulness at all times.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa spyad pa 'di rdzogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar bstan pa phan pa'i sems kyi rgyud la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa spyad pa 'di rdzogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar bstan pa phan pa'i sems kyi rgyud la /
translated: Likewise, when one has completed the practice of patience, in order to generate the knowledge of the truth of suffering in the continuum of mind that is the basis of wholesome roots,

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa bskyed pa'i don du dbang po gsal lam spyod yul gyi shugs las sdug bsngal la yid yang dag par dkris te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa bskyed pa'i don du dbang po gsal lam spyod yul gyi shugs las sdug bsngal la yid yang dag par dkris te /
translated: one should focus the mind correctly on suffering through the power of the object field.

original: dus gsum pa'i yang 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa'o zhes 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i yang 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa'o zhes 'jog pa'o //
translated: One should establish the impermanence of the desire realm in the three times.

original: de ltar sgom par byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar sgom par byed pa na /
translated: When one meditates in this way,

original: gang gi tshe yi ge gcig nyid kyis 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /🔽tshigs bcad legs par @233a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yi ge gcig nyid kyis 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste / tshigs bcad legs par @233a * //
translated: at that time, one should apprehend the desire realm as impermanent with a single letter.

original: goms pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: This is the reasoning of being well acquainted with a verse.

original: spyod yul de la 'du shes gang yin pa de ni ming gi 'du shes zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spyod yul de la 'du shes gang yin pa de ni ming gi 'du shes zhes bshad do //
translated: The discernment that is the object field of that is explained as the discernment of name.

original: ming gi 'du shes las pha rol yi ge med par 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa nyid rjod par byed pa'i mtshan ma kun du skyes pa gang yin pa'i 'du shes de ni mtshan ma'i 'du shes zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ming gi 'du shes las pha rol yi ge med par 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa nyid rjod par byed pa'i mtshan ma kun du skyes pa gang yin pa'i 'du shes de ni mtshan ma'i 'du shes zhes bshad do //
translated: The notion that the desire realm is impermanent is a notion of a sign.

original: de yang dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is threefold, according to the division of inferior, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: dman pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / 'bring dang khyad par can gyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: dman pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / 'bring dang khyad par can gyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes so //

analyzed: yang so sor dman pa'i dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye bas mtshan ma'i 'du shes ni dbye ba dgu'o //

original: dman pa'i dman pa mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / dman pa'i 'bring po dang / dman pa'i khyad par can dang / 'bring gi dman pa dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi khyad par can dang / khyad par can dman pa dang / khyad par can 'bring dang /
analyzed: dman pa'i dman pa mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / dman pa'i 'bring po dang / dman pa'i khyad par can dang / 'bring gi dman pa dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi khyad par can dang / khyad par can dman pa dang / khyad par can 'bring dang /
translated: The notion of a sign of the inferior of the inferior, the notion of a sign of the inferior of the middling, the notion of a sign of the inferior of the superior, the notion of a sign of the middling of the inferior, the notion of a sign of the middling of the middling, the notion of a sign of the middling of the superior, the notion of a sign of the superior of the inferior, the notion of a sign of the superior of the middling, and the notion of a sign of the superior of the superior.

original: khyad par can gyi khyad par can no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi khyad par can no //
translated: the special of the special.

original: 'dir / 'di la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir / 'di la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni /
translated: Here, the yogi who abides in this

original: dang po gsum las dang / 'bring po gsum las brgya lam na nyams pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dang po gsum las dang / 'bring po gsum las brgya lam na nyams pa yang ngo //
translated: may regress from the first three, and from the medium three, once every hundred times.

original: phyi ma 'du shes rnam pa gsum ni yang nges par mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma 'du shes rnam pa gsum ni yang nges par mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The latter three discriminations are definitely unshakable.

original: des ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one does not regress.

original: khyad par can khyad par can gyi 'du shes ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos mchog go /
analyzed: khyad par can khyad par can gyi 'du shes ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos mchog go /
translated: The discrimination of the special is the supreme mundane quality with contamination.

original: chos mchog de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos mchog de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The subsequent state of that supreme mundane quality is the nature of meditation, associated and non-associated.

original: de yang mtshungs ldan ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mtshungs ldan ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the associated is the roots of virtue and so on.

original: 'o na gang gi phyir 'di la chos mchog ces brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi phyir 'di la chos mchog ces brjod ce na /
translated: Well then, why is it called supreme mundane quality?

original: brjod de / gang las de zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi nang na 'di ni snying por gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brjod de / gang las de zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi nang na 'di ni snying por gyur pa ste /
translated: It is said that from among all contaminated phenomena, this is the essence,

original: mar gyi nyid khu bzhin no //
analyzed: mar gyi nyid khu bzhin no //
translated: like the cream of butter.

original: des na de'i phyir chos mchog ces brjod do //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir chos mchog ces brjod do //

original: 'dir yang mngon par rtogs pa'i nye bar spyod pa la bcu gnyis pa gsum ste sum cu rtsa drug tu bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang mngon par rtogs pa'i nye bar spyod pa la bcu gnyis pa gsum ste sum cu rtsa drug tu bshad do //
translated: Here, the twelve aspects of the realization of the truths are explained as thirty-six.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod pa la chags bral min par gyur pa'i 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bzod pa dang / 'dod pas bsdus pa'i ming gi 'du shes dang / 'dod pas bsdus pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go //
analyzed: 'dod pa la chags bral min par gyur pa'i 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bzod pa dang / 'dod pas bsdus pa'i ming gi 'du shes dang / 'dod pas bsdus pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go //
translated: The supreme mundane state that is not free from attachment to the desire realm, the perseverance of the desire realm, the conception of the name of the desire realm, the conception of the sign of the desire realm, and the supreme mundane state.

original: 'dod pa la chags bral min par gyur pa'i gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i bzod pa dang / ming gi 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go //🔽'dod pa la chags bral @233b min par gyur pa'i gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i bzod pa dang / ming gi 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go zhes pa ste bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la chags bral min par gyur pa'i gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i bzod pa dang / ming gi 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go //🔽'dod pa la chags bral @233b min par gyur pa'i gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i bzod pa dang / ming gi 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go zhes pa ste bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: The supreme mundane state that is not free from attachment to the form realm, the perseverance of the form realm, the conception of the name of the form realm, the conception of the sign of the form realm, and the supreme mundane state.🔽The supreme mundane state that is not free from attachment to the formless realm, the perseverance of the formless realm, the conception of the name of the formless realm, the conception of the sign of the formless realm, and the supreme mundane state.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bcu gnyis so //
translated: So too, those free from attachment to the desire realm have twelve.

original: 'di ni bcu gnyis pa gsum ni /
analyzed: 'di ni bcu gnyis pa gsum ni /
translated: The three twelvefold moments

original: sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: are thirty six.

original: 'o na de ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i nye bar spyod pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i rnal 'byor la /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i nye bar spyod pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i rnal 'byor la /
translated: The yogi who has trained in the enjoyments of such clear realization

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi spyi bor gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi spyi bor gnas pa nyid do //
translated: is the crown jewel of all ordinary beings.

original: 'di las phan chad du ci 'byung zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: 'di las phan chad du ci 'byung zhe na brjod de /
translated: What arises after that?

original: chos mchog de las par med par rnal 'byor pas yang /
analyzed: chos mchog de las par med par rnal 'byor pas yang /
translated: From the supreme mundane state, the yogi

original: bden pa rnams rjes su mthun par byed pa las /
analyzed: bden pa rnams rjes su mthun par byed pa las /

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zag pa med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zag pa med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, uncontaminated Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering of the desire realm arises.

original: de la chos ni chos nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: de la chos ni chos nyid kho na ste /
translated: Dharma is reality tattva alone,

original: de las skye zhing sems pa las ma yin pas /
analyzed: de las skye zhing sems pa las ma yin pas /
translated: because it arises from that and not from mind.

original: de las chos shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: de las chos shes pa skye'o //
translated: Dharma knowledge arises from that.

original: chos ni sdug bsngal bden pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni sdug bsngal bden pa ste /

original: de ni dang po nyid du shes pa ni chos shes pa'am /
analyzed: de ni dang po nyid du shes pa ni chos shes pa'am /
translated: The knowledge of the first is knowledge of the teaching.

original: chos te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: chos te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The teaching is the four noble truths.

original: gang de rnams dang po'i nyid du 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa'o zhes pa zag pa mang pa'i shes pa de ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang de rnams dang po'i nyid du 'dod pa'i khams mi rtag pa'o zhes pa zag pa mang pa'i shes pa de ni chos shes pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang dag par rdzogs te gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni /

original: so so skye bo nyid 'gag cing //
analyzed: so so skye bo nyid 'gag cing //
translated: ceases being an ordinary being.

original: de 'gags pa las /
analyzed: de 'gags pa las /
translated: From that cessation

original: rgyu 'phags pa brgyad kyi dang por gyur pas brgyad pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu 'phags pa brgyad kyi dang por gyur pas brgyad pa zhes brjod de /
translated: he becomes the first of the eight noble ones and is called the eighth.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is one who has entered for the sake of the fruit of stream entry.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i yang dag par thob pa na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i yang dag par thob pa na /
translated: When he obtains the knowledge of the teaching on suffering

analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa bag la nyal nyon mongs pa bcu spong ba ste /

original: 'di ltar / 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / log par lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims brtul mchog tu 'dzin pa dang ;
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / log par lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims brtul mchog tu 'dzin pa dang ;
translated: the view of esteeming morality and asceticism,

original: the tshom mo //
analyzed: the tshom mo //
translated: and doubt.

analyzed: bag la nyal ma yin pa nyi shu zad par gyur te /
translated: The twenty that are not latent afflictions are eliminated.🔽Thus,🔽lack of faith,🔽shamelessness,🔽deception,

analyzed: 'di ltar / ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / mi brtan pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang / dregs pa dang / khrel med pa dang / shin tu 'dzin pa dang /

analyzed: 'chab pa dang / rmugs pa dang / phying ba dang / le lo dang / @234a * //
translated: laziness,🔽sleep,🔽envy,🔽regret,🔽avarice,🔽intolerance,

analyzed: gnyid dang / phrag dog dang / 'gyod pa dang / ser sna dang / mi bzod pa dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa ste /

analyzed: de nyon mongs pa de rnams rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de ma thag tu rjes su shes pa skye ba'i don du sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: Immediately after the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of the factors with regard to the path arises with a view to the acquisition of the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /

analyzed: de dag bzhin du 'dis de bzhin du lhag ma'o zhes pa med par skye ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: des na rjes su shes pa 'grub pa'i don du /

analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i shes pa skye'o //

analyzed: de yang spangs pa la lta bas nyon mongs pa 'jig byed ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is not by seeing the abandonment that the defilement is destroyed.

original: so sor rtog pa'i shes pa'i bar med par sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i shes pa'i bar med par sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa skye ba'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness arises without interval after the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness.

original: de skyes pa na /
analyzed: de skyes pa na /
translated: When it has arisen,

analyzed: bag la nyal de nyid la khong khro spangs pa'i gzugs kyis bsdus pa dgu dang / bag la nyal ma yin pa bcu gcig spong ngo //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / mi brtan pa dang / rgod pa dang ; bag med pa dang / dregs pa dang / khrel med pa dang / shin tu 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / mi brtan pa dang / rgod pa dang ; bag med pa dang / dregs pa dang / khrel med pa dang / shin tu 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa'o //
translated: lack of faith, shamelessness, lack of conscience, deceit, guile, restlessness, torpor, sloth, lack of vigilance, and lack of conscientiousness.

analyzed: de dang 'di ste nyon mongs pa nyi shur 'gyur ro //

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa bag la nyal dgu po de gnyis /
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa bag la nyal dgu po de gnyis /
translated: The nine dormant afflictions that are included in the formless realm are the same as the above.

original: bag la nyal min brgyad de 'di ltar /
analyzed: bag la nyal min brgyad de 'di ltar /
translated: The eight that are not dormant are

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa de nyid do //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa de nyid do //
translated: the same as the above, lack of faith, and so on.

original: deng 'di ste nyon mongs bcu bdun spong ngo //
analyzed: deng 'di ste nyon mongs bcu bdun spong ngo //
translated: These are the seventeen afflictions that are abandoned.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal la shes pa gsum po 'di skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal la shes pa gsum po 'di skye'o //
translated: Thus, these three knowledges of suffering arise.

analyzed: des na khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa drug cu rtsa bdun rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Therefore, the sixty-seven afflictions of the three realms are completely abandoned.

original: gzhan bden pa gsum la so sor shes pa gsum gsum skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan bden pa gsum la so sor shes pa gsum gsum skye'o //
translated: The three knowledges of the three truths arise individually.

original: de'i rjes su kun 'byung la chos shes pa yang dag grub pa na ;
analyzed: de'i rjes su kun 'byung la chos shes pa yang dag grub pa na ;
translated: After that, when the knowledge of the truth of origination is accomplished,

translated: The twenty non-dormant states abandoned by the path of seeing are: lack of faith, laziness, heedlessness, forgetfulness, distraction, lack of recognition, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, lethargy, and excitement.

analyzed: de'i rjes su kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa skyes pa na / lus dam pa /
translated: After that, when subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin arises,🔽six dormant states of desire are abandoned: the view of the body as superior,

analyzed: mthar 'dzin tshul khrims brtul mchog 'dzin zhe sdang spangs pa bag la nyal drug dang / bag la nyal min bcu gcig zad de /
translated: the view grasping an extreme, the view holding a view as paramount, the view holding morality and asceticism as paramount, and anger.

original: 'di ltar / ma dad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma dad pa /
translated: The eleven non-dormant states abandoned by the path of seeing are: lack of faith,

original: ngo tsha med pa /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa /
translated: shamelessness,

original: sgyu dang / g-yo dang / mi brtan pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang / dregs @234b pa dang / khrel med pa dang / shin tu 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu dang / g-yo dang / mi brtan pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang / dregs @234b pa dang / khrel med pa dang / shin tu 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa'o //
translated: deceit, guile, instability, agitation, heedlessness, arrogance, lack of embarrassment, grasping, and concealment.

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa bag la nyal drug po de nyid dang / bag la nyal min brgyad de /
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa bag la nyal drug po de nyid dang / bag la nyal min brgyad de /
translated: The six latent states subsumed within the formless realm and the eight nonlatent states.🔽Thus, there are fourteen afflictions:

original: 'di ltar / ma dad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma dad pa /
translated: lack of faith,

original: ngo tsha med pa /🔽sgyu g-yo / mi brtan pa /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa / sgyu g-yo / mi brtan pa /
translated: shamelessness,🔽deception,🔽agitation,

original: rgod pa / bag med /
analyzed: rgod pa / bag med /
translated: carelessness,

original: dregs pa ste /🔽nyon mongs pa bcu bzhi po rnams rab tu spong ngo //🔽kun 'byung gi shes pa thams cad la nyon mongs pa lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dregs pa ste / nyon mongs pa bcu bzhi po rnams rab tu spong ngo // kun 'byung gi shes pa thams cad la nyon mongs pa lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: and arrogance.

original: de'i rjes su 'gog pa'i shes pa la lnga bcu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gog pa'i shes pa la lnga bcu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: After that, in the cognition of cessation, there are fifty-eight.

original: de'i rjes su lam la chos shes pa yang dag thob pa na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su lam la chos shes pa yang dag thob pa na /
translated: After that, when the cognition of the doctrine of the path is correctly obtained,

original: de nyid la rang lus dam pa /
analyzed: de nyid la rang lus dam pa /
translated: in that, there are twenty-eight afflictions:🔽the five views,

original: mthar 'dzin lta ba spangs pa /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin lta ba spangs pa /

analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal brgyad dang / bag la nyal min nyi shu ste /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyi shu nyer brgyad rab tu spong ngo //

original: de rjes su lam la rjes su shes pa skyes na /
analyzed: de rjes su lam la rjes su shes pa skyes na /
translated: After that, when the subsequent cognition of the path arises,

analyzed: de nyid la rang lus la dam pa dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / zhe sdang spangs pa gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i bag la nyal bdun dang / bag la nyal min bcu gcig po de nyid do //
translated: In that, there are seven latent propensities included in form, which are the attachment to one's body, the view of grasping extremes, and the abandonment of hatred, and there are eleven non-latent propensities.

original: de dang 'di ste gzugs med pas bsdus pa bag la nyal bdun dang bag la nyal min ma dad pa la sogs pa nas bag med pa'i mthar thug pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de dang 'di ste gzugs med pas bsdus pa bag la nyal bdun dang bag la nyal min ma dad pa la sogs pa nas bag med pa'i mthar thug pa brgyad do //
translated: And these, which are the seven latent propensities included in the formless realm and the eight non-latent propensities, from lack of faith up to carelessness.

original: de 'di ste /
analyzed: de 'di ste /
translated: And these,

original: lam gyi shes pa la nyon mongs pa drug cu rtsa gcig rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: lam gyi shes pa la nyon mongs pa drug cu rtsa gcig rab tu spong ngo //
translated: in the knowledge of the path, the sixty-one afflictions are completely abandoned.

original: des na sdug bsngal chos shes pa nas bzung ste bgrangs na lam la rjes su shes pa bcu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal chos shes pa nas bzung ste bgrangs na lam la rjes su shes pa bcu gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, counting from the knowledge of the dharma of suffering, it is the twelfth, subsequent knowledge of the path.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang /
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of the distinctions with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the subsequent cognition with regard to unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of the factors with regard to the origin, the cognition of the distinctions with regard to the origin, the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin,

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / 'gag pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / 'gag pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: the cognition of the factors with regard to cessation, the cognition of the distinctions with regard to cessation, the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation, the cognition of the factors with regard to the path, the cognition of the distinctions with regard to the path, the subsequent cognition with regard to the path.

original: de ma thag du bcu gsum pa ni 'bras bu'i sems te nyon mongs pa 'joms byed ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag du bcu gsum pa ni 'bras bu'i sems te nyon mongs pa 'joms byed ni ma yin no //
translated: The thirteenth moment is the effect-producing cognition, but it is not the cognition that destroys the defilements.

original: des na 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rnal 'byor pa nges pa la zhugs pa rgyun du zhugs pa 'bras bu'i sems su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des na 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rnal 'byor pa nges pa la zhugs pa rgyun du zhugs pa 'bras bu'i sems su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the yogācāra who is not detached from the realm of desire, but who has entered the certainty of perfection, is considered to be in the effect-producing cognition.

original: 'bras bu'i sems de nyid ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sems de nyid ni /
translated: This effect-producing cognition is of two types:

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod @235a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod @235a * //
translated: The mundane path🔽

original: pa'i khams la chags bral phyed pa nges pa la zhugs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu sems su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: pa'i khams la chags bral phyed pa nges pa la zhugs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu sems su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The worldly path, by the power of the worldly path, is the result of the once-returner, who is definitely engaged in the path and is free from half of the attachments of the desire realm.

original: bcu gsum pa'i sems de nyid ni /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa'i sems de nyid ni /
translated: That very thirteenth moment of mind

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor pa nges pa la zhugs pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i sems su rnam par gzhag go //🔽de bzhin du 'dod pa dang gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i nges pa la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor pa nges pa la zhugs pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i sems su rnam par gzhag go // de bzhin du 'dod pa dang gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i nges pa la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i /
translated: is the result of the non-returner, who is definitely engaged in the path and is free from attachment to the desire realm by the power of the worldly path.

original: gang bcu gsum pa'i 'bras bu'i sems ni phyir mi 'ong ba 'bras bu'i sems su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang bcu gsum pa'i 'bras bu'i sems ni phyir mi 'ong ba 'bras bu'i sems su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Similarly, the result of the non-returner is the mind of the thirteenth moment of the yogi who is definitely engaged in the path and is free from attachment to the desire realm and the form realm.🔽Moreover,

original: yang / de las bar med sdug bsngal la //
analyzed: yang / de las bar med sdug bsngal la //
translated: In that, the uninterrupted suffering

original: chos shes zag pa med pa ni //
analyzed: chos shes zag pa med pa ni //
translated: Is the uncontaminated dharma knowledge.

original: der gnas so sor skye bo yi //
analyzed: der gnas so sor skye bo yi //
translated: Abiding there, the individual

original: sa mtshams shin tu rgal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa mtshams shin tu rgal bar 'gyur //
translated: Completely crosses the boundary.

original: brgyad par 'gyur ro 'gas pa yi //
analyzed: brgyad par 'gyur ro 'gas pa yi //
translated: It becomes the eighth, the result of the non-returner.

original: 'bras bu don du rgyun zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu don du rgyun zhugs pa'o //
translated: The result is the stream-enterer.

original: chos shes so sor rtog pa zhes //
analyzed: chos shes so sor rtog pa zhes //
translated: One understands the Dharma, and then

original: de nas shes pa rjes su skyes //🔽de ltar rgyu dang zhi ba thabs //
analyzed: de nas shes pa rjes su skyes // de ltar rgyu dang zhi ba thabs //
translated: the subsequent cognition arises.🔽 Thus, the three cognitions arise in order

original: gsum la blo gsum rim pas so //
analyzed: gsum la blo gsum rim pas so //
translated: with regard to the three: cause, peace, and method.

original: de ma thag tu bcu gsum pa //
analyzed: de ma thag tu bcu gsum pa //
translated: Immediately after that, the thirteenth,

original: shes pa dag pa skyon spong min //
analyzed: shes pa dag pa skyon spong min //
translated: the cognition of the destruction of defilements, is not a result.

original: sems de 'bras bu gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: sems de 'bras bu gsum du 'gyur //
translated: That mind becomes three results:

original: chags bcas phyed bcas chags bral lo //
analyzed: chags bcas phyed bcas chags bral lo //
translated: with attachment, with half abandoned, and free from attachment.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of realization?

original: brjod de / 'jig rten pa'i mchog dang bcu gsum pa 'bras bu'i sems dang shes pa bcu gnyis dang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi shes bya rnams rnal 'byor pas mngon sum du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod de / 'jig rten pa'i mchog dang bcu gsum pa 'bras bu'i sems dang shes pa bcu gnyis dang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi shes bya rnams rnal 'byor pas mngon sum du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The supreme worldly cognition and the thirteenth, the result-cognition, are the direct realization by the yogi of the twelve cognitions and the objects to be known of the noble truths.🔽 Moreover, it is said:

original: yang / 'di ru de snyed mngon rtogs ni //
analyzed: yang / 'di ru de snyed mngon rtogs ni //
translated: The realization of that much here

original: shes bya mnyam rtogs nyid ces gsungs //
analyzed: shes bya mnyam rtogs nyid ces gsungs //
translated: is called the realization of the equality of objects of knowledge.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de yang rnam pa lnga ste ;
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de yang rnam pa lnga ste ;
translated: That realization is also fivefold:

original: mthong ba'i mngon rtogs dang / spangs pa'i mngon rtogs dang / mngon du byed pa'i mngon rtogs dang / yongs su shes pa'i mngon rtogs dang sgom pa'i mngon rtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i mngon rtogs dang / spangs pa'i mngon rtogs dang / mngon du byed pa'i mngon rtogs dang / yongs su shes pa'i mngon rtogs dang sgom pa'i mngon rtogs so //
translated: The clear realization of seeing, the clear realization of abandonment, the clear realization of manifesting, the clear realization of thorough understanding, and the clear realization of meditation.

original: yang de ni rnam pa lnga ru 'dod //
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa lnga ru 'dod //
translated: Moreover, it is asserted to be fivefold.🔽Seeing, abandonment,

original: mthong ba dang ni spong ba dang // mngon du byed pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni spong ba dang // mngon du byed pa nyid dang ni //
translated: manifesting,

original: yongs su shes dang bsgom pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su shes dang bsgom pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: thorough understanding, and meditation.

original: de la mthong ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Seeing is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / dmigs su 'dzin pa'i mthong ba dang // mngon par 'dzin pa mthong ba dang // don gyi rtogs pa mthong ba dang // mtshan nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dmigs su 'dzin pa'i mthong ba dang // mngon par 'dzin pa mthong ba dang // don gyi rtogs pa mthong ba dang // mtshan nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: the seeing of apprehending the object, the seeing of manifest apprehension, the seeing of the realization of the object, and the seeing of the characteristics.

original: spong ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spong ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Abandonment is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / rnam par rengs pa'i spong ba dang / bdun @235b pa 'dod chags kyi spong ba dang / 'grib pa'i spong ba dang / 'gog pa'i spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam par rengs pa'i spong ba dang / bdun @235b pa 'dod chags kyi spong ba dang / 'grib pa'i spong ba dang / 'gog pa'i spong ba'o //
translated: the abandonment of complete subjugation, the abandonment of separation from attachment, the abandonment of decrease, and the abandonment of cessation.

original: mngon du byed pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Manifesting is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / lus kyis mngon du byed pa rnyed pa dang / shes rab kyis so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lus kyis mngon du byed pa rnyed pa dang / shes rab kyis so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, the acquisition of the realization of the body and the discernment by wisdom.

original: yongs su ni thams cad do //
analyzed: yongs su ni thams cad do //
translated: The complete is all.

original: de kho na nyid mkhyen cing zag pa dang bcas pa rnam par 'bral ba de ni yongs su shes pa'o ste rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mkhyen cing zag pa dang bcas pa rnam par 'bral ba de ni yongs su shes pa'o ste rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The knowledge of reality and the separation from the contaminated is complete knowledge, which is ninefold.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: The complete knowledge of the cognition of the teaching with regard to the origin, the complete knowledge of the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin, the complete knowledge of the cognition of the teaching with regard to cessation, the complete knowledge of the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation,

original: lam la chos shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa'i chags pa bral ba yongs su shes pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la gzugs kyi chags pa bral ba yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa yongs su shes pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa'i chags pa bral ba yongs su shes pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la gzugs kyi chags pa bral ba yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: the complete knowledge of the cognition of the teaching with regard to the path, the complete knowledge of the subsequent cognition with regard to the path, the complete knowledge of the path of cultivation which is the separation from the attachment of the realm of desire, the complete knowledge of the path of cultivation which is the separation from the attachment of the realm of form,

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gzugs med pa'i chags pa bral ba yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gzugs med pa'i chags pa bral ba yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: On the path of cultivation, the complete knowledge of the detachment from the attachment to the formless realm.

original: de bsgom pa sgom pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bsgom pa sgom pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four cultivations of this path:

original: 'di ltar / skye ba sgom pa dang / kun du brten pa sgom pa dang / spas  pa sgom pa dang / rnam par ldog pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye ba sgom pa dang / kun du brten pa sgom pa dang / spas  pa sgom pa dang / rnam par ldog pa sgom pa'o //
translated: cultivation of birth, cultivation of frequent practice, cultivation of superiority, and cultivation of reversal.

original: 'dir bcu gsum pas 'bras bu sems la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa srid pa tha ma lan bdun pa'o//
analyzed: 'dir bcu gsum pas 'bras bu sems la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa srid pa tha ma lan bdun pa'o//
translated: Here, the yogi who abides in the result of the stream-enterer, by the thirteenth, is the one with seven existences.

original: thog mtha' med pa'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las /
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las /
translated: From the beginningless and endless ocean of cyclic existence,

original: srid pa'i rten bdun phrag bzhi nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rten bdun phrag bzhi nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: it means the four sets of seven existences.

original: de la bdun phrag bzhi ni /
analyzed: de la bdun phrag bzhi ni /
translated: Here, the four sets of seven are:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mi'i srid pa bdun dang / mi'i bar gyi srid pa bdun dang / lha ru srid pa bdun dang / lha'i bar ma'i srid pa bdun no //
analyzed: mi'i srid pa bdun dang / mi'i bar gyi srid pa bdun dang / lha ru srid pa bdun dang / lha'i bar ma'i srid pa bdun no //
translated: seven human existences, seven intermediate existences as humans, seven divine existences, and seven intermediate existences as gods.

original: 'dir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu sems la /
analyzed: 'dir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu sems la /
translated: Here, the result of the stream-enterer, in the mind of the yogi who abides in the result,

original: 'bras bu bsdus pa bsam gtan gyi lam /
analyzed: 'bras bu bsdus pa bsam gtan gyi lam /
translated: is the path of concentration that includes the result.

original: zag pa med pa thob par gyur cing /
analyzed: zag pa med pa thob par gyur cing /
translated: One obtains the uncontaminated state.

original: de'i bcu gsum pa 'bras bu sems las pha rol du 'dod pas bsdus pa'i kun nas dkris pa skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: de'i bcu gsum pa 'bras bu sems las pha rol du 'dod pas bsdus pa'i kun nas dkris pa skye bar gyur na /
translated: If the fetters subsumed by the desire to transcend the result of the thirteenth stage arise,

original: gang las zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyi lam thob pa de 'gag go //
analyzed: gang las zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyi lam thob pa de 'gag go //
translated: then the path of uncontaminated meditative concentration that one obtained ceases.

original: cha shas lhag ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cha shas lhag ma ni ma yin no //
translated: The remaining parts do not.🔽Also, it is said:

original: yang / bsam gtan lam gyi 'bras thob pa //
analyzed: yang / bsam gtan lam gyi 'bras thob pa //
translated: One who obtains the result of the path of meditative concentration

original: nyams 'gyur 'dir yang 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: nyams 'gyur 'dir yang 'ga' zhig go //
translated: may experience a fall, and some will.

original: de la brten pa'i 'bras thob pa'i //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i 'bras thob pa'i //
translated: Based on that, one who obtains the result

original: nyon mongs skyed par byed pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs skyed par byed pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: generates afflictions.

original: 'dis ni lam rnam pa gnyis gsungs par 'gyur ba yin te /🔽'di ltar / zag pa dang @236a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam rnam pa gnyis gsungs par 'gyur ba yin te / 'di ltar / zag pa dang @236a * //
translated: This teaches that there are two types of paths:

original: bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: those with contamination and those without contamination.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Those with contamination are four:

original: 'di ltar / bzod pa spyad pa dang / ming gi 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bzod pa spyad pa dang / ming gi 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / chos mchog go //
translated: those who practice patience, those with the perception of names, those with the perception of signs, and those with the supreme dharma.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam ni gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam ni gnyis te /
translated: The uncontaminated path is two:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam ni sdug bsngal bden pa la sogs pa shes pa bcu gnyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam ni sdug bsngal bden pa la sogs pa shes pa bcu gnyis bshad zin to //
translated: The path of seeing is the twelve knowledges of the truths of suffering and so on.

original: bsgom pa'i lam bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam bshad par bya'o //
translated: The path of meditation will now be explained.

original: gal te de'i rjes su rnal 'byor pa bden pa mthong ba thob pa des /
analyzed: gal te de'i rjes su rnal 'byor pa bden pa mthong ba thob pa des /
translated: If yogis who have obtained the result of seeing the four truths

original: de bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba bag la nyal la sogs pa 'khor ba'i rgyu dang bcas pa rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba bag la nyal la sogs pa 'khor ba'i rgyu dang bcas pa rnams /
translated: abandon the entanglements and so on that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and so forth, along with the causes of samsara,🔽then what is the point of abandoning the entanglements and so on that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation?

original: 'dun pa chags pa spang ba dang yongs su shes pa'i spang ba dag gi rtsa ba med pas na ci byed ce na /
analyzed: 'dun pa chags pa spang ba dang yongs su shes pa'i spang ba dag gi rtsa ba med pas na ci byed ce na /
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation because they are the root of desire and attachment and the root of complete knowledge.

original: brjod de / ci srid du 'khor ba 'jug pa de srid du sdug bsngal 'jug go zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod de / ci srid du 'khor ba 'jug pa de srid du sdug bsngal 'jug go zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: As long as samsara continues, suffering continues.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pas bag la nyal la sogs pa rgyu dang bcas pa rnams spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pas bag la nyal la sogs pa rgyu dang bcas pa rnams spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are also causes of samsara. Therefore, in order to abandon the entanglements and so on that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, along with their causes,

original: mthong ba'i de kho na nyid yang dang yang du rtsol ba'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam goms pa'i don du rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i de kho na nyid yang dang yang du rtsol ba'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam goms pa'i don du rtsom pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is undertaken for the purpose of familiarization with the reality that has been seen, through the characteristic of repeated effort.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That path of cultivation is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / byang chub kyi yan lag las byung ba dang / byang chub kyi yan lag las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / byang chub kyi yan lag las byung ba dang / byang chub kyi yan lag las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: that which arises from the members of enlightenment and that which does not arise from the members of enlightenment.

original: de la gang bsgom pa'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i gzhan gang yang rung ba dang dmigs su 'dzin pa dang mngon par nges 'dzin dag gi brtsams pas skye ba de ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: de la gang bsgom pa'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i gzhan gang yang rung ba dang dmigs su 'dzin pa dang mngon par nges 'dzin dag gi brtsams pas skye ba de ni yan lag can no //
translated: That path of cultivation which arises through the practice of any of the four noble truths, which is the object of the path of cultivation, and which is undertaken through the apprehension of the object and the definite apprehension of the object, is that which arises from the members of enlightenment.

original: gang yang bsgom pa'i lam rags pa dang zhi ba'i rnam pa la sogs pas dmigs pa bsgom pa'i lam gang dag gi mtshan ma 'am yongs su dag pas mngon par nges 'dzin ni byang chub yan lag can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang bsgom pa'i lam rags pa dang zhi ba'i rnam pa la sogs pas dmigs pa bsgom pa'i lam gang dag gi mtshan ma 'am yongs su dag pas mngon par nges 'dzin ni byang chub yan lag can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That path of cultivation which is cultivated through the aspects of grossness and peacefulness, etc., and which is any path of cultivation that is undertaken through the apprehension of the object and the definite apprehension of the object by means of the signs or purification, is that which does not arise from the members of enlightenment.

original: de la thams cad zhen pa'i lam gyis kyang sems gsum nye bar bsams pas kun du sbyor ba spong ba'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad zhen pa'i lam gyis kyang sems gsum nye bar bsams pas kun du sbyor ba spong ba'o //
translated: The path of the complete abandonment of the fetters is the path of the complete abandonment of the fetters by the three thoughts of the path of the complete abandonment of the fetters.
