original: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa'i 'dod chags pa dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang bag la nyal min nyi shu'i mtshan nyid dag gi nyon mongs pa'i phung po kun du bzlums pa rnams /
analyzed: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa'i 'dod chags pa dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang bag la nyal min nyi shu'i mtshan nyid dag gi nyon mongs pa'i phung po kun du bzlums pa rnams /
translated: The aggregate of afflictions is the collection of the characteristics of the twenty afflictions of desire realm attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance, and the characteristics of the latent states that are not abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: lam gyi dbang gis cha bcur phye ba'i /
analyzed: lam gyi dbang gis cha bcur phye ba'i /
translated: By the power of the path, they are divided into ten parts.

original: cha dang po gsum spangs pa ni srid pa tha ma lan bdun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha dang po gsum spangs pa ni srid pa tha ma lan bdun par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abandoning the first three parts makes one a bhavāgraparama, one who has seven existences.

original: cha bzhi pa kun thob pa ni rigs nas rigs so //
analyzed: cha bzhi pa kun thob pa ni rigs nas rigs so //
translated: Obtaining the fourth part makes one a gotraparama, one who has one existence.

original: bzhi pa dang lnga pa spong zhing spangs pa ni rigs nas rigs kho na'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang lnga pa spong zhing spangs pa ni rigs nas rigs kho na'o //
translated: Abandoning the fourth and fifth parts makes one a gotraparama.

original: cha drug pa thob pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: cha drug pa thob pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Obtaining the sixth part makes one a once returner.

original: de'i tshe rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'gag pa'o //
translated: At that time, the result of stream entry is stopped.

original: cha bdun pa yang 'di nyid do //
analyzed: cha bdun pa yang 'di nyid do //
translated: The seventh part is also this.

original: cha phyi ma gsum spong ba ni sa bon gcig pa'o //
analyzed: cha phyi ma gsum spong ba ni sa bon gcig pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the three latter parts makes one a sakṛdāgāmin, a once returner.

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa kun du sbyor ba ma lus pa spangs pa ni gong du 'pho ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa kun du sbyor ba ma lus pa spangs pa ni gong du 'pho ba yin te /
translated: Abandoning all fetters subsumed by the desire realm makes one an ūrdhvaṃsrotas, one who goes to a higher realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The nonreturner who is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyis bsdus pa 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid thag la nyal dang / ma dad pa dang ngo tsha med pa sgyu dang g-yo dang mi brtan pa dang rgod pa dang bag med pa dang dregs pa dang kha zas kyis rgyags pa'i mtshan nyid bag la nyal min rnams kun nas bzlums te /
analyzed: gzugs kyis bsdus pa 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid thag la nyal dang / ma dad pa dang ngo tsha med pa sgyu dang g-yo dang mi brtan pa dang rgod pa dang bag med pa dang dregs pa dang kha zas kyis rgyags pa'i mtshan nyid bag la nyal min rnams kun nas bzlums te /
translated: The latent afflictions that are not included in the desire realm, such as attachment, pride, and ignorance, and the latent afflictions that are included in the form realm, such as sleep, faithlessness, shamelessness, deceit, guile, instability, excitation, carelessness, arrogance, and the characteristic of being intoxicated by food.

original: gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams sngon bzhin du rnam pa bcur bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams sngon bzhin du rnam pa bcur bya'o //
translated: The fetters that are included in the form realm should be understood in ten aspects, as before.

original: de la cha dang po gsum spangs pa ni gong du 'pho ba yin no //🔽cha gzhan gnyis spangs pa ni 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la cha dang po gsum spangs pa ni gong du 'pho ba yin no // cha gzhan gnyis spangs pa ni 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: Abandoning the first three aspects is the leap-over.🔽Abandoning the other two aspects is parinirvāṇa with exertion.

original: gzhan cha gnyis spangs pa ni 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan cha gnyis spangs pa ni 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Abandoning the other two aspects is parinirvāṇa without exertion.

original: gzhan yang cha gnyis spangs pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang cha gnyis spangs pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, those who have abandoned two parts are those who attain parinirvana after they are born.

original: cha bcu pa thob pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: cha bcu pa thob pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Those who obtain the tenth part are those who attain parinirvana in the intermediate state.

original: cha bcu pa bar du spangs pa ni khams gnyis la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: cha bcu pa bar du spangs pa ni khams gnyis la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Those who have abandoned the tenth part are nonreturners who are free from attachment to the two realms.

original: gzugs med pa yang 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid bag la nyal dang ma dad pa la sogs pa bdun dregs pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kun du sbyor ba rnams sngon bzhin du rnam pa bcur bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa yang 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid bag la nyal dang ma dad pa la sogs pa bdun dregs pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kun du sbyor ba rnams sngon bzhin du rnam pa bcur bya'o //
translated: The fetters in the formless realm should be understood as tenfold, as before, through the characteristics of attachment, pride, and ignorance, and the seven such as lack of faith, along with the characteristic of haughtiness.

original: gang zag kyang bzhi @237a * //
analyzed: gang zag kyang bzhi @237a * //
translated: There are also four types of persons:

original: ste ; bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ste ; bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba spangs pa'o //
translated: those who attain parinirvana in the intermediate state are excluded.

original: gal te gzugs med pa la chags bral bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med dam /
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa la chags bral bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med dam /
translated: If one is free from attachment to the formless realm, is there no attainment of parinirvana in the intermediate state?

original: med pa nyid de /
analyzed: med pa nyid de /
translated: There is none.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is said:

original: gzugs med khams su gzugs bral phyir //
analyzed: gzugs med khams su gzugs bral phyir //
translated: Because there is no form in the formless realm,

original: bgrod bya yul dag med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: bgrod bya yul dag med pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because there is no pure land to be traversed,

original: / bar ma'i srid pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / bar ma'i srid pa med pa'o //
translated: there is no intermediate existence.

original: des na bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: des na bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no parinirvana in the intermediate existence.🔽Moreover,

original: yang / gzugs kyi chags pa kun bral phyir //
analyzed: yang / gzugs kyi chags pa kun bral phyir //
translated: because of being free from attachment to form,

original: gzugs med pa la bar sred med //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la bar sred med //
translated: there is no intermediate existence in the formless realm.

original: gang dang de ru yod min pas //
analyzed: gang dang de ru yod min pas //
translated: Because it does not exist there,

original: mya ngan 'da' med par srid 'dir //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' med par srid 'dir // zhes gsungs so //
translated: there is no parinirvana in this existence.

original: spangs pa'i gang zag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: spangs pa'i gang zag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The classification of individuals who have abandoned

original: gzugs kyi khams ci bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ci bzhin no //
translated: is just like the form realm.

original: tha ma'i cha gsum ma ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha gsum ma ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The third part is the one who attains parinirvana after being born. This is the distinction.

original: 'dir bsgom pa'i lam gang zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa'i lam gang zhe na brjod de /
translated: Here, what is the path of cultivation? It is said:

original: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa chos rnams yongs su shes pa rnams //
analyzed: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa chos rnams yongs su shes pa rnams //
translated: Among them, the complete knowledges subsumed by the desire realm

original: de'i cha zag pa med pa rnams //
analyzed: de'i cha zag pa med pa rnams //
translated: and their uncontaminated aspects

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas yid la byed pa na /
translated: are mental engagements with impermanence and so on.

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation which are included in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i chos rnams yongs su shes pa rnams /
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i chos rnams yongs su shes pa rnams /
translated: The complete knowledges of the dharmas included in the formless realm.

original: de'i cha zag pa med pa rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de'i cha zag pa med pa rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas yid la byed pas /
translated: By means of the aspects of impermanence, etc., of the pure part of that,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa bsgom pas spong bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa bsgom pas spong bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: the abandonment of the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation which are included in the realms of desire and form.

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i chos rnams yongs su shes shing de bzhin du bsam pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs bsgom pas spong bar bya ba rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i chos rnams yongs su shes shing de bzhin du bsam pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs bsgom pas spong bar bya ba rnams spong ngo //
translated: The complete knowledges of the dharmas included in the formless realm. In the same way, by means of the aspects of the truths, the abandonment of the defilements of the three realms to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas bar chad med pa'i lam skye'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas bar chad med pa'i lam skye'o //
translated: The arising of the uninterrupted path by the abandonment of the defilements of the three realms.

original: 'dir bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Here, the yogi who is on the uninterrupted path is free from attachment to the three realms.

original: dgra bcom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he is not an arhat.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam 'gags pa na 'bras bu tha ma dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam 'gags pa na 'bras bu tha ma dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo //
translated: The path of immediate succession, which is the path of no-more-learning, is the last result, the state of Arhatship.🔽The Arhat is free from the passions of the three realms.

original: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba dgra bcom pa yin no dgra bcom pa de yang rnam pa drug yin te /
analyzed: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba dgra bcom pa yin no dgra bcom pa de yang rnam pa drug yin te /
translated: The Arhat is of six types:

original: 'di ltar / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa mi skyob pa dang / mngon du @237b byed pa'i skal pa can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa mi skyob pa dang / mngon du @237b byed pa'i skal pa can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: 1. the one who regresses, 2. the one who is intent on dwelling, 3. the one who is intent on guarding, 4. the one who is intent on declining, 5. the one who is intent on penetrating, 6. the steadfast one.

original: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni 'bras bu yongs su nyams pa'i skal pa can gang yin pa'o //🔽'chi bar sems pa'i skal pa can ni gang bdag nyid mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i skal pa can no //
analyzed: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni 'bras bu yongs su nyams pa'i skal pa can gang yin pa'o // 'chi bar sems pa'i skal pa can ni gang bdag nyid mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i skal pa can no //
translated: The one who regresses is the one who is susceptible to regression.

original: rjes su bsrung ba'i skal pa can ni gang 'bras bu rjes su bsrung ba'i skal pa can no //
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba'i skal pa can ni gang 'bras bu rjes su bsrung ba'i skal pa can no //
translated: The one who is intent on guarding is the one who is susceptible to losing his result.🔽The one who is intent on penetrating is the one who is susceptible to penetrating.

original: gnas par rtog pa ni gnas pa'i skal pa can mi nyams shing mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par rtog pa ni gnas pa'i skal pa can mi nyams shing mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating stability is one who is capable of penetrating stability, who does not regress and does not manifest.

original: mngon du byed pa'i skal pa can ni gang mi g-yo ba mngon du byed pa'i skal pa can no //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i skal pa can ni gang mi g-yo ba mngon du byed pa'i skal pa can no //
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating manifestation is one who is capable of penetrating manifestation.

original: mi g-yo ba ni gang gis mi skye ba'i ye shes skyed pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni gang gis mi skye ba'i ye shes skyed pa'o //
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating immovability is one who generates the knowledge of non-production.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de yang rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de yang rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: That one who is immovable is of three kinds, namely:

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang rgyal gyi byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang rgyal gyi byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: the enlightenment of the śrāvaka, the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddha, and the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gal te mi g-yo ba ji lta bu zhe na brjod de /🔽nyon mongs pa mi skye bar shes pa mi g-yo ba ni nyan thos kyi'o //
analyzed: gal te mi g-yo ba ji lta bu zhe na brjod de / nyon mongs pa mi skye bar shes pa mi g-yo ba ni nyan thos kyi'o //
translated: If one asks, “What is the immovable one like?” it is said:🔽The immovable knowledge of the non-production of afflictions is that of the śrāvaka.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang the tshom mi skye bar shes pa mi g-yo ba ni rang rgyal byang chub kyi'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang the tshom mi skye bar shes pa mi g-yo ba ni rang rgyal byang chub kyi'o //
translated: The immovable knowledge of the non-production of affliction and doubt is that of the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddha.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa the tshom mi skye bar shes pa mi g-yo ba de ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa the tshom mi skye bar shes pa mi g-yo ba de ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Blessed One is the Buddha, the unshakable one, who knows without doubt the afflictions in all their aspects.

original: de rnams la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa yin gyi dgra bcom gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa yin gyi dgra bcom gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the one who is subject to complete regression is the arhat who can regress from his result, but not the other arhats.

original: de yang rtogs pa'i khyad par las te snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las zhes brjod pa de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa'i khyad par las te snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las zhes brjod pa de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This regression is from the distinction of realization, from the distinction of meditative attainment, as it is said.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gang las kyang yongs su nyams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gang las kyang yongs su nyams pa ma yin te /
translated: The perfect Buddha does not regress from anything,

original: kun nas bsnyel ba med pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas bsnyel ba med pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not subject to complete forgetting.

original: gal te lung las 'bras bu bzhi brjod de /
analyzed: gal te lung las 'bras bu bzhi brjod de /
translated: The four results are mentioned in the scriptures.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of stream-enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the result of arhatship.

original: 'dir 'bras bu la mang du bshad pa 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu la mang du bshad pa 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Here, it is contradictory to explain many results.

original: brjod de / 'gal ba ni med de /
analyzed: brjod de / 'gal ba ni med de /
translated: There is no contradiction,

original: cig shos rnams ni 'bras bu bzhi yi khyad par yin 'dod pas //
analyzed: cig shos rnams ni 'bras bu bzhi yi khyad par yin 'dod pas //
translated: because the others are asserted to be the distinctions of the four results.

original: 'bras bu rnams ni mang por 'gyur min khyad par nyer skye nyid //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ni mang por 'gyur min khyad par nyer skye nyid //
translated: The results are not many, but distinctions arise.

original: ces so // gang gi tshe de lta na 'bras bu gang gi khyad par gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ces so // gang gi tshe de lta na 'bras bu gang gi khyad par gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the distinction of which result?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i khyad par ni rigs nas rigs so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i khyad par ni rigs nas rigs so //
translated: The distinction of stream entry is from lineage to lineage.

original: sa bon gcig pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'o //
analyzed: sa bon gcig pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'o //
translated: The distinction of once return is the same seed.

original: gzugs kyi khams su phyir mi @238a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su phyir mi @238a * //
translated: The distinction of nonreturn is not returning to the form realm.

original: 'ong ba'i khyad par lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'ong ba'i khyad par lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are five distinctions of nonreturn:

original: gong du 'pho ba dang / 'du byed dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba dang / 'du byed dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: those who migrate upward, those who attain nirvana through application, those who attain nirvana without application, those who attain nirvana after birth, and those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba spangs te bzhi po de nyid do zhes khyad par dgu'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba spangs te bzhi po de nyid do zhes khyad par dgu'o //
translated: The four who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, after birth, with application, and without application in the formless realm.

original: dgra bcom pa rnam pa drug ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnam pa drug ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: The six types of arhats are as before.

original: des na mthong lam gyi spang bya nyon mongs pa spangs pa la rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la khyad par med do /
analyzed: des na mthong lam gyi spang bya nyon mongs pa spangs pa la rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la khyad par med do /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between perfect buddhas and pratyekabuddhas in abandoning afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de srid du 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de srid du 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the order of the realization of the arya path.

original: rnal 'byor pa phyi rol gyi lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa phyogs gcig spangs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa phyi rol gyi lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa phyogs gcig spangs te /
translated: Yogis who have abandoned one part of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm by means of the external path

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas bcu gsum la 'bras bu'i sems la lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas bcu gsum la 'bras bu'i sems la lan cig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: and who have abandoned the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing by means of the path of seeing are once returners who attain the result of the path of meditation in thirteen moments.

original: phyogs 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rigs nas rigs su skye ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa dag ni med do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rigs nas rigs su skye ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa dag ni med do //
translated: In this case, there is no one who has entered the stream for the sake of the fruit of stream-enterer, nor one who has entered the stream from family to family.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma lus pa spangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma lus pa spangs te /
translated: Similarly, one who has abandoned all the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm,

original: de kho na bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas bcu gsum pa'i sems phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas bcu gsum pa'i sems phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the same way, having abandoned the defilements to be abandoned by the path of seeing, attains the state of non-returner with the thirteenth moment of mind.

original: phyogs 'di la lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang po sa bon gcig pa med do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang po sa bon gcig pa med do //
translated: In this case, there is no one who is a once-returner for the first time with a single seed.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams pa dang gzugs kyi khams pa dag gi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khams gnyis la chags bral du gyur pa nyid de kho na bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs nas bcu
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams pa dang gzugs kyi khams pa dag gi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas khams gnyis la chags bral du gyur pa nyid de kho na bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs nas bcu
translated: Similarly, one who has abandoned the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm and the form realm, and has become free from attachment to both realms, and in the same way, having abandoned the defilements to be abandoned by the path of seeing, attains the state of non-returner with the

original: gsum pa'i sems la phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa'i sems la phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: thirteenth moment of mind.

original: phyogs 'di la gzugs khams kyi phyir mi 'ong ba lnga po med do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la gzugs khams kyi phyir mi 'ong ba lnga po med do //
translated: In this regard, the five nonreturners of the form realm do not exist.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba spangs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba spangs te /
translated: The intermediate nirvana of the desire realm is eliminated.

original: lhag ma lus pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma lus pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba bzhi nyid do //
translated: The remaining four are the four nonreturners.

original: des na phyi rol gyi lam gyi khams gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi lam gyi khams gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the two realms of the external paths is the four.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong bar nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong bar nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the formless realm is not possible.

original: chos @238b de lta bu yin pas so //
analyzed: chos @238b de lta bu yin pas so //
translated: Because the Dharma is like that.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis ni khams gsum ka'i spong ba'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni lugs bzang po'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis ni khams gsum ka'i spong ba'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni lugs bzang po'o //
translated: The noble path is the abandonment of the three realms. This is the good system.

original: 'di ni de srid nyan thos kyi bsgom pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: 'di ni de srid nyan thos kyi bsgom pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the way of abandoning the afflictions of the śrāvaka path of meditation.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni yang phyi rol gyi lam gyi 'dod pa dang gzugs dag na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa nas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni yang phyi rol gyi lam gyi 'dod pa dang gzugs dag na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa nas /
translated: The vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas is as follows: Having abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the desire realm and in the form and formless realms,

original: de'i rjes su mthong bas spang ba nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthong bas spang ba nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: they subsequently abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams spangs te rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon du byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams spangs te rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon du byed do //
translated: Through the ārya path, they abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned in the formless realm and manifest the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ni bskal pa grangs med gsum du pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas dga' ldan du gnas pa la sogs pa bgyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ni bskal pa grangs med gsum du pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags nas dga' ldan du gnas pa la sogs pa bgyis te /
translated: The great bodhisattvas, having practiced the six perfections for three incalculable eons and accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, take birth in Tuṣita and so on.

original: byang chub snying po la zhugs te lha'i bu'i bdud btul nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rnam par gzigs nas /
analyzed: byang chub snying po la zhugs te lha'i bu'i bdud btul nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rnam par gzigs nas /
translated: They enter the essence of enlightenment, subdue the devaputra māra, and see the forward and reverse processes of dependent origination.

original: bzod pa spyad pa la sogs pa rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: bzod pa spyad pa la sogs pa rdzogs par byas te /
translated: They complete the practice of patience and so on.

original: khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas sems bcu gsum pa la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas sems bcu gsum pa la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing of the three realms, on the thirteenth moment of mind, one is free from attachment to the desire realm because one has abandoned the afflictions of the desire realm to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bcu bzhi pa la gzugs na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pas gzugs la chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa la gzugs na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pas gzugs la chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: On the fourteenth moment of mind, one is free from attachment to the form realm because one has abandoned the afflictions of the form realm to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sems bco lnga la gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spangs par bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pas gzugs med pa'i khams su chags pa dang bral ba bgyis nas ;
analyzed: sems bco lnga la gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spangs par bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs pas gzugs med pa'i khams su chags pa dang bral ba bgyis nas ;
translated: On the fifteenth moment of mind, one is free from attachment to the formless realm because one has abandoned the afflictions of the formless realm to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sems bcu drug pa ni brtsal bya yin pas lam mo //
analyzed: sems bcu drug pa ni brtsal bya yin pas lam mo //
translated: The sixteenth moment of mind is the path because it is the path of no more learning.

original: mi slob pa 'bras bu'i gnas skabs te rtogs pa'i khyad par thams cad thob pa dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mi slob pa 'bras bu'i gnas skabs te rtogs pa'i khyad par thams cad thob pa dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i sems so //
translated: The state of the result of no more learning is the attainment of all the distinctive realizations, the attainment of the state of an arhat, the sixteenth moment of mind.

original: de kun du sgrub pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de kun du sgrub pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: By practicing all of those, one becomes a perfect buddha.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bcu gnyis pa dang bcu gsum pa la sogs pa'i sems bzhi dang ste bcu drug gis sangs rgyas nyid du rnam par gnas so zhes so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bcu gnyis pa dang bcu gsum pa la sogs pa'i sems bzhi dang ste bcu drug gis sangs rgyas nyid du rnam par gnas so zhes so //
translated: The sixteen minds, such as the twelfth and thirteenth moments of understanding, are the abiding in buddhahood.🔽Also, it is said:

original: yang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: yang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The samādhi of the tathāgatas

original: rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi chas //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi chas //
translated: is the aspect of the vajra-like mind.

original: zag pa thams cad spong nus kyang //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad spong nus kyang //
translated: Although it is able to abandon all defilements,

original: mi srid phyir na de des min //🔽@239a * // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi srid phyir na de des min // @239a * // zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is impossible, so it is not that.

original: 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The tathāgatas possess the vajra-like samādhi.

original: sems kyi chas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems kyi chas zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “aspect of the mind”

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'i cha shas kyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sems kyi skye ba'i cha shas kyis so //
translated: refers to the aspect of the arising of the mind that possesses the vajra-like samādhi.

original: zag pa thams cad zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: “All defilements” refers to the afflictions.

original: nus zhes pa ni don byed pa'o //
analyzed: nus zhes pa ni don byed pa'o //
translated: “Able” means able to perform the function.

original: de des min zhes pa ni de lta mod kyi mi spong zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de des min zhes pa ni de lta mod kyi mi spong zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase “it is not that” means “it is not the case that it is not abandoned.”

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: Because it is impossible.🔽What is the meaning of “impossible”?

original: 'o na mi srid pa'i don gang zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: 'o na mi srid pa'i don gang zhe na brjod de /
translated: It is said:

original: gzhan gyis gzhan min goms pa las //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan min goms pa las //
translated: Because another does not abandon that which is not another,

original: gcig gi spong min khams gnyis kyi //
analyzed: gcig gi spong min khams gnyis kyi //
translated: one part does not abandon the two realms,

original: skal mi mnyam min de yi phyir //
analyzed: skal mi mnyam min de yi phyir //
translated: because they are not of the same realm.

original: sangs rgyas skad cig bcu drug nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skad cig bcu drug nyid //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha has only sixteen moments.

original: ces so // 'di'i don ni gang las gzhan gyis spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ces so // 'di'i don ni gang las gzhan gyis spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is that another does not abandon it.

original: de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis nus kyang gzhan gyi rgyud kyis nyon mongs pa sel ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis nus kyang gzhan gyi rgyud kyis nyon mongs pa sel ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān, although able, does not remove the afflictions of the continuum of another.

original: 'o na sems kyi cha shas gcig gis rang rgyud kyi sel lam zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: 'o na sems kyi cha shas gcig gis rang rgyud kyi sel lam zhe na brjod de /
translated: Well, does one part of the mind abandon it? It is said:

original: goms pa las gcig gis khams gnyis kyi spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa las gcig gis khams gnyis kyi spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of cultivation, one part does not abandon the two realms.

original: gang las goms pa yin kyang sems gcig gis khams gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba ni mi srid do //🔽de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyi /
analyzed: gang las goms pa yin kyang sems gcig gis khams gnyis kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba ni mi srid do // de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyi /
translated: But it is impossible for a single mind to abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation of both realms, no matter what realm the mind belongs to.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa ste mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa ste mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spong ba ni mi srid do //
translated: Similarly, it is impossible for the path of meditation to abandon afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because it is impossible.

original: sangs rgyas nyid skad cig bcu drug ste bcu gsum pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid skad cig bcu drug ste bcu gsum pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Buddhahood is not the thirteenth moment of the sixteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: 'o na mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang phyi rol gyi lam gyis spong ngam zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: 'o na mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang phyi rol gyi lam gyis spong ngam zhe na brjod de /
translated: But is it possible to abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing by a path of the desire realm?

original: 'phags pa ni lam gnyis ka dang 'dod pas bsdus pa dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni lam gnyis ka dang 'dod pas bsdus pa dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'o //
translated: Aryas abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that are subsumed by the desire realm and the form realm by both paths.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa yang phyi rol gyi lam gyi 'dod pas bsdus pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa yang phyi rol gyi lam gyi 'dod pas bsdus pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'o //
translated: Also, non-noble persons abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation that are included in the desire realm and objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation that are included in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not abandon objects to be abandoned by the formless realm

original: de ni 'phags pa'i lam nyid kyis spang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i lam nyid kyis spang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are abandoned by the ārya path alone.

original: 'o na phyi dang 'phags pa'i lam dag rnam pa'i khyad par gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na phyi dang 'phags pa'i lam dag rnam pa'i khyad par gang zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the aspects of the external path and the ārya path?

original: brjod de / zhi ba dang rags pa'i rnam pa ni phyi rol gyi lam mo //
analyzed: brjod de / zhi ba dang rags pa'i rnam pa ni phyi rol gyi lam mo //
translated: They are stated: The external path has the aspects of peace and coarseness.

original: 'di ltar / 'dod pa'i khams ni rags pa'o @239b zhes pa ni rags pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod pa'i khams ni rags pa'o @239b zhes pa ni rags pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Thus the desire realm is coarse is the aspect of coarseness.🔽The form realm is peaceful is the aspect of peace.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni zhi ba'o zhes pa ni zhi ba'i rnam pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste phyi rol gyi lam la rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni zhi ba'o zhes pa ni zhi ba'i rnam pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste phyi rol gyi lam la rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: There are many aspects of the external path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /
translated: The ārya path has four aspects:

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: impermanence, and definite release.

original: 'di ni de ma thag tu spros pa dang bcas te bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni de ma thag tu spros pa dang bcas te bshad zin to //
translated: This has just been explained in detail.🔽Faith, effort, mindfulness, wisdom,

original: yang / dad brtson dran pa shes rab dang // ting 'dzin la sogs sngon 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yang / dad brtson dran pa shes rab dang // ting 'dzin la sogs sngon 'gro ba'o //
translated: concentration, etc. are its prerequisites.

original: lam ni zag pa kun spong ba //
analyzed: lam ni zag pa kun spong ba //
translated: The path is the relinquishing of all defilements.

original: gang gis stong pa'i phyir rgol rnams //
analyzed: gang gis stong pa'i phyir rgol rnams //
translated: By which the opponents are emptied.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i lam 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i lam 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: This path is the noble path.

original: gang gis zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: By which means by the noble path.

original: stong pa zhes pa ni ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes pa ni ma tshang ba'o //
translated: Emptied means incomplete.

original: phyir rgol zhes pa ni phyi rol pa'i grol bas mngon par nga rgyal ba dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / drang srong byas dang ba shi sta la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyir rgol zhes pa ni phyi rol pa'i grol bas mngon par nga rgyal ba dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / drang srong byas dang ba shi sta la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Opponents means the liberated ones who are proud, such as Īśvara, and the liberated sages such as Kapila and Uluka.

original: de ltar yang lam rnam pa gnyis kyis kyang 'dod khams la chags pa dang bral ba ni gzugs khams thams cad du skye ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang lam rnam pa gnyis kyis kyang 'dod khams la chags pa dang bral ba ni gzugs khams thams cad du skye ste /
translated: Thus, one who is free from attachment to the desire realm through either of the two paths is born in all the form realms.

original: tshangs pa chen po dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni ma gtogs so //
translated: However, one is not born in the heaven of Mahabrahma or among the beings of the base of nothingness.

original: 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba de nyid gang gang gi tshe gzugs khams la chags pa dang bral ba thob pa de'i tshe gzugs med pa'i khams su nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa phyir mi 'ong ba de nyid gang gang gi tshe gzugs khams la chags pa dang bral ba thob pa de'i tshe gzugs med pa'i khams su nye bar skye'o //
translated: When a noble nonreturner obtains freedom from attachment to the form realm, he is born in the formless realm.

original: 'o na gzugs med pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'phags pa 'di ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs med pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'phags pa 'di ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is an ārya free from attachment to the formless realm?🔽It is said:

original: brjod de / de ltar yang rab tu 'bar ba'i lcags kyi gong bu ni shin tu ches che ba'i bud shing du bcug pa na /
analyzed: brjod de / de ltar yang rab tu 'bar ba'i lcags kyi gong bu ni shin tu ches che ba'i bud shing du bcug pa na /
translated: Thus, when a mass of burning iron is placed in a very large amount of firewood,

original: bud shing de rnams ma lus par bsregs te thal bar gyur pa yang bud shing gi kun du tshang ba nyid rim gyis bsil bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud shing de rnams ma lus par bsregs te thal bar gyur pa yang bud shing gi kun du tshang ba nyid rim gyis bsil bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the firewood is completely burned and becomes ash, but the mass of burning iron gradually cools through the gradual exhaustion of the firewood.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa nyan thos lcags kyi gong bu /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa nyan thos lcags kyi gong bu /
translated: Likewise, the noble listeners are like a mass of iron

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi me kun du 'bar ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi me kun du 'bar ba /
translated: that is completely ablaze with the fire of the path, such as the Dharma knowledge of suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing phung po ches yang che ba mthong ba bsgom pas spang bar bya bar bcug pa na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing phung po ches yang che ba mthong ba bsgom pas spang bar bya bar bcug pa na /
translated: When they put into it the very large logs of the afflictions that are the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and meditation,

original: de rnams ma lus pa mthar thug pa bsregs nas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing rab tu zhi ba yang kun du 'bar ba nyid phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gnas pa mi slob pa'i lam gyi me'i lhag ma yin pas🔽so // rim gyis las kyi rnam par smin pa ma lus pa nye bar longs spyod nas rang gi lus bor te phung @240a * //
analyzed: de rnams ma lus pa mthar thug pa bsregs nas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing rab tu zhi ba yang kun du 'bar ba nyid phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gnas pa mi slob pa'i lam gyi me'i lhag ma yin pas so // rim gyis las kyi rnam par smin pa ma lus pa nye bar longs spyod nas rang gi lus bor te phung @240a * //
translated: they completely burn up all those afflictions and the fire of the path of no more learning remains in the expanse of nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates, the complete pacification of the fuel of the afflictions.

original: po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bgrod pas bsil bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bgrod pas bsil bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In this way, they gradually consume all the karmic ripening of their karma, abandon their bodies and proceed to the nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates.

original: rab tu 'bar ba'i lcags gong bzhin //
analyzed: rab tu 'bar ba'i lcags gong bzhin //
translated: They become cool, like a mass of iron🔽that is completely ablaze

original: nyon mongs bud shing kun bsregs pas //
analyzed: nyon mongs bud shing kun bsregs pas //
translated: when it burns up all the fuel of the afflictions.

original: dgra bcom lhag bcas la gnas pa //
analyzed: dgra bcom lhag bcas la gnas pa //
translated: The arhat who remains with residual aggregates

original: rim gyis bsil bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rim gyis bsil bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: is gradually cooled.

original: de tshe phung po med pa yi'ang //
analyzed: de tshe phung po med pa yi'ang //
translated: Even when there are no aggregates,

original: de yi sngon ma'ang 'gag 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi sngon ma'ang 'gag 'gyur te //
translated: his previous aggregates cease.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan ni mi skye ste //🔽rgyu rnams yang dag zad phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan ni mi skye ste // rgyu rnams yang dag zad phyir ro //
translated: Other suffering does not arise

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: because its causes are completely exhausted.

original: gal te gang gi tshe de ltar phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa na /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe de ltar phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa na /
translated: If one attains the realm of nirvana without residual aggregates in this way,

original: ci lha 'am mi 'am gzhan zhes ci ltar tha snyad bya zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: ci lha 'am mi 'am gzhan zhes ci ltar tha snyad bya zhe na brjod de /
translated: how can one be called a god, a human, or something else?

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams rab tu zhi bas nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba drug tu gnas pa med do //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams rab tu zhi bas nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba drug tu gnas pa med do //
translated: Because the causes of suffering are completely pacified, there are no residual aggregates, and since there is no appropriation, there is no abiding in the six kinds of beings.

original: 'gro ba med pas tha snyad thams cad ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pas tha snyad thams cad ldog pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no transmigration, all conventions cease.

original: lha dang mi zhes pa la sogs pa tha snyad kyi rten ni 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: lha dang mi zhes pa la sogs pa tha snyad kyi rten ni 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The basis of conventions such as god and human is transmigration.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad med pa 'di'am gzhan zhes pa'i tha snyad ni 'gro ba 'di las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad med pa 'di'am gzhan zhes pa'i tha snyad ni 'gro ba 'di las ldog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the conventional expressions “all beings” and “this or that” are the opposite of “this being.”

original: dper na me'i sreg byed la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyi rten ni bud shing ngo //
analyzed: dper na me'i sreg byed la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyi rten ni bud shing ngo //
translated: For example, the basis of all conventional expressions such as “the burning of fire” is fuel.

original: de bzhin du nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i gang zag la tha snyad thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i gang zag la tha snyad thams cad yin no //
translated: In the same way, all conventional expressions are in regard to the person who has appropriation,

original: nye bar len pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not in regard to the person who is without appropriation.🔽Moreover, it is said:

original: yang / tha snyad bya ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: yang / tha snyad bya ba ma lus pa //
translated: All conventional expressions

original: de yi rten ni 'gro dngos so //
analyzed: de yi rten ni 'gro dngos so //
translated: are in regard to the entity of beings.

original: 'gro ba med phyir ldog pa ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba med phyir ldog pa ste //
translated: Because there are no beings, there is cessation,

original: bud shing zad pa'i me bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bud shing zad pa'i me bzhin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: like the fire when the fuel is exhausted.

original: 'di ltar yang de nyid kyis na 'di ni gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang de nyid kyis na 'di ni gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not to be expressed as either the same or different.

original: sems can ma yin sems can ma yin pa ma yin thams cad du grangs las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ma yin sems can ma yin pa ma yin thams cad du grangs las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is not a sentient being, but not not a sentient being, and is beyond all enumeration.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la thams cad du tha snyad med pa ci zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la thams cad du tha snyad med pa ci zhe na brjod de /
translated: But why is it that all conventions are absent in nirvana?

original: tha snyad yod de /
analyzed: tha snyad yod de /
translated: They are present.

original: 'on kyang nye bar len pa'i tha snyad kyis tha snyad byar med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar len pa'i tha snyad kyis tha snyad byar med do //
translated: But they are not present by way of the convention of appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i tha snyad kyis tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i tha snyad kyis tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: They are present by way of the convention of nonappropriation.

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i tha snyad ni gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i tha snyad ni gsungs te /
translated: The convention of nonappropriation is taught.🔽And that is stated:

original: de yang / grol ba zhi ba bdud rtsi son //
analyzed: de yang / grol ba zhi ba bdud rtsi son //
translated: Liberation, peace, immortality,

original: skyon med yongs su mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: skyon med yongs su mya ngan 'das //
translated: faultless, complete nirvana,

original: sangs rgyas bde gshegs skyob pa rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bde gshegs skyob pa rnams //
translated: the buddhas, the sugatas, the protectors,

original: de tshe brjod kyi gzhan du min //
analyzed: de tshe brjod kyi gzhan du min //
translated: are then said to be, but not otherwise.

original: zhes so // 'dir mdor bsdus nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir mdor bsdus nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, in brief, afflictions are of two kinds:

original: bag la nyal dang / bag la nyal ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang / bag la nyal ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that are latent and those that are not latent.

original: de @240b la bag la nyal ci lta bu bag la nyal ma yin pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de @240b la bag la nyal ci lta bu bag la nyal ma yin pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What is a latent affliction? What is not a latent affliction?🔽It is stated:

original: brjod de / rlan can rab kyi rdul bzhin du //
analyzed: brjod de / rlan can rab kyi rdul bzhin du //
translated: Like a wet spot on a cloth,

original: bag la nyal 'di rnams khams gsum du shin tu brtan par rjes su thim zhing 'brel par 'gyur bas bag la nyal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bag la nyal 'di rnams khams gsum du shin tu brtan par rjes su thim zhing 'brel par 'gyur bas bag la nyal zhes brjod do //
translated: These latent states are called latent because they are very stable in the three realms and they are related to the mind.🔽

original: yang / khams gsum du bag la nyal dang // 'brel phyir bag la nyal zhes brjod //
analyzed: yang / khams gsum du bag la nyal dang // 'brel phyir bag la nyal zhes brjod //
translated: These latent states are called latent because they are very stable in the three realms and they are connected with the three realms.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And also:🔽Because they are connected with the three realms, they are called latent.

original: bag la nyal ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Nonlatent states are the very afflictions themselves.

original: kun nas dkris pa tsam yin pas //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa tsam yin pas //
translated: They are merely entanglements.

original: de bzhin du bag la nyal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bag la nyal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not latent states in the same way.

original: de'i phyir bag la nyal ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bag la nyal ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called nonlatent.

original: bag la nyal ni yang gang las de bzhin du rjes su nyal zhing zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni yang gang las de bzhin du rjes su nyal zhing zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Latent states are so called because they lie hidden and are the cause of the arising, endurance, and increase of contaminated entities.

original: des na de ni rnam pa gnyis yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: des na de ni rnam pa gnyis yin te 'di ltar /
translated: Thus, they are of two kinds:

original: sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: those associated with mind and those not associated with mind.

original: yang / de ni sems dang ldan pa dang // mi ldan dag tu shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang / de ni sems dang ldan pa dang // mi ldan dag tu shes par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It should be understood that it is associated with mind and not associated with mind.

original: 'o na sems dang ldan pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems dang ldan pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “associated with mind”?

original: brjod de / dper na grog mkhar gyi brten pa'i mtha' ni rnam par brten pa sbyang dka' ba grog ma rnams kyi gnas rang gi mkhar mtho ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: brjod de / dper na grog mkhar gyi brten pa'i mtha' ni rnam par brten pa sbyang dka' ba grog ma rnams kyi gnas rang gi mkhar mtho ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: For example, the base of the ant-hill is the cause of the high ant-hill, which is the abode of the ants that depend on it.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal ni /
translated: In the same way, the latent impressions of beings

original: de ni rnam par brten pa sbyang dka' ba nyes pa 'byung ba rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par brten pa sbyang dka' ba nyes pa 'byung ba rnams kyi sa bon du gyur pa'o //
translated: are the seeds of the arising of faults, which are difficult to eliminate.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa can spangs pa ma yin pa'i sems kyang brgyal ba dang gnyid mthug po log pa yang sems med pa'i gnyid kyis non pa yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs pa yang 'du shes med pa'i sems can kyang 'du shes
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa can spangs pa ma yin pa'i sems kyang brgyal ba dang gnyid mthug po log pa yang sems med pa'i gnyid kyis non pa yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs pa yang 'du shes med pa'i sems can kyang 'du shes
translated: Even though the mind that is not abandoned by those who are afflicted is also unconscious, deeply asleep, and oppressed by unconscious sleep, it is also the attainment of the meditative absorption of non-perception, and the sentient beings of the state of non-perception are also unconscious.

original: dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa yang /
analyzed: dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa yang /
translated: Also, the meditative attainment of the cessation of discriminations and feelings

original: de rnams ni mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal dang bcas pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams ni mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal dang bcas pa yin par bshad do //
translated: is explained as possessing the latent states of those.

original: dper na grog mkhar rnams kyi rtse mo ni rnam par mi brten pa sbyang sla ba rang gi rten las kun du bzhengs pa de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa'i bag la nyal lam /
analyzed: dper na grog mkhar rnams kyi rtse mo ni rnam par mi brten pa sbyang sla ba rang gi rten las kun du bzhengs pa de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa'i bag la nyal lam /
translated: For example, the peak of an anthill is not firm, is easy to destroy, and rises up from its own support.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan nam nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par mi rtag pa kun du spyod pa tsam dang sbyang sla ba rang gi rten du rtogs pa'i sa bon du gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan nam nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par mi rtag pa kun du spyod pa tsam dang sbyang sla ba rang gi rten du rtogs pa'i sa bon du gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, latent states that are concomitant with the mind, or other afflictions, or branch afflictions, and so on, should be understood as not firm, as mere engagement, and as easy to destroy, existing as seeds in their own support.🔽Moreover, it is said:

original: yang / mi ldan pa yi lhag brten don //🔽grog mkhar rnams kyi steng bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: yang / mi ldan pa yi lhag brten don // grog mkhar rnams kyi steng bzhin 'dod //
translated: The meaning of the support of nonpossession

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽de @241a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de @241a * //
translated: is asserted to be like the top of an anthill.🔽Thus,

original: bzhin du / ldan pa kun du spyod pa tsam //
analyzed: bzhin du / ldan pa kun du spyod pa tsam //
translated: mere engagement that is concomitant

original: go bya grog mkhar cog bzhin no //
analyzed: go bya grog mkhar cog bzhin no //
translated: is like the top of an anthill.

original: zhes so // gal te de ltar mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal ni rtag tu yod pa nyid yin na ci kun nas dkris pa rtag tu 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // gal te de ltar mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal ni rtag tu yod pa nyid yin na ci kun nas dkris pa rtag tu 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the latent state of non-possession is always present, why do the entanglements not always occur?🔽It is said:

original: brjod de / nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: brjod de / nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: There are three causes of the defilements:

original: yul dang / yul can phrad pa dang // mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang / yul can phrad pa dang // mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: the object, the contact of the object with the subject, and the non-abandoning of the latent state of non-possession, and the incorrect mental orientation.

original: gang las 'di gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu tshang ba'o //
analyzed: gang las 'di gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu tshang ba'o //
translated: From these three, the causes of the defilements are complete.

original: rgyu rnams kyi tshogs pa ni res 'ga' ba yin pas kun nas dkris pa dus thams cad du 'byung ba ma yin no //🔽yang / yul ni yul can gyis thob dang // mi ldan bag la nyal rten dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed dang // gsum ni nyon mongs rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi tshogs pa ni res 'ga' ba yin pas kun nas dkris pa dus thams cad du 'byung ba ma yin no // yang / yul ni yul can gyis thob dang // mi ldan bag la nyal rten dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed dang // gsum ni nyon mongs rgyu yin no //
translated: Since the collection of causes is sometimes incomplete, the entanglements do not occur at all times.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The object, the attainment of the object by the subject, the support of the latent state of non-possession, and the incorrect mental orientation, these three are the causes of the defilements.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i lam mam phyi rol gyi lam gyis /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i lam mam phyi rol gyi lam gyis /
translated: If the noble path or the external path

original: ci mtshungs par ldan pa spong ngam mi ldan pa spong zhe na brjod de /
analyzed: ci mtshungs par ldan pa spong ngam mi ldan pa spong zhe na brjod de /
translated: Do they abandon that which is associated or that which is not associated?

original: mi ldan pa rnams spong ste ;
analyzed: mi ldan pa rnams spong ste ;
translated: They abandon that which is not associated.

original: ldan pa'i sa bon gyi gnas yin pa dang / sgrub dka' ba'i phyir dang rnam par brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sa bon gyi gnas yin pa dang / sgrub dka' ba'i phyir dang rnam par brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is associated is the seed of the basis and is difficult to establish and is firm.

original: de rnams spangs pa las mtshungs par ldan pa nyid spong ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams spangs pa las mtshungs par ldan pa nyid spong ba'o //
translated: From the abandonment of those, that which is associated is abandoned.

original: sa bon zad pa las myu gu rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon zad pa las myu gu rnams bzhin no //
translated: Like sprouts from the exhaustion of seeds.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa'i lung gi tshul las 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa'i lung gi tshul las 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig
translated: The twenty-first chapter, called the ascertainment of the noble truths, is completed from the chapter on scriptural exegesis of the Saṃmatīya school in the Ascertainment of the Compounded and Uncompounded.

original: pa'o / // / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i lam rab tu dbye ba ni mang ste /
analyzed: pa'o / // / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i lam rab tu dbye ba ni mang ste /
translated: The division of the path of the bodhisattva vehicle is manifold.

original: 'di ltar / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stong pa nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stong pa nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: Thus, the perfections, the factors of enlightenment, emptiness, the meditative stabilizations, the formless meditative attainments, the eight liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: zil gyis gnon pa rnams dang / zad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ye shes dang / dbang po rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / nor rnams dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / spyan rnams dang /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa rnams dang / zad pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ye shes dang / dbang po rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / nor rnams dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / spyan rnams dang /
translated: the overpowerings, the totalities, the concentrations, the awarenesses, the faculties, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the riches, the discriminations, the eyes,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / gzugs dang / dbang du gyur pa la sogs pa rnams dang / tshor ba sems pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed do //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed @241b pa dang / 'dun pa dang / lhag par mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed @241b pa dang / 'dun pa dang / lhag par mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang /
translated: perception, volition, contact, mental attention, aspiration, resolve, faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / ye shes dang / bzod pa rnams te 'di dag la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa ni drug ste /
translated: The perfections are six in number.

original: 'di ltar / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /

translated: the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of meditative concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //

analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan gnyis las sbyin pa 'byung ste /

analyzed: rgyu bzhis sbyin pa ngan par 'gyur te /
translated: Generosity is bad for four reasons:🔽thus,🔽generosity for the sake of gain,🔽generosity for the sake of fear,

translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of generosity:🔽thus,🔽incorrect generosity

original: de la yongs su bsngo ba rnam pa gnyis kyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni thar pa ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su bsngo ba rnam pa gnyis kyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni thar pa ste /
translated: The result of generosity is liberation, since it is completely dedicated in two ways.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du bsngos pa dang / sems can gyi don du bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du bsngos pa dang / sems can gyi don du bsngos pa'o //
translated: The result of generosity is liberation, because it is dedicated to nirvana and to the benefit of sentient beings.

original: rgyu brgyad kyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu brgyad kyis sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen por 'gyur te /
translated: The result of generosity is great wealth, for eight reasons:

original: 'di ltar / zhing dang / dngos po dang / yid la byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / @242a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / zhing dang / dngos po dang / yid la byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / @242a * //
translated: field, thing, mental activity, attitude,

original: de las gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rten dang / mang du byed pa dang / skye bo mang po las so //
analyzed: de las gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rten dang / mang du byed pa dang / skye bo mang po las so //
translated: taking hold of something else, basis, making much of it, and many people.

original: de la zhing zhes pa la khyad par bzhis 'bras bu longs spyod chen po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la zhing zhes pa la khyad par bzhis 'bras bu longs spyod chen po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The field is superior in four ways, and the result is great wealth:

original: 'di ltar / 'gro ba'i khyad par dang / sdug bsngal gyi khyad par dang / phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi khyad par dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'gro ba'i khyad par dang / sdug bsngal gyi khyad par dang / phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi khyad par dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: superiority of the world, superiority of suffering, superiority of benefit, and superiority of qualities.

original: de la 'gro ba'i khyad ni mang ste /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'i khyad ni mang ste /
translated: The superiority of the world is great,

original: 'di ltar / dud 'gro la byin pas brgya 'gyur dang / tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur pa'i mi la byin pas stong 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dud 'gro la byin pas brgya 'gyur dang / tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur pa'i mi la byin pas stong 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is a hundred times better to give to an animal than to a person who has broken ethical discipline, and a thousand times better to give to a person who has not broken ethical discipline than to a person who has broken ethical discipline.

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par gyis 'bras bu longs spyod chen por 'gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par gyis 'bras bu longs spyod chen por 'gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan ni /
translated: The reason for the great enjoyment that results from the particular suffering is🔽the seven bases of meritorious action that arise from giving things that are superior.

original: nye bar lhag pa'i dngos po las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun te /
analyzed: nye bar lhag pa'i dngos po las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bdun te /
translated: They are:

original: 'di ltar / phyogs bzhi'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi ched du kun dga' ra ba rtsom pa dang / kun dga' ra ba der gtsug lag khang bzhengs pa dang / gtsug lag khang der nyal stan khri stan sbyin pa dang / gtsug lag khang der rtag tu zas sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / phyogs bzhi'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi ched du kun dga' ra ba rtsom pa dang / kun dga' ra ba der gtsug lag khang bzhengs pa dang / gtsug lag khang der nyal stan khri stan sbyin pa dang / gtsug lag khang der rtag tu zas sbyin pa dang /
translated: to begin a monastery for the sake of the Saṅgha of monks in the four directions; to build a temple in that monastery; to give a bed and a seat in that temple; to give food constantly in that temple;

original: gtsug lag khang der 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i don du sbyin pa dang / gtsug lag khang der dge slong nad pa'i phyir ram nad pa'i nye gnas kyi phyir sbyin pa dang / gtsug lag khang der bsil dus dang sprin khebs dus sam /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i don du sbyin pa dang / gtsug lag khang der dge slong nad pa'i phyir ram nad pa'i nye gnas kyi phyir sbyin pa dang / gtsug lag khang der bsil dus dang sprin khebs dus sam /
translated: Giving for the sake of coming to and going from that monastery;🔽giving for the sake of the monks in that monastery, either for the sick or for the attendants of the sick;🔽giving in that monastery of food, etc. , in the cold season, in the rainy season,

original: rlung gi dus sam char gyi dus su zas la sogs pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dus sam char gyi dus su zas la sogs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: in the windy season, and in the hot season.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par ni gsum ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par ni gsum ste /
translated: The difference in benefit is threefold:

original: 'di ltar / ma dang / pha dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma dang / pha dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: thus, benefitting one's mother, benefitting one's father, and benefitting others.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par ni brgyad de 'di ltar /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par ni brgyad de 'di ltar /
translated: The difference in virtue is eightfold:

original: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / slob bzhin ma dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang ; bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa can no //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / slob bzhin ma dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang ; bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa can no //
translated: thus, the virtue of the male and female lay practitioners, the virtue of the male and female novices, the virtue of the female probationers, the virtue of the monks, the virtue of the nuns, and the virtue of the one-day vow-holders.

original: yon tan can sbyin gnas kyi zhib ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yon tan can sbyin gnas kyi zhib ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The difference in the field of merit is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / gang zag khyad par can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / gang zag khyad par can no //
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Dharma, the noble Sangha, and the special person.

original: dngos po zhes pa dngos po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes pa dngos po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The thing is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / dngos po gya nom pa dang / dngos po rab tu mang po ;
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po gya nom pa dang / dngos po rab tu mang po ;
translated: Thus, the excellent thing and the very abundant thing.

original: yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, it is fivefold:

original: 'di ltar / mdog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa dang / reg bya phun sum tshogs pa dang / dus su bde bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mdog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa dang / reg bya phun sum tshogs pa dang / dus su bde bar byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, excellent color, excellent smell, excellent taste, excellent touch, and timely pleasure.

original: yid la byed pa las 'bras bu longs spyod chen po ni lnga ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa las 'bras bu longs spyod chen po ni lnga ste /
translated: The result of great enjoyment from attention is fivefold:

original: dad pas sbyin pa dang / dam par byed pas sbyin @242b pa dang / rang gi lag nas ster ba dang / dus su sbyin pa dang / nye bar gnod pa med par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas sbyin pa dang / dam par byed pas sbyin @242b pa dang / rang gi lag nas ster ba dang / dus su sbyin pa dang / nye bar gnod pa med par sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving with faith, giving with respect, giving with one's own hands, giving at the right time, and giving without harming others.

original: bsam pa las 'bras bu longs spyod chen po ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam pa las 'bras bu longs spyod chen po ni gnyis te /
translated: The result of great enjoyment from intention is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: Thus, generosity is superior when it is practiced with the intention of attaining nirvana and when it is dedicated to the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: 'di las gzhan sbyin pa dman pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan sbyin pa dman pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Generosity is inferior when it is of two types:

original: 'di ltar / bde 'gro'i don du sbyin pa dang // longs spyod kyi ched du sbyin pa'o //🔽de las gzhan yongs su 'dzin pas sbyin pa ni /🔽dper na sbyin byed tshul khrims dang ldan pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bde 'gro'i don du sbyin pa dang // longs spyod kyi ched du sbyin pa'o // de las gzhan yongs su 'dzin pas sbyin pa ni / dper na sbyin byed tshul khrims dang ldan pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity for the sake of a happy rebirth and generosity for the sake of wealth.🔽Generosity is not fully engaged when it is of two types:

original: brten nas sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: brten nas sbyin pa ni /
translated: generosity that is given with a sense of ownership, for example, when a generous person gives a gift,

original: dper na sbyin byed 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis chags bral du gyur pas sbyin pa'o //🔽lan mang du byed pas sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dper na sbyin byed 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis chags bral du gyur pas sbyin pa'o // lan mang du byed pas sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
translated: generosity that is given with a sense of dependence, for example, when a generous person gives a gift because he or she has attained freedom from attachment by means of the worldly path,

original: 'di ltar / gang gi tshe yang dang yang du goms pas sbyin pa dang / yang dang yang du rjes su rnam par brtags te sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang gi tshe yang dang yang du goms pas sbyin pa dang / yang dang yang du rjes su rnam par brtags te sbyin pa'o //
