translated: generosity that is given with a sense of repetition, for example, when a generous person gives a gift because he or she has given gifts repeatedly in the past,

original: skye bo mang po la sbyin pa ni gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la sbyin pa ni gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: generosity that is given with a sense of the multitude, for example, when a generous person gives a gift to many people,

original: rang rigs byas pa'i sbyin pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rang rigs byas pa'i sbyin pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity that one does oneself and generosity that one induces others to do.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i bye brag rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i bye brag rnams so //
translated: These are the different kinds of generosity.

original: yang sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: Moreover, generosity is threefold:

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity of material things, generosity of safety, and generosity of the Dharma.

original: 'di rnams su thabs kyi sbyin pa dang / mkhas pa'i sbyin pa dag bsdus te sbyin pa rnam pa lnga zhes gzhan dag go ;
analyzed: 'di rnams su thabs kyi sbyin pa dang / mkhas pa'i sbyin pa dag bsdus te sbyin pa rnam pa lnga zhes gzhan dag go ;
translated: Others say that these include the generosity of skillful means and the generosity of expertise, and so generosity is fivefold.

original: / de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: / de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The generosity of material things is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / don sbyin pa dang / don mchog sbyin pa dang / yan lag sbyin pa dang / yan lag mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don sbyin pa dang / don mchog sbyin pa dang / yan lag sbyin pa dang / yan lag mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity of material things that are useful, generosity of material things that are the best, generosity of body parts, and generosity of one’s life.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rnam gsum ste /
translated: The generosity of the Dharma is threefold:

original: 'di ltar / chos ston pa dang / thabs bshad pa dang / mkhas par bya ba la gzhan sbyor ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos ston pa dang / thabs bshad pa dang / mkhas par bya ba la gzhan sbyor ba'o ;
translated: teaching the Dharma, explaining the skillful means, and applying oneself to expertise.

original: / sbyin bya ma yin pa'i dngos po ni gsum ste /
analyzed: / sbyin bya ma yin pa'i dngos po ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three things that should not be given:

original: 'di ltar / chang dang / dug dang / mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chang dang / dug dang / mtshon cha'o //
translated: alcohol, poison, and weapons.

original: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Morality is of two kinds:🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / lus kyi dang / ngag gi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lus kyi dang / ngag gi'o //
translated: of the body and of speech.

original: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Of these, the bodily is of three kinds:🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: turning away from killing, turning away from taking what is not given, and turning away from sexual misconduct.🔽The verbal is of four kinds:

original: ngag gi las la rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: ngag gi las la rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /
translated: Thus,

original: brdzun smra ba las ldog pa dang / tshig phra ma las ldog pa dang / tshig rtsub po las ldog pa dang / ngag kyal pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba las ldog pa dang / tshig phra ma las ldog pa dang / tshig rtsub po las ldog pa dang / ngag kyal pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: turning away from lying, turning away from slander, turning away from harsh speech, and turning away from idle chatter.

original: yang rnam pa lnga ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: yang rnam pa lnga ste 'di ltar /
translated: It is also of five kinds:🔽Thus,

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa'i @243a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa'i @243a * //
translated: turning away from killing, and so on.

original: mtshan nyid ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo dge ba'i chos sdud par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / tshogs kyi tshul khrims dang / kun nas slong bar byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo dge ba'i chos sdud par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / tshogs kyi tshul khrims dang / kun nas slong bar byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The essence of moral discipline as a quality is the moral discipline of restraint, the moral discipline of acquiring virtue, the moral discipline of acting for the benefit of sentient beings, the moral discipline of the collections, and the moral discipline of motivation.

original: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The moral discipline of restraint is of eight types:

original: 'di ltar / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa dang / dge tshul gyi sdom pa dang / dge tshul ma'i sdom pa dang / bar slob ma'i sdom pa dang / dge slong gi sdom pa dang / dge slong ma'i sdom pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen ma'i sdom pa dang / dge tshul gyi sdom pa dang / dge tshul ma'i sdom pa dang / bar slob ma'i sdom pa dang / dge slong gi sdom pa dang / dge slong ma'i sdom pa dang /
translated: the vows of a lay practitioner, the vows of a lay practitioner who also practices celibacy, the vows of a novice monk, the vows of a novice nun, the vows of a probationary nun, the vows of a monk, the vows of a nun,

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: and the vows of one-day fasting.

original: yang sdom pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang sdom pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, there are five types of vows:

original: 'di ltar / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: and the untainted morality.

original: tshogs kyi tshul khrims ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi tshul khrims ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The morality of the assemblage is fourfold.🔽Thus,🔽the morality of restraint of the faculties is the antidote to the discursive thought of harm;🔽the morality of moderation in food is the antidote to the unserviceability of harm;

original: 'di ltar / nye bar 'tshe ba rnam rtog gi gnyen po dbang po rnams sgo sdom pa dang / nye bar 'tshe brten las su mi rung ba'i gnyen po zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnyen po srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal bar sbyor ba rjes su ldan pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / nye bar 'tshe ba rnam rtog gi gnyen po dbang po rnams sgo sdom pa dang / nye bar 'tshe brten las su mi rung ba'i gnyen po zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnyen po srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal bar sbyor ba rjes su ldan pa nyid dang /
translated: the morality of being endowed with the practice of not lying down to sleep in the first or last part of the night is the antidote to the harm of non-exertion;

original: nye bar 'tshe ba 'gyod pa'i gnyen po shes bzhin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba 'gyod pa'i gnyen po shes bzhin la gnas pa'o //
translated: and the morality of being endowed with watchfulness is the antidote to the harm of regret.

original: slong bar byed pa'i tshul khrims ni sems las byung ba ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: slong bar byed pa'i tshul khrims ni sems las byung ba ste rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The morality of instigation is a mental factor, threefold.

original: 'di ltar / brnab sems kyi gnyen po ma chags pa'i rang bzhin brnab sems med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brnab sems kyi gnyen po ma chags pa'i rang bzhin brnab sems med pa'o //
translated: Thus, non-covetousness is the antidote to covetousness, and has the nature of non-attachment.

original: gnod sems kyi gnyen po zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin mi gnod pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gnyen po zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin mi gnod pa'i sems so //
translated: Non-ill-will is the antidote to ill-will, and has the nature of non-hatred, i.e., a mind that is not harmful.

original: log par lta ba'i gnyen po ma rmongs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gnyen po ma rmongs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Right view is the antidote to wrong view, and has the nature of non-delusion.

original: tshul khrims dri ma med pa ni drug ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dri ma med pa ni drug ste /
translated: The six kinds of stainless morality are🔽as follows:

original: 'di ltar / skyon med pa dang / ma nyams pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / ma nogs pa dang / thun tshags ma yin pa dang / rang dbang can no //🔽gnas brtan pa chos mngon pa pas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / skyon med pa dang / ma nyams pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / ma nogs pa dang / thun tshags ma yin pa dang / rang dbang can no // gnas brtan pa chos mngon pa pas gsungs te /
translated: It is without fault, not deficient, unadulterated, not deficient, not partial, and independent.

original: tshul khrims ni gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni gsum ste /
translated: The elders who are Ābhidharmikas say that morality is threefold:🔽as follows:

original: 'di ltar / sems pa'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi 'da' ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sems pa'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi 'da' ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of intention, the morality of restraint, and the morality of non-transgression.

original: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Morality is also twofold:

original: 'di ltar / sdom pa'i don gyis na tshul khrims dang / spong ba'i don gyis na tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdom pa'i don gyis na tshul khrims dang / spong ba'i don gyis na tshul khrims so //
translated: morality is in the sense of restraint and in the sense of abandonment.

original: de la sdom pa'i don gyis na @243b tshul khrims ni bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i don gyis na @243b tshul khrims ni bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In the sense of restraint, morality is fourfold:🔽restraint of the code of rules,🔽restraint of the absorptions,🔽restraint of the formless meditative attainments,

original: rnam par ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems pa'i tshul khrims dang / yang dag par bsdams pa'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //🔽spong ba'i don gyis na tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: rnam par ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems pa'i tshul khrims dang / yang dag par bsdams pa'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims so // spong ba'i don gyis na tshul khrims ni /
translated: and restraint of the uncontaminated.

original: rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun te 'di ltar /
analyzed: rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun te 'di ltar /
translated: In the sense of abandonment, morality is thirty-sevenfold:🔽morality of abandoning desire for sense objects through renunciation,🔽morality of abandoning malice through non-violence,🔽morality of abandoning lethargy and sleepiness through the perception of light,

original: nges par 'byung bas 'dod pa la 'dun pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / gnod sems med pas gnod sems spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / snang ba'i 'du shes kyis rmugs pa dang gnyid spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi g-yeng bas rgod pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bas 'dod pa la 'dun pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / gnod sems med pas gnod sems spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / snang ba'i 'du shes kyis rmugs pa dang gnyid spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi g-yeng bas rgod pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: morality of abandoning excitement and regret through non-distraction,

original: chos rnam par bzhag pas the tshom spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / ye shes kyis ma rig pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / rab tu dga' bas mi dga' ba spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan dang pos sgrib pa rnams spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: chos rnam par bzhag pas the tshom spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / ye shes kyis ma rig pa spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / rab tu dga' bas mi dga' ba spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan dang pos sgrib pa rnams spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: The morality of abandoning doubt through the presentation of the Dharma, the morality of abandoning ignorance through wisdom, the morality of abandoning unhappiness through joy, the morality of abandoning obscurations through the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pas rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa rnams spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan gsum pas dga' ba spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan bzhi pas bde ba sdug bsngal dag spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas la snyoms par 'jug pas gzugs kyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pas rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa rnams spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan gsum pas dga' ba spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan bzhi pas bde ba sdug bsngal dag spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas la snyoms par 'jug pas gzugs kyi 'du shes dang /
translated: the morality of abandoning discursive thought and investigation through the second concentration, the morality of abandoning joy through the third concentration, the morality of abandoning happiness and suffering through the fourth concentration, and the morality of abandoning the perception of form through entering the sphere of infinite space,

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes rnams spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par zhugs pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pas /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes rnams spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par zhugs pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pas /
translated: the morality of abandoning the notion of obstruction, the notion of separateness, the morality of abandoning the notion of the sphere of infinite space by entering into the sphere of infinite consciousness, the morality of abandoning the notion of the sphere of infinite consciousness by entering into the sphere of nothingness,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pas /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pas /
translated: and the morality of abandoning the notion of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception by entering into the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi rtag pa rjes su mthong bas rtag pa'i 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / sdug bsngal rjes su mthong bas bde ba'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / bdag med pa rjes su mthong bas bdag gi 'du shes spongs ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi rtag pa rjes su mthong bas rtag pa'i 'du shes spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / sdug bsngal rjes su mthong bas bde ba'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / bdag med pa rjes su mthong bas bdag gi 'du shes spongs ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: the morality of abandoning the perception of the sphere of nothingness, the morality of abandoning the perception of permanence by seeing impermanence, the morality of abandoning the perception of happiness by seeing suffering, the morality of abandoning the perception of self by seeing selflessness,

original: yid 'byung ba rjes su mthong bas dga' ba spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / chags bral rjes su mthong bas chags pa spongs ba'i tshul khrims dang / 'gog pa rjes su mthong bas kun @244a * //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba rjes su mthong bas dga' ba spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / chags bral rjes su mthong bas chags pa spongs ba'i tshul khrims dang / 'gog pa rjes su mthong bas kun @244a * //
translated: the morality of abandoning delight by seeing disgust, the morality of abandoning attachment by seeing freedom from attachment, the morality of abandoning all by seeing cessation,

original: 'byung spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / so sor spong ba rjes su mthong bas nye bar len pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / zad pa rjes su mthong bas sdug pa'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / 'gag pa rjes su mthong bas kun du 'du byed pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: 'byung spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / so sor spong ba rjes su mthong bas nye bar len pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / zad pa rjes su mthong bas sdug pa'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / 'gag pa rjes su mthong bas kun du 'du byed pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: the morality of abandoning the elements, the morality of abandoning the appropriation of the aggregates by seeing the individual abandonment of the aggregates, the morality of abandoning the perception of beauty by seeing the exhaustion of the aggregates, the morality of abandoning the formation of the aggregates by seeing the cessation of the aggregates,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba rjes su mthong bas brten pa'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / mtshan ma med pa rjes su mthong bas mtshan ma'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / smon pa med pa rjes su mthong bas smon pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba rjes su mthong bas brten pa'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / mtshan ma med pa rjes su mthong bas mtshan ma'i 'du shes spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / smon pa med pa rjes su mthong bas smon pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: the morality of abandoning the perception of a basis by seeing the transformation of the aggregates, the morality of abandoning the perception of signs by seeing the signlessness of the aggregates, the morality of abandoning wishes by seeing the wishlessness of the aggregates,

original: stong pa nyid rjes su mthong bas bdag du mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyis chos rnams nges par mthong bas dpa' zhum pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / yang dag pa ci lta bar shes pa mthong bas rmongs pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rjes su mthong bas bdag du mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyis chos rnams nges par mthong bas dpa' zhum pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / yang dag pa ci lta bar shes pa mthong bas rmongs pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: the discipline of abandoning the clinging to a self by seeing emptiness, the discipline of abandoning the clinging to the fainthearted by seeing phenomena with superior wisdom, the discipline of abandoning the clinging to delusion by seeing the correct knowledge of things as they are,

original: 'tsho ba rjes su mthong bas gnas la mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / so sor rtog pa rjes su mthong bas so sor rtog pa ma yin pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par rtog pa rjes su mthong bas kun du sbyor ba'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba rjes su mthong bas gnas la mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / so sor rtog pa rjes su mthong bas so sor rtog pa ma yin pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par rtog pa rjes su mthong bas kun du sbyor ba'i mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: the discipline of abandoning the clinging to abodes by seeing livelihood, the discipline of abandoning non-discernment by seeing discernment, the discipline of abandoning the clinging to fetters by seeing discursive thought,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis lta ba dang / gnas gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rags pa rnams sdong ba'i tshul khrims dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis bag la nyal du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis lta ba dang / gnas gcig pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rags pa rnams sdong ba'i tshul khrims dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis bag la nyal du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: The morality of the path of the result of stream-enterer is the morality that eliminates the views and the afflictions of the single abode. The morality of the path of once-returner is the morality that subdues the coarse afflictions. The morality of the path of non-returner is the morality that eliminates the afflictions that are included in the latent states.

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of the path of arhat is the morality that eliminates all afflictions.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the culmination of the perfection of morality.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of patience:

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o//
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o//
translated: the patience of not taking offense at harm done by others, the patience of voluntarily accepting suffering, and the patience of ascertaining the Dharma.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the culmination of the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of effort:

original: 'di ltar / go cha sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can don sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / go cha sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can don sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is the armor-like effort, the effort of application to virtue, the effort of application to the welfare of living beings, and the perfection of effort which is the culmination.

original: bsam gtan la @244b rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan la @244b rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of meditation:

original: 'di ltar / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bde ba mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bde ba mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: the meditation which is the accomplishment of good qualities, the meditation which is the accomplishment of the welfare of living beings, and the meditation which is the accomplishment of the remedy for the addictions.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the culmination.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ste ;
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ste ;
translated: There are three kinds of wisdom:

original: 'di ltar / kun rdzob bden pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kun rdzob bden pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the wisdom which is the realization of the conventional truth, the wisdom which is the realization of the ultimate truth, and the wisdom which is the realization of the welfare of living beings.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of wisdom:

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the wisdom which is the nature of the cause, and the wisdom which is the nature of the result.

original: de la rgyu'i ngo bo nyi gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i ngo bo nyi gnyis te /
translated: The essence of the cause is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / mos pa la spyod pa dang ; sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mos pa la spyod pa dang ; sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i 'o //
translated: that of the one who is engaged in devotion and that of the one who has entered the stages.

original: de la dang po gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dang po gsum ste /
translated: The first is threefold:🔽that of the one who is engaged in the perfection of wisdom, that of the one who is engaged in the perfection of meditation, and that of the one who is engaged in the perfection of vigor.🔽The perfection of wisdom is threefold:

original: 'di ltar / thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang / bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang / sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang / bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang / sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab bo //
translated: that of the nature of hearing, that of the nature of reflection, and that of the nature of meditation.

original: de la sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ni dbye ba gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ni dbye ba gsum ste /
translated: The perfection of meditation is threefold:

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas kyi ngo bo dang / lhag mthong gi rang bzhin dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas kyi ngo bo dang / lhag mthong gi rang bzhin dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ngo bo'o //
translated: that of the nature of serenity, that of the nature of insight, and that of the nature of serenity and insight combined.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The result is the perfection of wisdom endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: 'phags pa gnas brtan pa ni dri ba dgu dang / lan dgus shes rab rnam par bzhag pa byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa gnas brtan pa ni dri ba dgu dang / lan dgus shes rab rnam par bzhag pa byed do //
translated: The noble Sthaviras present the perfection of wisdom in nine questions and nine answers.

original: de la dri ba dgu ni 'di ltar /🔽shes rab gang yin /🔽shes rab mtshan nyid ci /
analyzed: de la dri ba dgu ni 'di ltar / shes rab gang yin / shes rab mtshan nyid ci /
translated: The nine questions are as follows:🔽What is wisdom?🔽What is the characteristic of wisdom?

original: ro ci yin /
analyzed: ro ci yin /
translated: What is the taste of wisdom?

original: nye bar gnas pa ci /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ci /
translated: What is the proximate cause of wisdom?

original: shes rab 'di'i go 'phang gi gnas ci /
analyzed: shes rab 'di'i go 'phang gi gnas ci /
translated: What is the state of this wisdom?

original: shes rab phan yon ci /
analyzed: shes rab phan yon ci /
translated: What are the benefits of wisdom?

original: shes rab ces pa'i don gang yin /
analyzed: shes rab ces pa'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of wisdom?

original: shes rab thob pa'i nye ba'i rten du yin /
analyzed: shes rab thob pa'i nye ba'i rten du yin /
translated: What is the proximate basis for attaining wisdom?

original: shes rab dbye ba du zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab dbye ba du zhe na /
translated: How many types of wisdom are there?

original: lam ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The path is as follows:

original: shes rab gang yin ces pa brjod de /
analyzed: shes rab gang yin ces pa brjod de /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: yid kyis ci lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa mthong ba 'di ni shes rab zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyis ci lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa mthong ba 'di ni shes rab zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that seeing the object as it is with the mind is called wisdom.

original: yang na phan pa dang mi phan pa yid la byed pas yid kyi rgyu rnam pa mang du byed pa 'di ni shes rab zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na phan pa dang mi phan pa yid la byed pas yid kyi rgyu rnam pa mang du byed pa 'di ni shes rab zhes brjod do //
translated: Or, it is said that wisdom is the mind's manifold activity through attention to what is beneficial and not beneficial.

original: de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsum ste /
translated: Thus, in the Abhidharma, it is said:

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, it is said:

original: shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: gcig med pa'i sum cu'i rnam grangs kyis brjod de /
analyzed: gcig med pa'i sum cu'i rnam grangs kyis brjod de /
translated: It is expressed by the thirty terms without repetition.🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / gang shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang shes rab bo //
translated: What is wisdom?

original: rab tu shes pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / yang dag par mtshon pa dang / nye bar mtshon pa dang / so sor yang dag nye bar mtshon pa dang /🔽rig pa dang / mkhas pa dang / mthar phyin pa dang / rnam @245a * //
analyzed: rab tu shes pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / yang dag par mtshon pa dang / nye bar mtshon pa dang / so sor yang dag nye bar mtshon pa dang / rig pa dang / mkhas pa dang / mthar phyin pa dang / rnam @245a * //
translated: It is to be very knowledgeable, to discern, to discern well, to discern phenomena, to be able to illustrate, to be able to illustrate well, to be able to illustrate individually,

original: par 'brel pa dang / sems nye bar yongs su rtogs pa dang / chen po dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / yongs su 'dren byed dang / rnam par mthong ba dang / yang dag par shes pa dang / shes rab lcag dang / shes rab dbang po dang /
analyzed: par 'brel pa dang / sems nye bar yongs su rtogs pa dang / chen po dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / yongs su 'dren byed dang / rnam par mthong ba dang / yang dag par shes pa dang / shes rab lcag dang / shes rab dbang po dang /
translated: to be aware, to be skilled, to be consummate, to be connected, to be mentally aware, to be great, to be intelligent, to be a guide, to be able to see, to be able to understand, to be a whip of insight, to be an organ of insight,

original: shes rab stobs dang / shes rab mtshon cha dang ; shes rab gsal ba dang / shes rab snang ba dang / shes rab sgron ma dang / shes rab de kho na nyid dang / ma rmongs pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab stobs dang / shes rab mtshon cha dang ; shes rab gsal ba dang / shes rab snang ba dang / shes rab sgron ma dang / shes rab de kho na nyid dang / ma rmongs pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang /
translated: to be a strength of insight, to be a weapon of insight, to be a light of insight, to be a radiance of insight, to be a lamp of insight, to be the suchness of insight, to be undeluded, and to discern phenomena.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba 'di ni shes rab zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba 'di ni shes rab zhes brjod do //
translated: This right view is called wisdom.

original: mtshan nyid ci zhe na smras pa brjod de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ci zhe na smras pa brjod de /
translated: What is its characteristic? It is said:

original: rigs pas mngon du byed pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: rigs pas mngon du byed pa ni shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the manifestation of reason.

original: ro ci yin zhes smra ba brjod de /
analyzed: ro ci yin zhes smra ba brjod de /
translated: What is its taste? It is said:

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of things.

original: nye bar gnas pa gang yin zhes smra ba brjod de /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa gang yin zhes smra ba brjod de /
translated: What is its benefit? It is said:

original: kun nas ma rmongs pa nye bar gnas pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: kun nas ma rmongs pa nye bar gnas pa ni shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the benefit of the absence of confusion.

original: shes rab 'di'i go 'phang gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab 'di'i go 'phang gnas so //
translated: This is the abode of wisdom.

original: yang na shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni shes rab rnam par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni shes rab rnam par gsal ba'o //
translated: Or else, the characteristic of wisdom is the manifestation of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi ro ni gting yongs su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ro ni gting yongs su dpag pa'o //
translated: The taste of wisdom is the thorough comprehension of the profound.

original: shes rab nye bar gnas pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab nye bar gnas pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa 'joms pa'o //
translated: The benefit of wisdom is the destruction of the darkness of ignorance.

original: shes rab de'i go 'phang gnas ni so sor yang dag pa rig pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: shes rab de'i go 'phang gnas ni so sor yang dag pa rig pa bzhi'o //
translated: The abode of wisdom is the four right understandings.

original: phan yon gang yin zhes smra ba bsdus nas brjod do //
analyzed: phan yon gang yin zhes smra ba bsdus nas brjod do //
translated: What is its benefit? It is said:

original: shes rab kyis ni tshul khrims spyod byed bsam gtan la 'jog byed //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni tshul khrims spyod byed bsam gtan la 'jog byed //
translated: Morality is practiced through wisdom, and concentration is stabilized.

original: shes rab kyis ni lam rnams sgom byed 'bras bu mthong bar byed //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni lam rnams sgom byed 'bras bu mthong bar byed //
translated: The paths are cultivated through wisdom, and the fruits are seen.

original: shes rab kyis ni shes rab gong ma dge spyan bla med pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni shes rab gong ma dge spyan bla med pa //
translated: Through wisdom, one attains the highest wisdom, the eye of virtue.

original: nyams pa'i shes rab sel cing bla med shes rab 'phel //
analyzed: nyams pa'i shes rab sel cing bla med shes rab 'phel //
translated: Wisdom eliminates degeneration and increases unsurpassed wisdom.

original: pha rol rgol ba 'jug byed cing //
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba 'jug byed cing //
translated: It engages in refuting opponents,

original: 'jig rten chos kyis mi gos pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyis mi gos pa //
translated: and one is unstained by worldly phenomena.

original: shes rab ldan pa smra ba na //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa smra ba na //
translated: When the wise speak,

original: legs par smras pa shin tu srid //
analyzed: legs par smras pa shin tu srid //
translated: it is very likely to be well-spoken.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten gzhan //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten gzhan //
translated: In this world and in other worlds,

original: grol ba grags pa thob pa bde //
analyzed: grol ba grags pa thob pa bde //
translated: the liberated one attains fame and happiness.

original: don dang rtsol ba dpa' ba nyid //
analyzed: don dang rtsol ba dpa' ba nyid //
translated: Meaning, effort, and heroism🔽are always present in the wise.

original: shes rab ldan pa rnam par rtag / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba na //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa rnam par rtag / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba na //
translated: In dependent origination,

original: ming dang gzugs ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni ston pa'o //
translated: name-and-form are taught.

original: sems can so sor bden pa ston //
analyzed: sems can so sor bden pa ston //
translated: The truth is taught for each sentient being.

original: de rnams shes rab can spyod yul //
analyzed: de rnams shes rab can spyod yul //
translated: These are the domain of the wise.

original: shes rab kyis ni sdig pa spong //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni sdig pa spong //
translated: Through wisdom, one abandons evil,🔽and one attains the supreme state.

original: shes rab kyis ni chags dang sdang // rmongs dang skye 'chi ma lus pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni chags dang sdang // rmongs dang skye 'chi ma lus pa //
translated: ignorance, and all birth and death.

original: shin tu rgyal dka' rgyal bar byed //
analyzed: shin tu rgyal dka' rgyal bar byed //
translated: It is difficult to conquer, but wisdom conquers it.

original: shes rab zhes pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab zhes pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of wisdom?

original: brjod de / rab tu shes pa 'di ni shes rab bam /
analyzed: brjod de / rab tu shes pa 'di ni shes rab bam /
translated: It is said: This is wisdom because it is the highest knowledge.

original: nyes pa thams cad rab tu spong @245b bas 'di ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad rab tu spong @245b bas 'di ni shes rab bo //
translated: This is wisdom because it abandons all faults.

original: shes rab tu brnyes pa'i phyir nye ba'i rten gang zhe na zhes pa brjod de /
analyzed: shes rab tu brnyes pa'i phyir nye ba'i rten gang zhe na zhes pa brjod de /
translated: What is the basis of wisdom? It is said:🔽There are eleven bases.

original: nye ba'i rten bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i rten bcu gcig ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'di ltar / mdo'i don tshol ba nyid dang / yang dag pa mang du gtam pa nyid dang / btegs gnas su gnas pa nyid dang / bden pa la rtog pa dang / dngos po dang rnam par drang ba'i bya ba la gnas pa'i tshul khrims nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / mdo'i don tshol ba nyid dang / yang dag pa mang du gtam pa nyid dang / btegs gnas su gnas pa nyid dang / bden pa la rtog pa dang / dngos po dang rnam par drang ba'i bya ba la gnas pa'i tshul khrims nyid dang /
translated: Seeking the meaning of the sutras, speaking correctly, abiding in the four bases of mindfulness, contemplating the truths, the morality of abiding in the practice of things and discernment,

original: bsam gtan rjes su sbyor ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par bral ba'i sems nyid dang / shes rab 'chal pa'i gang zag yongs su spangs pa dang / shes rab can gyi gang zag bsten pa dang / de la lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan rjes su sbyor ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par bral ba'i sems nyid dang / shes rab 'chal pa'i gang zag yongs su spangs pa dang / shes rab can gyi gang zag bsten pa dang / de la lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: and the superior aspiration for that.

original: shes rab rnam par dbye ba du zhe na zhes pa brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par dbye ba du zhe na zhes pa brjod do //
translated: How many kinds of wisdom are there?

original: shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Wisdom is of two kinds:

original: 'di ltar / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab ni 'phags pa'i lam dang 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab ni 'phags pa'i lam dang 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa /
translated: Among them, mundane wisdom is not endowed with the noble path and its fruits,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa /🔽kun du sbyor bar bya ba /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa / kun du sbyor bar bya ba /
translated: it is contaminated,🔽it is a fetter,

original: 'dud par bya ba /
analyzed: 'dud par bya ba /
translated: it is a bowing down,

original: klung du 'bab par bya ba /
analyzed: klung du 'bab par bya ba /
translated: it is a flowing down,

original: sgrib par bya ba /
analyzed: sgrib par bya ba /
translated: it is an obscuration,

original: mchog tu bzung ba /
analyzed: mchog tu bzung ba /
translated: it is a supreme grasping,

original: nye bar bslang ba /
analyzed: nye bar bslang ba /
translated: it is a thorough envelopment,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la byung ba'o //
translated: and it is a thorough affliction.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab ni /
translated: Supramundane wisdom

original: lam dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa /
translated: is endowed with the path and its fruits.

original: de ni zag pa med pa /
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa /
translated: It is uncontaminated,

original: sbyor bar bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sbyor bar bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not to be joined.

original: 'dud par bya ba ma yin pa /🔽klung du 'bab par bya ba ma yin pa /🔽sgrib par bya ba ma yin pa /🔽mchog tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'dud par bya ba ma yin pa / klung du 'bab par bya ba ma yin pa / sgrib par bya ba ma yin pa / mchog tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not to be bowed to.🔽It is not to be crossed.🔽It is not to be covered.🔽It is not to be grasped at.

original: nye bar blang ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not to be taken up.

original: nyon mongs pa can la byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not to be defiled.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of wisdom:

original: 'di ltar / bsam pa'i rang bzhin dang / thos pa'i rang bzhin dang / sgom pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽de la gzhan las ma thos par rang gi las las shes pa'am /🔽bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa so sor thob pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsam pa'i rang bzhin dang / thos pa'i rang bzhin dang / sgom pa'i rang bzhin no // de la gzhan las ma thos par rang gi las las shes pa'am / bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa so sor thob pa'am /
translated: that which is based on reflection, that which is based on listening, and that which is based on meditation.

original: bzo'i skye mched rig pa'i gnas la shes rab so sor thob pa 'di ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ces brjod do //
analyzed: bzo'i skye mched rig pa'i gnas la shes rab so sor thob pa 'di ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ces brjod do //
translated: That which is based on reflection is the wisdom that is attained from one’s own actions, without listening to others, or the wisdom that is attained from the realization of the truths, or the wisdom that is attained from the knowledge of the arts and sciences.

original: dngos po de nyid la gzhan las thos nas shes rab so sor thos pa ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ces brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid la gzhan las thos nas shes rab so sor thos pa ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ces brjod do //
translated: That which is based on listening is the wisdom that is attained from listening to others about those very things.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyang de ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi shes rab kyang de ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin zhes brjod do //
translated: The wisdom of all meditative concentrations is called the nature of meditation.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three more types:

original: 'di ltar / skye ba la mkhas pa dang / mi 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye ba la mkhas pa dang / mi 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in arising, skill in non-arising, and skill in means.

original: de 'di yid la byas pas mi dge ba'i chos yongs su spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos yongs su 'phel ba'o zhes pa shes rab gang yin pa 'di @246a * //
analyzed: de 'di yid la byas pas mi dge ba'i chos yongs su spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos yongs su 'phel ba'o zhes pa shes rab gang yin pa 'di @246a * //
translated: The wisdom that, by bringing this to mind, abandons non-virtuous dharmas and increases virtuous dharmas

original: ni skye ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: ni skye ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: is skill in arising.🔽The wisdom that, by bringing this dharma to mind, non-virtuous dharmas increase and virtuous dharmas decline

original: chos 'di yid la byas pas mi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel zhing dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams pa'o zhes pa shes rab gang yin pa de ni mi 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di yid la byas pas mi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'phel zhing dge ba'i chos yongs su nyams pa'o zhes pa shes rab gang yin pa de ni mi 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: is skill in non-arising.

original: chos de rnams nye bar bzung ste shes rab thams cad kyang de ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos de rnams nye bar bzung ste shes rab thams cad kyang de ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: All wisdom that takes up those dharmas is skill in means.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three more types of wisdom:

original: kun du 'phel bar bgrod pa dang / 'grib par bgrod pa dang / 'grib par 'gro ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'phel bar bgrod pa dang / 'grib par bgrod pa dang / 'grib par 'gro ba yin pa'o //
translated: that which leads to increase, that which leads to decrease, and that which neither leads to increase nor to decrease.

original: de la gang rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa gsum gyi shes rab de ni kun du 'phel bar bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa gsum gyi shes rab de ni kun du 'phel bar bgrod pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the three stages of the stream-enterer, once-returner, and non-returner leads to increase.

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa'i lam bzhi'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni 'grib par bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa'i lam bzhi'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni 'grib par bgrod pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the four stages of the stream-enterer, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat leads to decrease.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pas bzhi'i rnam par smin pa dang / sa bzhi'i bya ba lung du ma bstan pa shes rab gang yin pa de ni kun 'phel bar bgrod pa ma yin pa 'grib par ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pas bzhi'i rnam par smin pa dang / sa bzhi'i bya ba lung du ma bstan pa shes rab gang yin pa de ni kun 'phel bar bgrod pa ma yin pa 'grib par ma yin no //
translated: The wisdom of the four stages of the stream-enterer, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat, which is neither the maturation of the four stages nor the neutral action of the four stages, neither leads to increase nor to decrease.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /
translated: Again, there are four kinds of wisdom:

original: rang gi las las shes pa dang / bden pa rjes su mthun pa shes pa dang / lam dang ldan pa shes pa dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi las las shes pa dang / bden pa rjes su mthun pa shes pa dang / lam dang ldan pa shes pa dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of one's own karma, knowledge of the conformity of the truths, knowledge of the possession of the path, and knowledge of the possession of the fruit.

original: de la rang gi las kyis shes pa ni dngos po bcu'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi las kyis shes pa ni dngos po bcu'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Among them, knowledge of one's own karma is the right view of the ten things.

original: de la dngos po ni bcu ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po ni bcu ste /
translated: Therein, the things are ten:

original: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal bden pa shes pa dang // kun 'byung bden pa shes pa dang // 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa dang // lam gyi bden pa shes pa dang // 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa las gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal bden pa shes pa dang // kun 'byung bden pa shes pa dang // 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa dang // lam gyi bden pa shes pa dang // 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa las gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang /
translated: namely, knowledge of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the truth of the origin, knowledge of the truth of cessation, knowledge of the truth of the path, and the knowledge of nirvana that arises from cultivating the noble path.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / chos rnam pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dkon mchog gsum la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / chos rnam pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dkon mchog gsum la yid ches pa'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom, the power of wisdom, the foot of supernatural power of investigation, the element of Dharma, and the branch of enlightenment of investigation.

original: bden pa rjes su mthun pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: bden pa rjes su mthun pa shes pa ni /
translated: Knowledge of the conformity of the truths is the knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: phung po lnga mi rtag zhes pa'am sdug bsngal zhes pa'am bdag med pa'o zhes rnam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga mi rtag zhes pa'am sdug bsngal zhes pa'am bdag med pa'o zhes rnam par lta ba'o //
translated: The view is the thought: The five aggregates are impermanent, or They are painful, or They are without a self.

original: gang de lta bu'i ngo bo rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa 'di ni bden pa rjes su mthun pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang de lta bu'i ngo bo rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa 'di ni bden pa rjes su mthun pa shes pa'o //
translated: The acceptance that is in conformity with that kind of nature is the knowledge that is in conformity with the truth.🔽 The wisdom of the four paths is the wisdom that is in conformity with the path.

original: lam bzhi'i shes rab ni lam yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: lam bzhi'i shes rab ni lam yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The four paths are as follows:🔽the path of the fruit of entering the stream, the path of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the path of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the path of the fruit of arhatship.🔽 The wisdom of the four fruits is the knowledge that is in conformity with the fruits.

original: de la lam bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la lam bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: The four fruits are as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba 'bras bu'i lam dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / dgra bcom pa'i @246b 'bras bu'i lam mo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba 'bras bu'i lam dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / dgra bcom pa'i @246b 'bras bu'i lam mo //
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.🔽 🔽The wisdom of the four fruits is the knowledge that is in conformity with the fruits.

original: 'bras bu bzhi'i shes rab ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi'i shes rab ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The four fruits are as follows:🔽the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.🔽 🔽The wisdom of the four fruits is the knowledge that is in conformity with the fruits.

original: de la 'bras bu bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: The four fruits are as follows:🔽the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.🔽 🔽The wisdom of the four fruits is the knowledge that is in conformity with the fruits.🔽 The four fruits are as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.🔽 🔽The wisdom of the four fruits is the knowledge that is in conformity with the fruits.🔽 The four fruits are as follows:🔽the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.🔽 🔽The wisdom of the four fruits is the knowledge that is in conformity with the fruits.🔽 The four fruits are as follows:🔽the fruit of entering the stream,

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There is also fourfold wisdom:

original: 'di ltar / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / yongs su ma bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / yongs su ma bsdus pa'o //
translated: the wisdoms of the realm of desire, the realm of form, the formless realm, and the unincluded.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the realm of desire is the wholesome and neutral wisdom of the realm of desire.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the realm of form is the wholesome and neutral wisdom of the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the formless realm is the wholesome and neutral wisdom of the formless realm.

original: lam dang 'bras bu ni yongs su ma bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu ni yongs su ma bsdus pa'o //
translated: The path and the fruits are unincluded.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is also fourfold wisdom:

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa'o //
translated: the wisdom of the doctrine, the subsequent wisdom, the wisdom of the mind of another, and the conventional wisdom.

original: de la lam bzhi dang 'bras bu bzhi'i shes rab ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam bzhi dang 'bras bu bzhi'i shes rab ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the four paths and the four fruits is the wisdom of the doctrine.

original: de chos shes pa 'di dang ldan pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tshul len pa'o //
analyzed: de chos shes pa 'di dang ldan pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tshul len pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the Dharma. The possession of this knowledge is the taking up of the way of the past and the future.

original: de ltar yang /🔽gang kha cig 'das pa'i dus kyi bden pa mngon par shes pa de ni bden pa mngon par shes pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar yang / gang kha cig 'das pa'i dus kyi bden pa mngon par shes pa de ni bden pa mngon par shes pa 'di nyid do //
translated: Thus,🔽the knowledge that “the knowledge of the truth of those who have attained it in the past is this very knowledge of the truth that I now possess,”

original: gang kha cig ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bden pa mngon par shes par 'gyur ba de ni bden pa mngon par shes par 'gyur ba 'di nyid do zhes pa'i shes pa de ni rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang kha cig ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bden pa mngon par shes par 'gyur ba de ni bden pa mngon par shes par 'gyur ba 'di nyid do zhes pa'i shes pa de ni rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge that “the knowledge of the truth of those who will attain it in the future is this very knowledge of the truth that I now possess,”

original: gzhan gyi sems la shes pa de ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la shes pa de ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the minds of others,

original: shes pa 'di gsum ma rtogs pa lhag ma'i shes rab de ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di gsum ma rtogs pa lhag ma'i shes rab de ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the remaining wisdom that is not included in these three knowledges is conventional knowledge.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar /🔽gang 'phel ba ma yin zhing 'grib pa'i shes rab yod do //
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste 'di ltar / gang 'phel ba ma yin zhing 'grib pa'i shes rab yod do //
translated: Moreover, there are four kinds of wisdom:🔽there is wisdom that does not increase and does not decrease;

original: gang nye bar 'phel zhing 'grib pa ma yin pa'i shes rab yod do //
analyzed: gang nye bar 'phel zhing 'grib pa ma yin pa'i shes rab yod do //
translated: there is wisdom that increases and does not decrease;

original: gang 'grib pa dang 'phel ba dag gi shes rab yod do //
analyzed: gang 'grib pa dang 'phel ba dag gi shes rab yod do //
translated: There is wisdom for those who are neither increasing nor decreasing.

original: gang 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //
analyzed: gang 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //
translated: There is wisdom for those who are neither increasing nor decreasing.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa gang dag dge ba'i shes rab de ni 'grib pa yin zhing nye bar mi 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa gang dag dge ba'i shes rab de ni 'grib pa yin zhing nye bar mi 'phel ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the wisdom of those in the desire realm who are virtuous is decreasing and not increasing.

original: lam bzhi'i gang shes rab de ni nye bar 'phel zhing 'grib pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam bzhi'i gang shes rab de ni nye bar 'phel zhing 'grib pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of those on the four paths is increasing and not decreasing.

original: yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa gang dge ba'i shes rab de ni 'phel ba yin zhing 'grib pa yang yin no //🔽sa bzhi'i rnam par smin pa dang / sa gsum gyi rnam par smin pa lung ma @247a * //
analyzed: yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa gang dge ba'i shes rab de ni 'phel ba yin zhing 'grib pa yang yin no // sa bzhi'i rnam par smin pa dang / sa gsum gyi rnam par smin pa lung ma @247a * //
translated: Moreover, the wisdom of those in the form and formless realms who are virtuous is both increasing and decreasing.

original: bstan pa'i shes rab de ni 'grib pa ma yin nye bar 'phel ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i shes rab de ni 'grib pa ma yin nye bar 'phel ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of those on the four levels that is karmically neutral and the wisdom of those on the three levels that is karmically neutral are neither increasing nor decreasing.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four types of wisdom:

original: 'di ltar / gang skyong zhing mngon du byed pa ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang skyong zhing mngon du byed pa ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //
translated: There is wisdom for those who are neither cultivating nor manifesting.

original: gang mngon du byed cing skyo ba ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //
analyzed: gang mngon du byed cing skyo ba ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //
translated: The wisdom of those who are not disgusted and who do not manifest is present.

original: gang skyo ba dang mngon du byed pa'i shes rab yod do //
analyzed: gang skyo ba dang mngon du byed pa'i shes rab yod do //
translated: The wisdom of those who are disgusted and who manifest is present.

original: gang skyo ba ma yin mngon du byed pa ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do //🔽de la gang gis 'dod pa las 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab de ni mngon shes dang bden pa mngon du byed pa ma yin zhes pa shes rab 'di ni yid 'byung zhing mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang skyo ba ma yin mngon du byed pa ma yin pa dag gi shes rab yod do // de la gang gis 'dod pa las 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab de ni mngon shes dang bden pa mngon du byed pa ma yin zhes pa shes rab 'di ni yid 'byung zhing mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of those who are not disgusted and who do not manifest is present.🔽The wisdom by which one becomes free from attachment to desire is neither a superknowledge nor the manifestation of the truth. This wisdom is not disgusted and does not manifest.

original: 'dod pa 'dod chags dang bral ba bden pa'i shes rab kyi mngon par shes pa mngon du byed cing bden pa ma yin pa shes rab 'di ni mngon du byed pa yin cing skyo ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'dod chags dang bral ba bden pa'i shes rab kyi mngon par shes pa mngon du byed cing bden pa ma yin pa shes rab 'di ni mngon du byed pa yin cing skyo ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of one free from attachment to desire who manifests the superknowledge of the truth and the truth is the manifestation of wisdom and is not disgusted.

original: lam bzhi'i shes rab ni yid 'byung ba dang mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam bzhi'i shes rab ni yid 'byung ba dang mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the four paths is disgusted and manifests.

original: lhag ma shes rab ni skyo ba ma yin cing mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma shes rab ni skyo ba ma yin cing mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The remaining wisdom is neither disgusted nor manifests.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four kinds of understanding:

original: 'di ltar / don so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: understanding of the meaning, understanding of the teaching, understanding of clear expression, and understanding of ready speech.

original: de la don shes pa ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la don shes pa ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Understanding of the meaning is understanding of the meaning of the teaching.

original: chos shes pa ni chos so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //🔽nges pa'i tshig mngon par brjod pa shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni chos so sor yang dag par rig pa'o // nges pa'i tshig mngon par brjod pa shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Understanding of the teaching is understanding of the teaching itself.🔽Understanding of clear expression is understanding of the clear expression of the teaching.

original: shes pa shes pa ni spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa shes pa ni spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Understanding of ready speech is understanding of the various kinds of speech.

original: tshul gzhan yang de yang /
analyzed: tshul gzhan yang de yang /
translated: There is another formulation:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu shes pa ni don so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu shes pa ni don so sor rig pa'o //
translated: Understanding of cause and effect is understanding of the meaning.

original: rgyu shes pa ni chos so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes pa ni chos so sor rig pa'o //
translated: Understanding of cause is understanding of the teaching.🔽Understanding of clear expression is understanding of clear expression.

original: nges pa'i tshig mngon par brjod pa shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig mngon par brjod pa shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor rig pa'o //
translated: Understanding of ready speech is understanding of ready speech.

original: shes pa shes pa ni spobs pa so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa shes pa ni spobs pa so sor rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of consciousness is knowledge of individual readiness.

original: tshul gzhan yang de ltar yang /
analyzed: tshul gzhan yang de ltar yang /
translated: Another method:

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa shes pa ni don so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa shes pa ni don so sor rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of suffering and cessation is knowledge of the meaning.

original: kun 'byung dang lam shes pa ni chos so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang lam shes pa ni chos so sor rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of origin and path is knowledge of the teaching.

original: gnyis ni sngon bzhin no //🔽tshul gzhan yang /
analyzed: gnyis ni sngon bzhin no // tshul gzhan yang /
translated: The other two are as before.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Another method:🔽The sutra collection, the geya, vyakarana, gatha, udana, itivrttaka, jataka, adbhutadharma,

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / tshad du brjod pa'i sde dang / de ltar byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i sde dang /🔽shin tu rgyas pa'i sde ste chos 'di rnams shes pa ni chos so sor yang dag par @247b rig pa'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / tshad du brjod pa'i sde dang / de ltar byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde ste chos 'di rnams shes pa ni chos so sor yang dag par @247b rig pa'o //
translated: and vaipulya are known as the teaching.🔽Knowledge of these is knowledge of the teaching.

original: de de bzhin du gsungs pa ni don 'di'i don ni 'di'o zhes pa ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du gsungs pa ni don 'di'i don ni 'di'o zhes pa ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the meaning of the teaching is knowledge of the meaning.

original: de la chos nges pa'i tshig la mngon par brjod pa shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos nges pa'i tshig la mngon par brjod pa shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of verbal expression with regard to the teaching is the analytical knowledge of expression.

original: shes pa shes pa ni stobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa shes pa ni stobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of knowledge is the analytical knowledge of prowess.

original: tshul gzhan yang /
analyzed: tshul gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: it is said:

original: mig shes pa ni chos so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: mig shes pa ni chos so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness is the analytical knowledge of the teaching.

original: mthong ba'i don gyis mig shes pa ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don gyis mig shes pa ni don so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness that sees the object is the analytical knowledge of the object.

original: gnyis ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: The other two are as before.

original: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang shes rab rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four types of wisdom:

original: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung shes pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa bgrod pa'i lam shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung shes pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa bgrod pa'i lam shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
translated: the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: de la rgyu drug gis sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rgyu drug gis sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: The perfections of generosity and so on become transcendent due to six causes.

original: 'di ltar / bsam pa dam pa las dang / gzhi dam pa las dang / thabs la mkhas pa dam pa las dang / yongs su bsngo ba dam pa las dang / rnam par dag pa dam pa las so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsam pa dam pa las dang / gzhi dam pa las dang / thabs la mkhas pa dam pa las dang / yongs su bsngo ba dam pa las dang / rnam par dag pa dam pa las so //
translated: from the highest thought, from the highest basis, from the highest skill in means, from the highest transference, and from the highest purification.

original: rgyu gsum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi go rims nges pa bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi go rims nges pa bstan te /
translated: The order of generosity, etc. is taught by three reasons:

original: 'di ltar / sngon ma la kun du brten nas phyi ma skye ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngon ma la kun du brten nas phyi ma skye ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the later arises in dependence on the former, and because the later is more sublime,

original: sngon ma rags pa'i phyir dad phyi ma phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon ma rags pa'i phyir dad phyi ma phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the former is gross and the later subtle.

original: bslab pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum ni /
translated: The three trainings are

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: tshul khrims su rtogs pa'i bslab pa dang / sems su rtogs pa'i bslab pa dang / shes rab tu rtogs pa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims su rtogs pa'i bslab pa dang / sems su rtogs pa'i bslab pa dang / shes rab tu rtogs pa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: the training in higher morality, the training in higher mind, and the training in higher wisdom.

original: de la dang po ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste /
translated: The first of these is the three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience.

original: 'di ltar / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of patience.

original: gnyis pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gcig ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gcig ste /
translated: The second is one perfection:🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of meditation.

original: gsum pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gcig ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gcig ste /
translated: The third is one perfection:🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bslab pa gsum ga'i yang grogs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bslab pa gsum ga'i yang grogs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the companion of all three trainings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The six perfections are twofold:🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are also twofold:🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / rgyu'i ngo bo dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu'i ngo bo dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature of cause and the nature of effect.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: They are also threefold:🔽Thus,

original: de la smon lam chen po bcu ni 'di lta ste /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa dang rim gro'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa rgya che ba'i mos pa rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par spangs pa nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar phyin pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa grangs thams cad

It is the prayer to accomplish the great worship and service of all the buddhas with the pure, vast, and supreme aspiration for the realm of space, for the realm of phenomena, to the end of time, with all the enumerations of eons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi spyan yang dag par bzung ba'i phyir dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su bzung ba'i phyir dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir ni gnyis pa'o
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi spyan yang dag par bzung ba'i phyir dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su bzung ba'i phyir dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir ni gnyis pa'o
translated: The second is for the sake of upholding the eye of Dharma taught by all the tathagatas, for the sake of upholding all the buddhas and bodhisattvas and for the sake of protecting the teachings of all the perfect buddhas.

original: tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa'i sems can gyis yongs su gang ba dang / rgya che ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gzhol ba'i sems can thams cad bsam pa ci lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa dang kun du mnyes par bya ba'i phyir smon lam ni bdun pa'o //
