translated: The seventh vow is to be filled with the immeasurable light of wisdom and to teach and please all beings in the vast buddha-fields, according to their aspirations.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir dang / 'gran bzod med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu bar ma chad par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang yang dag par 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir dang / 'gran bzod med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu bar ma chad par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang yang dag par 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The eighth vow is to be inseparable from the buddhas and bodhisattvas, to be in harmony with them in thought and deed, to accumulate the roots of virtue without rival, and to be constantly and uninterruptedly in the company of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: ci ltar 'dod par sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sems bskyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu stobs ye shes kyi rjes su bgrod pa'i phyir dang / mi nyams pa rjes su 'gro ba'i mngon shes thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod par sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sems bskyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu stobs ye shes kyi rjes su bgrod pa'i phyir dang / mi nyams pa rjes su 'gro ba'i mngon shes thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The eighth is the vow to attain the superknowledges that go everywhere without exception, in order to see the buddhas whenever one wishes, in order to follow the power, strength, and knowledge of the tathagatas with one's own mental power, and in order to go everywhere without exception.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mthun par rgyu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mthun par rgyu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The ninth is the vow to move in harmony in all world spheres,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba thob pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba thob pa'i phyir ;
translated: in order to appear in the circles of the retinue of all buddhas.

original: bsam du med pa'i theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par chad pa med par spyad pa'i phyir smon lam ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam du med pa'i theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par chad pa med par spyad pa'i phyir smon lam ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the vow to attain the inconceivable great vehicle, and to practice the bodhisattva practices without interruption.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir dang / lus dang dag dang yid kyi las don yod pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang lhan cig du sangs rgyas kyi chos nges pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir dang / lus dang dag dang yid kyi las don yod pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang lhan cig du sangs rgyas kyi chos nges pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: The ninth is the vow to attain the stage of irreversibility, in order to practice the conduct of a bodhisattva who is firmly established in the irreversible wheel, in order to make one's physical, verbal, and mental actions meaningful,

original: dbyangs dang lhan cig tu rgya che ba'i mthu stobs ye shes kyi rjes su bgrod pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang lhan cig tu sems can rab tu dang ba thob pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir dang / sman gyi rgyal po lta bu'i rten thob pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dbyangs dang lhan cig tu rgya che ba'i mthu stobs ye shes kyi rjes su bgrod pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang lhan cig tu sems can rab tu dang ba thob pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir dang / sman gyi rgyal po lta bu'i rten thob pa'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to attain the qualities of a buddha simultaneously with seeing, in order to follow the wisdom of vast power simultaneously with hearing, in order to attain faith in sentient beings and overcome afflictions simultaneously with seeing, in order to attain the support that is like the king of medicines,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang mtshungs pa'i lus thob pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir smon lam ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang mtshungs pa'i lus thob pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir smon lam ni dgu pa'o //
translated: in order to attain a body that is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, and in order to practice the conduct of all bodhisattvas.

original: pa bskul ba chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po nye bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing chen po mthu stobs ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings yangs pa nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par bskal pa'i grangs thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i grangs chad pa med pa'i phyir dang ;
analyzed: pa bskul ba chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba mya ngan las 'da' ba chen po nye bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing chen po mthu stobs ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings yangs pa nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par bskal pa'i grangs thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i grangs chad pa med pa'i phyir dang ;
translated: Because he turns the great wheel of Dharma and demonstrates great nirvana, because he is followed by the great buddha field of Powerful Wisdom, and because the appearance of buddhas is uninterrupted for all the enumerations of eons throughout the vast realm of phenomena that extends to the end of space and to the end of time.

original: ye shes chen po mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir smon lam chen po bcu pa mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir smon lam chen po bcu pa mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The tenth great vow is made in order to turn the great wheel of the Dharma, to demonstrate great nirvana, to follow the great buddha field, the field of wisdom and power, and to manifest the great wisdom, because the appearance of buddhas is uninterrupted throughout all the enumerations of kalpas in the vast realm of phenomena that extends to the end of space and to the end of time.

original: smon lam chen po de rnams ni 'bad rtsol chen po bcu'o //
analyzed: smon lam chen po de rnams ni 'bad rtsol chen po bcu'o //
translated: These ten great vows are the ten great efforts.

original: de la sogs pa smon lam re re la 'khor ni so sor yongs su sbyong bar byed pa grangs med khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dang gang gis byang chub sems dpa' mngon par sgrub par byed pa thob pa 'di ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o
analyzed: de la sogs pa smon lam re re la 'khor ni so sor yongs su sbyong bar byed pa grangs med khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dang gang gis byang chub sems dpa' mngon par sgrub par byed pa thob pa 'di ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o
translated: In each of these aspirations and so on, the retinue is the countless hundreds of thousands of millions of those who are purified individually and who attain the accomplishment of the bodhisattvas. This is the perfection of aspiration.

original: // stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: // stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The perfection of power is twofold:

original: 'di ltar / so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bsgom pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bsgom pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of discernment and the power of meditation.

original: yang stobs bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: yang stobs bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are also twelve powers:

original: 'di ltar / bsam pa'i stobs dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang / gzungs kyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs dang / dbang gi stobs dang / spobs pa'i stobs dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsam pa'i stobs dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang / gzungs kyi stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs dang / dbang gi stobs dang / spobs pa'i stobs dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang /
translated: the power of intention, the power of superior intention, the power of retention, the power of samadhi, the power of abundance, the power of mastery, the power of eloquence, the power of aspiration, the power of the branches of enlightenment, the power of the perfections, the power of the factors of enlightenment, and the power of the factors of the path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs dang / byams pa chen po'i stobs dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs so zhes pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs dang / byams pa chen po'i stobs dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi stobs so zhes pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is the power of the perfections, the power of great love, the power of great compassion, and the power of the blessing of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngag ma lus pa dgongs pa dang bcas pa nges par rtogs pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngag ma lus pa dgongs pa dang bcas pa nges par rtogs pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the knowledge of the complete and definitive understanding of the entire speech of the Tathagata together with its intention.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the perfection of the perfections, the twenty-second chapter of the Treatise on the Definitive Expressions of the Composed and Uncomposed.

original: // / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni phung po bdun te /
analyzed: // / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni phung po bdun te /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are seven groups.

original: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / @250a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / @250a * //
translated: Thus, the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural powers, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: and the noble eightfold path.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Among them, the foundations of mindfulness are four:

original: 'di ltar / lus dran pa nye bar gzhag dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lus dran pa nye bar gzhag dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the foundation of mindfulness of the body, the foundation of mindfulness of feelings, the foundation of mindfulness of mind, and the foundation of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi ste /
translated: There are four right efforts:

original: 'di ltar / ma skyes pa'i mi dge ba mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang / skyes pa'i mi dge ba rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang / ma skyes pa'i dge ba rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang / skyes pa'i dge ba rnams spel ba'i phyir 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma skyes pa'i mi dge ba mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang / skyes pa'i mi dge ba rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang / ma skyes pa'i dge ba rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang / skyes pa'i dge ba rnams spel ba'i phyir 'dun pa'o //
translated: Thus, the will for the non-arising of unarisen unwholesome dharmas, the will for the abandonment of arisen unwholesome dharmas, the will for the arising of unarisen wholesome dharmas, and the will for the increase of arisen wholesome dharmas.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are as follows:🔽the base of supernatural power of aspiration,🔽the base of supernatural power of perseverance,🔽the base of supernatural power of mind,

original: 'dun pa rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang / sems rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang / dpyod pa rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang / sems rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang / dpyod pa rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'o //
translated: and the base of supernatural power of investigation.

original: de la bar du spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad skye ste /
analyzed: de la bar du spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad skye ste /
translated: With regard to these, the eight formative factors that abandon the middle are produced.

original: 'di ltar / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang btang snyoms so //🔽dbang po lnga ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang btang snyoms so // dbang po lnga ni /
translated: They are as follows: aspiration, perseverance, faith, suppleness, mindfulness, vigilance, intention, and equanimity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The five faculties are as follows:🔽the faculty of faith,🔽the faculty of perseverance,🔽the faculty of mindfulness,🔽the faculty of concentration,

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: and the faculty of wisdom.

original: stobs lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stobs lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five powers are as follows:

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs so //
translated: and the power of wisdom.

original: de rnams ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: These are mundane.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven factors of awakening are as follows:🔽the factor of awakening that is mindfulness,🔽the factor of awakening that is the investigation of phenomena,🔽the factor of awakening that is perseverance,🔽the factor of awakening that is joy,

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the factor of awakening that is concentration,

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: and the factor of awakening that is equanimity.

original: lam yan lag brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eightfold noble path is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: de nyid kyis na spong ba'i 'du byed spangs ba'i sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na spong ba'i 'du byed spangs ba'i sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are also included in the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid ni bcu drug ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni bcu drug ste /
translated: Emptiness is of sixteen kinds.

original: 'di ltar / nang gi chos ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / nang gi chos ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
translated: The internal sense spheres are the six beginning with the eye.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di la ni nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di la ni nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that by way of its own nature is the emptiness of the internal.

original: phyi'i chos ni gzugs la sogs pa drug ste /
analyzed: phyi'i chos ni gzugs la sogs pa drug ste /
translated: The external sense spheres are the six beginning with form.

original: de ni de'i rang @250b bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang @250b bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that by way of its own nature is the emptiness of the external.

original: de ni nang yin te sems kyis zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nang yin te sems kyis zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is internal because it is grasped by the mind.

original: phyi rol yin te dbang pos bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol yin te dbang pos bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is external because it is not included in the sense spheres of the faculties.

original: gang dbang po'i rten du gyur pa phyi rol dang nang gis bsdus pa de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dbang po'i rten du gyur pa phyi rol dang nang gis bsdus pa de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of external and internal refers to the emptiness of the nature of the internal and external bases of the sense faculties, which are included in the internal and external.

original: gang stong pa nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i stong pa nyid ni dmigs pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i stong pa nyid ni dmigs pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid de ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness refers to the emptiness of the nature of the emptiness that is perceived as an object, which is characterized by the consciousness that perceives it as an object.

original: phyogs bcu rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / snod ni snod kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni chen po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / snod ni snod kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni chen po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the great refers to the emptiness of the nature of the ten directions and the emptiness of the nature of the world.

original: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is nirvana.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate refers to the emptiness of the nature of that.

original: 'dus byas ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The conditioned refers to the desire, form, and formless realms. The emptiness of the conditioned refers to the emptiness of the nature of that.

original: gang la skye ba med 'gag pa med gnas pa med gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med 'gag pa med gnas pa med gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: That which is neither produced, nor ceases, nor remains, nor changes into something else is unconditioned.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: That it is empty of itself is the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: gang gis rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' nye bar mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' nye bar mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
translated: That which is not perceived as the extremes of eternalism and nihilism is beyond the extremes.

original: dbus zhes brjod de /
analyzed: dbus zhes brjod de /
translated: It is called the middle.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: That it is empty of itself is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: 'khor ba'i tha ma med pa thog ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i tha ma med pa thog ma med pa nyid do //
translated: Samsara is without end and without beginning.

original: de la ni dbus med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni dbus med pa'o //
translated: It has no middle.

original: des na thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the beginning, end, and middle are empty of themselves. This is the emptiness of what is without end and beginning.

original: gang dge ba'i phyogs mi spong ba de ni dor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i phyogs mi spong ba de ni dor ba med pa ste /
translated: That which does not abandon the virtuous side is not to be discarded.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: That it is empty of itself is the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis ma byas pa 'am ma bsgyur ba de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis ma byas pa 'am ma bsgyur ba de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of all phenomena is not made or transformed by the Sravakas and so on. That emptiness of its nature is the emptiness of nature.

original: chos thams cad ni de'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad stong pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni de'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad stong pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are empty of all phenomena by way of their nature. That is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: gzugs su yod pa'i mtshan gyis gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
analyzed: gzugs su yod pa'i mtshan gyis gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
translated: The emptiness of the internal is the emptiness of the eyes and so on.🔽All those phenomena are empty of the nature of their individual characteristics and the nature of their general characteristics. That is the emptiness of individual characteristics.🔽The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the great trichiliocosm.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the nirvana that is a mere imputation.🔽The emptiness of the compounded is the emptiness of the compounded that is a mere imputation.

original: chos de rnams thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos de rnams thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the uncompounded is the emptiness of the uncompounded that is a mere imputation.🔽The emptiness of what is beyond extremes is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes in the sense that the extremes of samsara and nirvana are not observed.🔽The emptiness of the beginningless and endless is the emptiness of the beginning and end that are mere imputations.🔽The emptiness of nature is the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena that are mere imputations.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of the nonobservation of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the entity is the emptiness of the entity of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the nonentity is the emptiness of the nonentity of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the entity and nonentity is the emptiness of the entity and nonentity of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate that is a mere imputation.🔽The emptiness of the compounded is the emptiness of the compounded that is a mere imputation.🔽The emptiness of the uncompounded is the emptiness of the uncompounded that is a mere imputation.🔽The emptiness of what is beyond extremes is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes in the sense that the extremes of samsara and nirvana are not observed.

original: dus rnams ni gdod nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / dngos po btags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'das ma 'ongs da ltar nye bar dmigs te zhes mi dmigs pa de'i gang stong pa nyid de ni mi @251a * //
analyzed: dus rnams ni gdod nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / dngos po btags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'das ma 'ongs da ltar nye bar dmigs te zhes mi dmigs pa de'i gang stong pa nyid de ni mi @251a * //
translated: The emptiness of the beginningless and endless is the emptiness of the beginning and end that are mere imputations.🔽The emptiness of nature is the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena that are mere imputations.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of the nonobservation of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the entity is the emptiness of the entity of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness

original: dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The object is emptiness.

original: kun nas tshogs pa las byung ba'i chos rnams ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas tshogs pa las byung ba'i chos rnams ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Things that arise from a collection of causes and conditions do not exist inherently, because they are dependently arisen.

original: des na gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: des na gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, whatever is dependently arisen is an entity that lacks intrinsic nature.

original: de ni rang gis stong pas 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rang gis stong pas 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since that is empty of itself, this is the emptiness of entities.

original: dngos po ni phung po lnga ste de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni dngos po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni phung po lnga ste de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni dngos po stong pa nyid do //
translated: An entity is the five aggregates. Since that is empty of its own essence, this is the emptiness of entities.

original: dngos po med pa ni 'dus ma byas te nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'dus ma byas te nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: A nonentity is an unconditioned thing, such as space.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'di ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since that is empty of its own essence, this is the emptiness of nonentities.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of essential nature.

original: de des stong pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des stong pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since that is empty of itself, this is the emptiness of essential nature.

original: pha rol zhes pa ni 'dor ba nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol zhes pa ni 'dor ba nyid do //
translated: The other side is the abandonment.

original: ngo bo zhes pa ni gzhan gyis ma byas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo zhes pa ni gzhan gyis ma byas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence is the nature that is not made by others.

original: pha rol ngo bo ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol ngo bo ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid nyid do //
translated: The otherness of essence is the reality of phenomena, suchness.

original: de des stong pa 'di ni pha rol ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des stong pa 'di ni pha rol ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that with respect to that is the emptiness of the otherness of essence.

original: bsam gtan ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni bzhi ste /
translated: The absorptions are four.

original: 'di ltar / bsam gtan dang po dang ; bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bsam gtan dang po dang ; bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: They are the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, and the fourth absorption.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The four absorptions are of two types:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and transcendent.

original: de la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa ni rgyu bzhi'i 'jig rten par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa ni rgyu bzhi'i 'jig rten par 'gyur te /
translated: The absorptions and formless states are mundane due to four causes:

original: 'di ltar / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par bzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: they are afflicted, purified, posited, and purified.

original: de la lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The four unwholesome roots are the afflictions.

original: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis nyon mongs pa'i bsam gtan gyi sgo nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba kun myang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis nyon mongs pa'i bsam gtan gyi sgo nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba kun myang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They become afflicted through afflicted concentration due to afflicted thought, because they experience all the bliss of pliancy.

original: lta bas lta ba mchog gi bsam gtan pas bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta bas lta ba mchog gi bsam gtan pas bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: They become afflicted through the concentration of the view of the supremacy of views, because they are motivated by the view of the supremacy of views.🔽They become afflicted through the concentration of the view of the supremacy of morality and asceticism, because they are motivated by the view of the supremacy of morality and asceticism.🔽They become afflicted through the concentration of the view of the supremacy of the aggregates, because they are motivated by the view of the supremacy of the aggregates.🔽They become afflicted through the concentration of the view of the supremacy of the elements, because they are motivated by the view of the supremacy of the elements.🔽They become afflicted through the concentration of the view of the supremacy of the sense bases, because they are motivated by the view of the supremacy of the sense bases.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mthar rtog pa la sogs pa lta ba kun nas ldang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mthar rtog pa la sogs pa lta ba kun nas ldang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They become afflicted through the concentration of the view of the supremacy of the perishable collection, because they are motivated by the view of the perishable collection.

original: nga rgyal gyis nga rgyal mchog gi bsam gtan pas bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /🔽des khyad par lhag par rtogs mthong bas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis nga rgyal mchog gi bsam gtan pas bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te / des khyad par lhag par rtogs mthong bas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They become afflicted through the concentration of pride, because they are motivated by pride.🔽They become afflicted through the concentration of ignorance, because they are motivated by ignorance.

original: ma rig pa the tshom mchog gi bsam gtan pas bsam gtan nyon mongs can du 'gyur te /🔽de kho na nyid ma rtogs par grol ba 'dod pa'i khyad par lhag par rtogs pa la thar pa ma yin pa zhes the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa the tshom mchog gi bsam gtan pas bsam gtan nyon mongs can du 'gyur te /🔽de kho na nyid ma rtogs par grol ba 'dod pa'i khyad par lhag par rtogs pa la thar pa ma yin pa zhes the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They become afflicted through the concentration of doubt, because they are motivated by doubt.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @251b sems 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @251b sems 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the afflicted mind is engaged in the afflictions and secondary afflictions of the desire and form realms.

original: rnam par byang ba ni dka' ba'i bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa yin yang dge ba nyid de //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni dka' ba'i bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa yin yang dge ba nyid de //
translated: Purification is the difficult concentration, etc. Although mundane, it is virtuous

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the faults of affliction, etc.

original: rgyu gnyis dag las rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis dag las rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Purification occurs from two causes:

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the faults of affliction, etc. and because it is free from the stain of entanglements.

original: rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The establishment of the absorptions is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad bzung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang ming du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad bzung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang ming du bya ba'o //
translated: the establishment of the members, the establishment of the absorptions, the establishment of the measure of their duration, and the establishment of their names.

original: de la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The presentation of the branches is stated in the first absorption has five branches and so on.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The first absorption has five branches:

original: 'di ltar / rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Discernment, investigation, joy, pleasure and one pointed mind.

original: de rnams la rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dag gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de rnams la rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dag gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Among them, discernment and investigation are branches of antidotes.

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Joy and pleasure are branches of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag dang phan yon gyi yan lag dag gi rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag dang phan yon gyi yan lag dag gi rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One pointed mind is the branch of support for the branches of antidotes and benefit.

original: yan lag lnga po de dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po ni /
analyzed: yan lag lnga po de dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po ni /
translated: The first absorption endowed with those five branches

original: skyon gnyis dang rnam par bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon gnyis dang rnam par bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: is free of two faults.

original: 'di ltar / 'dod pas dben pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir rnam rtog med cing rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod pas dben pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir rnam rtog med cing rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ste ;
translated: Thus, the second meditative concentration, which is free from investigation and analysis because it is free from the desire realm and free from the nonvirtuous factors, has four branches.

original: yan lag bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: The four branches are as follows:

original: nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: inner clarity, joy, bliss, and one-pointed mind.

original: de rnams la nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de rnams la nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Among these, inner clarity is the branch of antidote.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Joy and bliss are the branches of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointed mind is the branch of support.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The third meditative concentration has five branches.

original: de la yan lag lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five branches are as follows:

original: dga' ba yang btang snyoms su byed pa'i phyir btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba yang btang snyoms su byed pa'i phyir btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, bliss, and one-pointed mind.

original: de rnams la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de rnams la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection are the branches of counteracting.

original: bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag @252a * //
analyzed: bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag @252a * //
translated: Pleasure is the branch of benefit.

original: go ; / sems rtse gcig pa ni rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: go ; / sems rtse gcig pa ni rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the branch of support.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth absorption has four branches.

original: de la yan lag bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four branches are as follows:

original: btang snyoms rnam par dag pa dang / dran pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yid dga' ba yid mi bde ba rnams sngon pa zhin du spangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: btang snyoms rnam par dag pa dang / dran pa rnam par dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yid dga' ba yid mi bde ba rnams sngon pa zhin du spangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, and neither pleasure nor pain due to the prior abandonment of pain, mental pleasure, and mental discomfort.

original: sdug bsngal ma yin bde ba ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin bde ba ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the fourth.

original: 'di rnams la btang snyoms rnam par dag pa dang dran pa rnam par dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di rnams la btang snyoms rnam par dag pa dang dran pa rnam par dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Among these, pure equanimity and pure mindfulness are the branches of countering.

original: sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Neither pleasure nor pain is the branch of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni rten gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni rten gyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the branch of support.

original: 'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i sde pa'i lung las bsam gtan lnga bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i sde pa'i lung las bsam gtan lnga bshad de /
translated: The scriptures of the Sthavira sect explain five meditative attainments.

original: de la rnam rtog dpyod pa dga' ba bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga ldan no //
analyzed: de la rnam rtog dpyod pa dga' ba bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po ni yan lag lnga ldan no //
translated: The first meditative attainment possesses five members: investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and a one-pointed mind.

original: dpyod pa dga' ba bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ldan no //
analyzed: dpyod pa dga' ba bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ldan no //
translated: The second meditative attainment possesses four members: investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and a one-pointed mind.

original: dga' ba bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa ni yan lag gsum ldan no //
analyzed: dga' ba bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa ni yan lag gsum ldan no //
translated: The third meditative attainment possesses three members: joy, pleasure, and a one-pointed mind.

original: bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni yan lag gnyis ldan no //
analyzed: bde ba sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa ni yan lag gnyis ldan no //
translated: The fourth meditative attainment possesses two members: pleasure and a one-pointed mind.

original: btang snyoms dang sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan lnga pa ni yan lag gnyis ldan no //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan lnga pa ni yan lag gnyis ldan no //
translated: The fifth meditative attainment possesses two members: equanimity and a one-pointed mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The presentation of meditative attainment is as follows.

original: yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: One enters the first meditative attainment through seven mental orientations.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The same applies up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de la yid la byed pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are seven kinds of attention:

original: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pa dang / lhag par grol ba dang / rnam par dben pa dang / dga' ba 'dud par byed pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pa dang / lhag par grol ba dang / rnam par dben pa dang / dga' ba 'dud par byed pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: attention to the characteristics, attention to the investigation, attention to the discernment of what is to be realized, attention to the discernment of the investigation, attention to the discernment of the result of the investigation, attention to the result of the task, and attention to the task itself.🔽Attention to the characteristics is the attention of one who is a beginner, who has not yet attained concentration, who is engaged in the investigation of the characteristics of the truths.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid la byed pas 'dod pa la skyon du yang dag par mthong bas dang ; rags pa'i mtshan nyid so sor myong bar byed de /
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid la byed pas 'dod pa la skyon du yang dag par mthong bas dang ; rags pa'i mtshan nyid so sor myong bar byed de /
translated: He sees the imperfections of the realm of desire and experiences the characteristics of grossness.

original: de dag dngos po med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid so sor myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag dngos po med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid so sor myong bar byed do //
translated: Because of the non-existence of those, he experiences the characteristics of calmness in the first meditation.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid so sor rig pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: This is attention to the characteristics.

original: de yang thos pa dang bsam pa mang bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thos pa dang bsam pa mang bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the attention of one who has much listening and reflection.🔽Attention to the investigation is the attention of one who has attained concentration, who is engaged in the investigation of the characteristics of the truths.

original: de las gong du thos bsam las @252b 'das te /
analyzed: de las gong du thos bsam las @252b 'das te /
translated: Beyond that, one should transcend listening and reflection and🔽cultivate the meditative aspect of the mind, which is characterized by tranquility.

original: mtha' gcig tu sgom pa'i rnam pa yid zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas lhag mthong bsgoms pa nas yang ci ltar btsal ba'i rags pa dang zhi ba nyid lhag par mos par byed pa 'di ni lhag par grol ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu sgom pa'i rnam pa yid zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas lhag mthong bsgoms pa nas yang ci ltar btsal ba'i rags pa dang zhi ba nyid lhag par mos par byed pa 'di ni lhag par grol ba'o //
translated: From the cultivation of tranquility and insight that focus on signs, one should also cultivate the superior aspiration for coarseness and peace, as they are investigated. This is the superior liberation.

original: de dag dang po nyid du goms pa'i las spong ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: de dag dang po nyid du goms pa'i las spong ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The mental attention that is concomitant with the path of abandoning the actions that are initially cultivated in relation to those is

original: rab tu dben pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa ste /
translated: isolation.

original: des nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa mchog spangs pa'i phyir dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa mchog spangs pa'i phyir dang / btang snyoms kyi gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it abandons the most excellent aspect of the afflictions and because it abandons the negative reflex actions of equanimity.

original: rnal 'byor pa de ni la gong du spong ba dang song ba'i phan yon mthong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de ni la gong du spong ba dang song ba'i phan yon mthong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: That yogin sees the benefits of having gone to the higher stages of abandoning and delights in them.

original: rab tu dben pa chung ngu dga' ba bde ba dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa chung ngu dga' ba bde ba dang ldan pas /
translated: With the joy of the small stage of isolation, he is endowed with bliss.

original: dus dang dus su rab tu dang ba'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: dus dang dus su rab tu dang ba'i yid la byed pas /
translated: From time to time, he has mental attention that is clear.

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa bsal gyi bar du sems kun du dga' bar byed pa 'di ni dga' ba sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa bsal gyi bar du sems kun du dga' bar byed pa 'di ni dga' ba sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the mental orientation of delight, which delights the mind until it is free from torpor and restlessness.

original: dge ba'i sbyor ba nye bar bstan pa yang dag par ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba de nyid kyis /
analyzed: dge ba'i sbyor ba nye bar bstan pa yang dag par ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ba de nyid kyis /
translated: The yogi who is endowed with the teaching of virtuous application

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa kun du spyod pa /

original: 'di ltar / spong ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //

translated: the part that is favorable to the elimination of defilements, the part that is favorable to abiding in this life, the part that is favorable to distinction, and the part that is favorable to the penetration of the truths.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni dag pa rnam pa gnyis te /

original: dag pa 'di'i mtshan ci zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa 'di'i mtshan ci zhe na /

analyzed: brjod de / nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni spong ba'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: It is said: that which is favorable to the non-arising of defilements is the part that is favorable to the elimination of defilements.

analyzed: rang gis dang rjes su mthun pa ni gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //

analyzed: sa gong ma dang rjes su mthun pa ni khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa'o //

original: zag pa med pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The stage conducive to penetration is in conformity with the uncontaminated.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi nyes pa ni drug ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi nyes pa ni drug ste /
translated: There are six faults of concentration:

original: 'di ltar / le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba'o //
translated: Laziness, forgetting the instruction, laxity and excitation, lack of application, and application.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dri ma bdun te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dri ma bdun te /
translated: There are seven stains of concentration:

original: 'di ltar / rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / dbugs 'jug pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / dbugs 'jug pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'o //
translated: Conceptualization, analysis, joy, supreme joy, pleasure, inhalation, and exhalation.

original: rnam par thar pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa zhes pa ni /
translated: As for the liberations,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
translated: there are eight liberations:

original: 'di ltar / gzugs can gzugs la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs can gzugs la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is when one with form sees forms.

original: nang gzugs med pas phyi rol gzugs la lta ba 'di ni gnyis so //
analyzed: nang gzugs med pas phyi rol gzugs la lta ba 'di ni gnyis so //
translated: The second is the perception of the external form as ugly.

original: sdug pa'o zhes mos par gyur pa 'di ni gsum pa'o //🔽de gsum ni sprul @254a * //
analyzed: sdug pa'o zhes mos par gyur pa 'di ni gsum pa'o // de gsum ni sprul @254a * //
translated: The third is the perception of the external form as beautiful.

original: pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa ste gzugs can no //
analyzed: pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa ste gzugs can no //
translated: These three are the liberation of the form realm.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite space is the fourth liberation.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness is the fifth liberation.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sphere of nothingness is the sixth liberation.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the seventh liberation.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The cessation of perception and feeling is the eighth liberation.

original: de lnga ni gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: de lnga ni gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: These five are the formless liberations.

original: de la dag pa'i gzugs med bzhi ni /
analyzed: de la dag pa'i gzugs med bzhi ni /

original: de'i ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'o //

original: zhi ba la gnas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhi ba la gnas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: They are called abodes of peace.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni thar pa dang 'dra ba'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni thar pa dang 'dra ba'i gnas pa'o //

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la rten 'das nas /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la rten 'das nas /
translated: Having transcended the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation,

original: gang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gags te /
analyzed: gang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gags te /

original: ldang ba tshun chad du mchog tu zhi bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldang ba tshun chad du mchog tu zhi bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a state of supreme peace until one arises from it.

original: de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa zhes so //🔽mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa zhes so // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni /
