original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The nine serial absorptions are as follows:

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'du shes dang tshor ba dang 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'du shes dang tshor ba dang 'gog pa'o //
translated: The four absorptions and the four formless states, and the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight spheres of mastery are as follows:

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gzugs chung ngu la lta zhing zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ba 'di ni zil gyis mnan pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gzugs chung ngu la lta zhing zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ba 'di ni zil gyis mnan pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: Having the ideation of inner form, one sees small external forms. Having subdued them, one knows and sees them. This is the first sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs su shes nas phyi rol gzugs chen po la lta zhing /
analyzed: nang gzugs su shes nas phyi rol gzugs chen po la lta zhing /
translated: Having the inner form, one sees the external form as large.

original: de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ste /
translated: One sees and knows them by surpassing them.

original: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Having the perception of that, this is the second.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes nas phyi rol gzugs chung ngu la lta zhing /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes nas phyi rol gzugs chung ngu la lta zhing /
translated: Having the inner perception of formlessness, one sees the external form as small.

original: de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: One sees and knows them by surpassing them. This is the third.

original: de bzhin du chen po zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the large is the fourth.🔽Having the inner perception of formlessness, one sees the external form as blue.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes nas phyi rol gzugs sngon po la lta zhing de dag zhes pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes nas phyi rol gzugs sngon po la lta zhing de dag zhes pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth.

original: de bzhin du ser po zhes pa ni drug pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du ser po zhes pa ni drug pa'o ;
translated: Similarly, the yellow is the sixth.

original: / de bzhin du dmar po zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du dmar po zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the red is the seventh.

original: de bzhin du dkar po zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the white is the eighth.

original: de la gzugs chung ngu ni  sems can du brjod pa ste tshad chung ngu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs chung ngu ni  sems can du brjod pa ste tshad chung ngu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the small form is said to be a sentient being because it is small in size.

original: chen po ni sems can du brjod pa ma yin pa ste khang pa dang gzhal yas khang dang ri la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chen po ni sems can du brjod pa ma yin pa ste khang pa dang gzhal yas khang dang ri la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great is not called a sentient being, but is a house, a celestial mansion, a mountain, etc.

original: tshad chen po nyid yin @254b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad chen po nyid yin @254b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of great dimension.

original: zad par bcu ni 'di lta ste /🔽zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: zad par bcu ni 'di lta ste / zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: The ten universal bases are:

original: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: the universal base of earth, the universal base of water, the universal base of fire, the universal base of wind, the universal base of blue, the universal base of yellow, the universal base of red, the universal base of white, the universal base of the sphere of infinite space, and the universal base of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rang bzhin no //🔽'di ltar / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rang bzhin no // 'di ltar / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do //
translated: The three samadhis are:🔽the emptiness samadhi, the signless samadhi, and the wishless samadhi.🔽The emptiness samadhi is the door of liberation of emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The signless samadhi is the door of liberation of signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is the door of liberation called wishlessness.

original: 'ga' zhig du rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi pa yang ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig du rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi pa yang ste /
translated: In some places, there is a fourth door of liberation,

original: 'di ltar / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: namely, the door of liberation of no fabrication.

original: shes pa bcu gnyis ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes pa bcu gnyis ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are twelve knowledges:

original: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of exhaustion, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of phenomena, subsequent knowledge, conventional knowledge,

original: yongs su sbyangs pa shes pa dang / sgra ci bzhin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs pa shes pa dang / sgra ci bzhin pa shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of thorough training, and the knowledge of what is so and what is not.

original: dbang po ni gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: dbang po ni gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: There are three faculties:

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge, and the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.

original: rim pa bzhin du mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa lam rnams su'o //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa lam rnams su'o //
translated: respectively, in the paths of insight, cultivation, and beyond training.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three concentrations:

original: 'di ltar / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: the concentration with applied thought and sustained thought, the concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought, and the concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: rjes su dran pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa ni bcu ste /
translated: There are ten recollections:

original: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Teaching, the recollection of the Community, the recollection of morality, the recollection of renunciation, the recollection of divinities,

original: skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus su gtogs pa rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus su gtogs pa rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: the recollection of displeasure, the recollection of death, the recollection of the body, and the recollection of breathing.

original: de la lus su son pa rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: de la lus su son pa rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: The recollection of the body is as follows:

original: lus kyi mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug nges par sems pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lus kyi mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug nges par sems pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The thirty-six impure substances of the body are definitely to be contemplated.

original: lus 'di nyid ni rkang pa'i mthil nas spyi bo dang skra dang klad pa nas 'og tu dang / sen mo dang spu dang @255a * //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid ni rkang pa'i mthil nas spyi bo dang skra dang klad pa nas 'og tu dang / sen mo dang spu dang @255a * //
translated: This body, from the soles of the feet to the top of the head, from the hair of the head and the hair of the body, below, and to the tips of the nails and body hair,🔽is filled with various kinds of impurities.

original: skra'i mthar thug pa mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang ba rnams yang dag pa ci lta ba so sor rtog pa ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: skra'i mthar thug pa mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang ba rnams yang dag pa ci lta ba so sor rtog pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the correct discernment of things as they are.

original: lus 'di la yod de /
analyzed: lus 'di la yod de /
translated: This is what exists in this body:

original: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / skyi dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / chu rgyus dang / chu ser dang / rus pa dang / rkang gzhungs dang / snying dang / mkhal ma dang / mtshor ba dang /
analyzed: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / skyi dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / chu rgyus dang / chu ser dang / rus pa dang / rkang gzhungs dang / snying dang / mkhal ma dang / mtshor ba dang /
translated: hair of the head, hair of the body, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, fluid, bones, marrow, heart, kidneys, liver,

original: glo ba dang / mchin pa dang / pho ba dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / grod pa dang / phyi sa dang / gcin dang / mchi ma dang / rdul dang / tshil dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / rnag dang /
analyzed: glo ba dang / mchin pa dang / pho ba dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / grod pa dang / phyi sa dang / gcin dang / mchi ma dang / rdul dang / tshil dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / rnag dang /
translated: lungs, liver, intestines, stomach, colon, spleen, excrement, urine, tears, sweat, grease, saliva, mucus, pus,

original: khrag dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / zhag dang / dri ma dang / glang pa dang / mig rnag dang / rna spabs so //
analyzed: khrag dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / zhag dang / dri ma dang / glang pa dang / mig rnag dang / rna spabs so //
translated: blood, bile, phlegm, lymph, oil-of-the-joints, oil-of-the-skin, eye-discharge, and ear-wax.

original: lus 'di la so sor yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin so sor rtog go zhes so //
analyzed: lus 'di la so sor yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin so sor rtog go zhes so //
translated: He contemplates this body as it really is, in its individual parts.

original: de la dkon mchog gsum ni rten no //
analyzed: de la dkon mchog gsum ni rten no //
translated: The Three Jewels are the support.

original: tshul khrims dang gtong ba ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang gtong ba ni gzhi'o //
translated: Morality and generosity are the basis.

original: lha ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: lha ni dbang po'o //
translated: The gods are the power.

original: yid 'byung ba dang 'chi ba dang dbugs mi 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba dang 'chi ba dang dbugs mi 'byin pa'o //
translated: Disgust, death, and the absence of breathing are the application.

original: lus su son pa dang dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dag gis na rnam par mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: lus su son pa dang dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dag gis na rnam par mi brjed pa'o //
translated: The mindfulness of the body and the mindfulness of breathing are the non-loss.

original: de la rgyu bzhis nyin mo sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu bzhis nyin mo sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The mindfulness of the Buddha is fourfold during the day.

original: 'di ltar / dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa dang / mchod pa'i cho ga dang / rnam pa rjes su dran pa dang / phan 'dogs pa rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa dang / mchod pa'i cho ga dang / rnam pa rjes su dran pa dang / phan 'dogs pa rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: (1) striving in virtue, (2) the rite of worship, (3) recollecting the aspects, and (4) recollecting the benefits.

original: ci ltar nyin mo mi nyal bar sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa goms pa de las nyal ba na'ang de kho na ltar rmi lam mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar nyin mo mi nyal bar sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa goms pa de las nyal ba na'ang de kho na ltar rmi lam mthong ba'o //
translated: Just as one who is not sleeping during the day and is familiar with the recollection of the Buddha will see him in dreams, so also one who is familiar with the recollection of the Buddha during the day will see him in dreams.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa rnams ni phan yon bdun te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa rnams ni phan yon bdun te /
translated: The benefits of the recollections of the Buddha and so on are seven.

original: 'di ltar skye ba dran par 'gyur ba dang / rab tu dang ba mang ba nyid dang / dman pa'i chos la 'gyod pa dang bcas par 'chi ba'i dus mi byed pa dang / lus zhig na bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dran par 'gyur ba dang / rab tu dang ba mang ba nyid dang / dman pa'i chos la 'gyod pa dang bcas par 'chi ba'i dus mi byed pa dang / lus zhig na bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams su skye ba'o //
translated: Thus, one becomes: (1) mindful of one's births, (2) very faithful, (3) not dying with regret for the lesser vehicles, and (4) after the body is destroyed, one is born among the gods in the happy realms of the higher rebirths.

original: 'dod khams dang gzugs khams kyi sems can la dmigs pas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dod khams dang gzugs khams kyi sems can la dmigs pas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'o //
translated: The four Brahma abodes are focused on sentient beings of the desire and form realms.

original: de nyid tshad med pa'i sems can la dmigs pas tshad med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid tshad med pa'i sems can la dmigs pas tshad med pa bzhi'o //
translated: They are the four immeasurables because they focus on immeasurable sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: love, compassion, joy, and impartiality.

original: de la bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pas ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pas ni byams pa'o //
translated: Among them, love is the desire that they possess happiness.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pas ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pas ni snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire that they be free from suffering.

original: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pas ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pas ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the desire that they never be separated from happiness.

original: nyon mongs pa med par 'dod pas ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par 'dod pas ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Impartiality is the desire that they be free from afflictions.

original: bzhi po de rnams @255b ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ru ni sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de rnams @255b ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ru ni sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: On the level of earnest aspiration, these four focus on sentient beings.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun du ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun du ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: On the seven bodhisattva stages, such as the stage of the joyous, they focus on phenomena.

original: de las gong du ni dmigs pa med pa'o //🔽'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de las gong du ni dmigs pa med pa'o // 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Above that, they are without a focus.

original: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum bshad de /
analyzed: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum bshad de /
translated: The noble Aksayamatinirdesa also explains three types of impartiality:

original: 'di ltar / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten chos brgyad la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten chos brgyad la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is indifferent to the afflictions because he has abandoned the eight worldly concerns, such as gain and loss.

original: bzod pa byed pa'i phyir rang bzhin kun du bsrung ba'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bzod pa byed pa'i phyir rang bzhin kun du bsrung ba'i btang snyoms so //
translated: He is indifferent to the protection of his nature because he is patient.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: He is indifferent to the right and wrong times.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms ni drug ste /🔽'di ltar / sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms ni drug ste / 'di ltar / sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: He is indifferent to the right and wrong times in six ways:🔽He is indifferent to generosity at the time of morality.

original: tshul khrims dus su sbyin pa btang snyoms so //🔽bzod pa'i dus su brtson 'grus btang snyoms so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dus su sbyin pa btang snyoms so // bzod pa'i dus su brtson 'grus btang snyoms so //
translated: He is indifferent to morality at the time of generosity.🔽He is indifferent to patience at the time of effort.

original: brtson 'grus dus su bsam gtan btang snyoms so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dus su bsam gtan btang snyoms so //
translated: He is indifferent to effort at the time of meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan dus su sbyin pa btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dus su sbyin pa btang snyoms so //
translated: He is indifferent to meditative concentration at the time of generosity.

original: shes rab dus su pha rol tu phyin pa lnga btang snyoms so //
analyzed: shes rab dus su pha rol tu phyin pa lnga btang snyoms so //
translated: He is indifferent to the five perfections at the time of wisdom.

original: nor ni bdun te /
analyzed: nor ni bdun te /
translated: He is indifferent to the seven riches.

original: 'di ltar / dad pa'i nor dang / tshul khrims kyi nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / gtong ba'i nor dang / shes rab kyi nor dang / ngo tsha ba'i nor dang / khrel yod pa'i nor ro //🔽spyan lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dad pa'i nor dang / tshul khrims kyi nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / gtong ba'i nor dang / shes rab kyi nor dang / ngo tsha ba'i nor dang / khrel yod pa'i nor ro // spyan lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are the wealth of faith, the wealth of morality, the wealth of learning, the wealth of generosity, the wealth of wisdom, the wealth of conscience, and the wealth of shame.

original: sha'i spyan dang / rnam par smin pa'i lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //🔽mngon par shes pa drug ni 'di lta ste /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: sha'i spyan dang / rnam par smin pa'i lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no // mngon par shes pa drug ni 'di lta ste / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: The five eyes are the eye of flesh, the eye of divine destiny, the eye of wisdom, the eye of teaching, and the eye of a Buddha.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The six superknowledges are the superknowledge of magical power, the superknowledge of the divine eye, the superknowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of knowing others' minds, the superknowledge of recollecting former lives, and the superknowledge of knowing the destruction of the impurities.

original: gzungs ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzungs ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four retentions are the retention of the Dharma, the retention of meaning, the retention of the teaching, and the retention of confidence.

original: 'di ltar / bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / gsang sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / gsang sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: Thus, there is the dharani of patience, the dharani of the Dharma, the dharani of meaning, and the dharani of spells.

original: yang gzungs ni bcu ste /
analyzed: yang gzungs ni bcu ste /
translated: Again, there are ten dharanis:

original: 'di ltar / don gyi gzungs dang / gzhung gi gzungs dang / mngon shes kyi gzungs dang / 'od zer rnam par 'gyed pa'i gzungs dang / pha rol rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i gzungs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang dbul po sems can rjes su bsgrub pa nye bar sgrub pa'i gzungs dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / don gyi gzungs dang / gzhung gi gzungs dang / mngon shes kyi gzungs dang / 'od zer rnam par 'gyed pa'i gzungs dang / pha rol rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i gzungs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang dbul po sems can rjes su bsgrub pa nye bar sgrub pa'i gzungs dang /
translated: Thus, there is the dharani of meaning, the dharani of scripture, the dharani of superknowledge, the dharani of radiating light, the dharani of defeating opponents, the dharani of accomplishing the worship of the Tathagata and the needs of poor sentient beings,

original: theg pa chen po la gzhol ba'i sems can @256a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la gzhol ba'i sems can @256a * //
translated: the dharani of encouraging sentient beings to enter the Mahayana,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i gzungs dang / ma chags pa'i smon lam gyi gzungs dang / spobs pa mi zad pa'i gzungs dang / don sna tshogs pa'i spobs pa'i gzungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i gzungs dang / ma chags pa'i smon lam gyi gzungs dang / spobs pa mi zad pa'i gzungs dang / don sna tshogs pa'i spobs pa'i gzungs so //
translated: the dharani of unattached aspiration, the dharani of inexhaustible eloquence, and the dharani of various kinds of eloquence.

original: 'chi ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dbul ba dang / nye bar spyod pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / yongs su tshol ba'i 'bad pa dang / chos kyis phongs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa dang / 'dod pa rnam par nyams pa dang /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / dbul ba dang / nye bar spyod pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / yongs su tshol ba'i 'bad pa dang / chos kyis phongs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa dang / 'dod pa rnam par nyams pa dang /
translated: death, afflictions, poverty, enjoyment, miserable realms, striving to seek, the karmic obstruction of the loss of the Dharma, the loss of desire,

original: sba gong ba dang / the tshom ste /
analyzed: sba gong ba dang / the tshom ste /
translated: and doubt.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba bcu'i gnyen po ni rim pa bzhin du dbang bcu ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba bcu'i gnyen po ni rim pa bzhin du dbang bcu ste /
translated: The antidotes to the ten kinds of harm are the ten masteries, respectively.

original: 'di ltar / tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang /
translated: They are mastery over life, mastery over mind, mastery over equipment, mastery over karma, mastery over birth, mastery over miracles, mastery over aspiration,

original: lhag par mos pa la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang pa'o //
translated: mastery over resolute intention, mastery over wisdom, and mastery over the Dharma.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal gyi bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal gyi bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o /
translated: The great paṇḍita Daśabalaśrībhadra’s Compendium on the Ascertainment of the Luminous: Ascertaining the Compounded and Uncompounded states, “The chapter on the ascertainment of the bodhisattva path is the twenty-third.”

original: // / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la rtogs par byed pa'i gang zag gi dbye bas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gzhag pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la rtogs par byed pa'i gang zag gi dbye bas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gzhag pa gnyis te /
translated: The presentation of the bodhisattva is twofold, according to the categories of the individuals who are engaged in the bodhisattva vehicle.🔽They are:

original: 'di ltar / gang zag rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang zag rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the individual and the presentation of the realizations.

original: de la gang zag gi rdzas med kyang rgyu rnam pa bzhis gang zag rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi rdzas med kyang rgyu rnam pa bzhis gang zag rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Although the substance of the individual does not exist, there are four types of individuals according to four causes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: tha snyad bde ba'i don du dang / mi skrag pa'i don du dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi skyon can yon tan can bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: tha snyad bde ba'i don du dang / mi skrag pa'i don du dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi skyon can yon tan can bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: for the sake of easy convention, for the sake of non-fear, and for the sake of teaching the faults and qualities of self and others.

original: de la tha snyad bde ba'i don du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la tha snyad bde ba'i don du zhes pa ni /
translated: “For the sake of easy convention” means

original: gzugs la sogs pa mang po rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mang po rnams kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa /
translated: Because the names of many things, such as form, etc., are different,

original: ming tha dad pa mang po rnams gcig tu bsdus pa'i sems can gyi ming gis brjod pas tha snyad tshegs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming tha dad pa mang po rnams gcig tu bsdus pa'i sems can gyi ming gis brjod pas tha snyad tshegs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the many different names are included in the name sentient being, the conventional is not difficult to express.

original: 'jig rten rjes su 'jug pa'i don gyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten rjes su 'jug pa'i don gyis zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “in order to engage with the world” means that

original: 'jig rten chos tsam gyi ming ni sems can med par tha snyad gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten chos tsam gyi ming ni sems can med par tha snyad gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: the names of mere phenomena of the world do not exist without sentient beings.

original: de lta mod kyi phal cher ni sems can gyi tha snyad kyis so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi phal cher ni sems can gyi tha snyad kyis so //
translated: Nevertheless, for the most part, the conventional is expressed in terms of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pas kyang nges par 'jig rten dang lhan cig tu tha snyad bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pas kyang nges par 'jig rten dang lhan cig tu tha snyad bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, the noble ones must use conventions in common with the world.

original: de 'jig rten rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de 'jig rten rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is engaging with the world.

original: 'jig rten mi skrag pa'i don du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten mi skrag pa'i don du zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “in order to not frighten worldly people” means that

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la @256b mi mkhas pa rnams thams cad du sems can med pa thos nas skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la @256b mi mkhas pa rnams thams cad du sems can med pa thos nas skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: those who are not skilled in the nature of dependent origination are frightened when they hear that sentient beings do not exist at all.

original: bdag gzhan gyi skyon yon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gzhan gyi skyon yon bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the faults and virtues of self and others:

original: gang gis gang zag gi rnam par gzhag pa mi byed /
analyzed: gang gis gang zag gi rnam par gzhag pa mi byed /
translated: By what is the classification of persons not made?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba tsam bstan mod /🔽sems can du btags pa med pas sems can 'di rnams kyi skyon rnams ni spangs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba tsam bstan mod / sems can du btags pa med pas sems can 'di rnams kyi skyon rnams ni spangs so //
translated: Only the mere afflictions and purification are taught.🔽Since there is no designation of sentient beings, it is not possible to know, “The faults of these sentient beings are abandoned”

original: yon tan 'di rnams ni bskrun no zhes shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: yon tan 'di rnams ni bskrun no zhes shes par mi nus so //
translated: and “These virtues are produced.”

original: de la gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de la gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The classification of persons is sevenfold:

original: 'di ltar / spyod pa'i dbye bas dang / nges par 'byung ba'i dbye bas dang / nye bar ston pa'i dbye bas dang / sbyor ba'i dbye bas dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas dang / khams kyi dbye bas dang / bya ba'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / spyod pa'i dbye bas dang / nges par 'byung ba'i dbye bas dang / nye bar ston pa'i dbye bas dang / sbyor ba'i dbye bas dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas dang / khams kyi dbye bas dang / bya ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: Thus, by the classification of practice, by the classification of renunciation, by the classification of teaching, by the classification of application, by the classification of result, by the classification of realm, and by the classification of action.

original: de la spyod pa'i dbye bas gang zag bdun te /
analyzed: de la spyod pa'i dbye bas gang zag bdun te /
translated: By the classification of practice, there are seven persons:

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa dang / gti mug la spyod pa dang / nga rgyal la spyod pa dang / rnam rtog la spyod pa dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa dang / zhan pa'i sdug bsngal can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa dang / gti mug la spyod pa dang / nga rgyal la spyod pa dang / rnam rtog la spyod pa dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa dang / zhan pa'i sdug bsngal can no //
translated: Thus, there are those who practice with passion, those who practice with hatred, those who practice with delusion, those who practice with pride, those who practice with discursive thought, those who practice with a mixture of these, and those who practice with a weak and suffering mind.

original: de la chags par bya ba'i dngos po dman pa la yang 'dod chags chen po skye ba'i phyir dang / skyes pa'i 'dod chags yun ring du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir drag la rgyun ring ba'i 'dod chags la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags par bya ba'i dngos po dman pa la yang 'dod chags chen po skye ba'i phyir dang / skyes pa'i 'dod chags yun ring du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir drag la rgyun ring ba'i 'dod chags la spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who practice with intense and long-lasting passion are those who experience great passion even for inferior objects of passion, and whose passion, once arisen, remains for a long time.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang drag ring dang / de bzhin du gti mug drag ring dang / de kho na bzhin du nga rgyal drag ring dang / de bzhin du rnam rtog drag ring ngo /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang drag ring dang / de bzhin du gti mug drag ring dang / de kho na bzhin du nga rgyal drag ring dang / de bzhin du rnam rtog drag ring ngo /
translated: Those who practice with intense and long-lasting hatred, delusion, pride, and discursive thought are to be understood in the same way.

original: gang nyon mongs tha mal du gnas pa mnyam pa'i cha la spyod pa ste nyon mongs pa mnyam par rnam par gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs tha mal du gnas pa mnyam pa'i cha la spyod pa ste nyon mongs pa mnyam par rnam par gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one who practices in the aspect of equality of the passions in their ordinary state is the one who is situated in the equality of the passions.

original: gang nyon mongs pa shin tu chung ba tha mal du gnas pa ni zhan pa'i rdul can no //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa shin tu chung ba tha mal du gnas pa ni zhan pa'i rdul can no //
translated: The one who is situated in the ordinary state of the passions in their very weak form is the one who is situated in the weak dust.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dbye bas gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dbye bas gang zag gsum ste /
translated: The persons are threefold by way of the division of the vehicles.

original: 'di ltar / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are the persons of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Great Vehicle.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa pa ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa pa ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba /
translated: Among them, the person of the Śrāvaka Vehicle is naturally of dull faculties.

original: nyan thos kyi chos nyid la nges pa'am ma nges par gnas pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos nyid la nges pa'am ma nges par gnas pa /
translated: He is situated in the certainty or uncertainty of the Śrāvaka Dharma.

original: bdag nyid 'ba' zhig grol ba'i phyir smon lam mdzad pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'ba' zhig grol ba'i phyir smon lam mdzad pa /
translated: He makes prayers for the sake of his own liberation alone.

original: skyo ba'i bsam pa dang chags bral gyi bsam pa dang grol ba'i bsam pas /
analyzed: skyo ba'i bsam pa dang chags bral gyi bsam pa dang grol ba'i bsam pas /
translated: He has the intention of weariness, the intention of freedom from attachment, and the intention of liberation.

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod la dmigs nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub cing de sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa rjes su thob bo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod la dmigs nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub cing de sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin pa rjes su thob bo //
translated: Having taken the Sravaka Canon as their object, they practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, and they attain the end of suffering.

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po zhan pa ni yang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po la @257a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po zhan pa ni yang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po la @257a * //
translated: Those of weak faculties by nature, in relation to the faculties of the Pratyekabuddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: ltos nas so //🔽rang rgyal pa'i theg pa pa ni /
analyzed: ltos nas so // rang rgyal pa'i theg pa pa ni /
translated: are the Sravakas.🔽The vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas is for those who are of middling faculties by nature, who are either destined for the Pratyekabuddha vehicle or not.

original: gang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid du nges pa'am ma nges pa'i gnas pa rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring du gyur pa dag kho na grol ba'i phyir smon lam mdzad pa sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: gang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid du nges pa'am ma nges pa'i gnas pa rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring du gyur pa dag kho na grol ba'i phyir smon lam mdzad pa sngon bzhin no //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas make their aspirations, as before, in order to liberate those who are destined for the Pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: skyo ba chags bral rnam grol gyi bsam pas /
analyzed: skyo ba chags bral rnam grol gyi bsam pas /
translated: With the intention of being liberated from attachment to renunciation,

original: nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la dmigs nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa bgyis te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la dmigs nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa bgyis te /
translated: having taken the Sravaka Canon as their object, they practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.🔽They have not produced the factors conducive to penetration,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma skyes pa'am /
translated: It is not the generation of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.🔽

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes pa'am /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes pa'am /
translated: He is one who has already produced the aids to penetration,

original: sngon du 'bras bu ma thob pa /
analyzed: sngon du 'bras bu ma thob pa /
translated: or who has not yet attained the result.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa ru rang nyid kyis lam mngon du byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa ru rang nyid kyis lam mngon du byas te /
translated: In the absence of a Buddha, he realizes the path by himself,

original: bse ru ltar gcig pu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: bse ru ltar gcig pu gnas pa'am /
translated: and dwells alone like a rhinoceros,

original: tshogs dang spyod par gyur te sdug bsngal gyi mtha' rjes su 'thob po //
analyzed: tshogs dang spyod par gyur te sdug bsngal gyi mtha' rjes su 'thob po //
translated: or he dwells in a group and attains the end of suffering.

original: theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid du nges pa'am ma nges par rnam par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa'i gang zag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid du nges pa'am ma nges par rnam par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The person who is a Mahayanist is one who is fixed in the nature of a Bodhisattva, either definitely or not definitely.

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba /
translated: He is naturally sharp-witted,

original: phyogs thams cad du mtha' med pa'i khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams rnam par grol ba'i phyir smon lam mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du mtha' med pa'i khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams rnam par grol ba'i phyir smon lam mdzad pa /
translated: and makes prayers of aspiration to liberate the sentient beings of the three worlds, without limit in any direction.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la dmigs nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la dmigs nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs te /
translated: With the intention of attaining the nirvana that is not a dwelling place, he focuses on the Bodhisattva canon and practices the teaching in accordance with it.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: He brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa lung bstan pa rab tu thob ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa lung bstan pa rab tu thob ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o //
translated: He attains the prediction of the purification of the buddhaverse and becomes fully enlightened in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lung bstan pa rab tu thob ces pa ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: lung bstan pa rab tu thob ces pa ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob ces pa'i don to //
translated: The attainment of the prediction refers to the attainment of the acceptance that phenomena are unborn on the eighth level.

original: nye bar ston pa'i dbye bas gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: nye bar ston pa'i dbye bas gang zag gsum ste /
translated: The persons are classified as three by way of the teaching.🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa dang tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'o //🔽de la tshogs ma bsags pa ni gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs pa mos pa rab tu chud pa /🔽chung du nges nges pa med pa'i skye ba dang dus kyis thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa dang tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa'o // de la tshogs ma bsags pa ni gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs pa mos pa rab tu chud pa / chung du nges nges pa med pa'i skye ba dang dus kyis thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: those who have not accumulated the collection, those who have accumulated the collection and those who have not accumulated the collection and those who have accumulated the collection.🔽Those who have not accumulated the collection are those who have not accumulated the collection of merit and wisdom and who have not obtained the result of stream enterer.

original: tshogs bsags pa dang tshogs ma bsags pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa dang tshogs ma bsags pa ni /
translated: Those who have accumulated the collection and those who have not accumulated the collection are those who have accumulated the collection of merit and wisdom and who have obtained the result of stream enterer.

original: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs pa /🔽mos pa dang rab tu dang ba 'bring po //
analyzed: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs pa / mos pa dang rab tu dang ba 'bring po //
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: 'drid des dus dang skye ba nges par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽tshogs bsags pa @257b ni /
analyzed: 'drid des dus dang skye ba nges par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'o // tshogs bsags pa @257b ni /
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs pas /🔽mos pa dang rab tu dang ba rab tu gyur pa /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs pas / mos pa dang rab tu dang ba rab tu gyur pa /
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: rab des skye ba dang dus de la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽gzhan yang tshogs ma bsags pa ni /
analyzed: rab des skye ba dang dus de la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'o // gzhan yang tshogs ma bsags pa ni /
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs nas /🔽bden pa chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa chung ngu ldan pas /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs nas / bden pa chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa chung ngu ldan pas /
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.🔽It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: chung ngu des skye ba dang dus nges pa med pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang ldan pa'o //🔽tshogs bsags pa dang ma bsags pa ni /
analyzed: chung ngu des skye ba dang dus nges pa med pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang ldan pa'o // tshogs bsags pa dang ma bsags pa ni /
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs nas /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos 'di la dmigs nas /
translated: It is the possession of the element conducive to penetra­tion, which is the time and the birth that definitely lead to liberation.

original: chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa 'bring po dang ldan pas 'bring des skye ba dang dus nges pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang ldan pa'o //🔽tshogs pas gas pa ni gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos la dmigs nas bden pa la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa rab dang ldan pas /
analyzed: chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa 'bring po dang ldan pas 'bring des skye ba dang dus nges pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang ldan pa'o // tshogs pas gas pa ni gang bden pa'i bdag po'i chos la dmigs nas bden pa la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa rab dang ldan pas /
translated: The medium one is endowed with the medium patience that definitely contemplates the Dharma, and it is definitely generated by the certainty of time.🔽The great one is endowed with the great patience that definitely contemplates the Dharma, and it is definitely generated by the certainty of time.

original: rab des skye ba de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha mthun dang ldan pa'o //🔽de la phyogs dang po ni /🔽bden pa'i bdag po'i chos la mos pa dang rab tu dang pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rab des skye ba de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha mthun dang ldan pa'o // de la phyogs dang po ni / bden pa'i bdag po'i chos la mos pa dang rab tu dang pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The great one is endowed with the great patience that definitely contemplates the Dharma, and it is definitely generated by the certainty of time.

original: dad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first category is the factor conducive to penetrative insight that is endowed with the medium patience that definitely contemplates the Dharma, which is characterized by conviction and faith in the Dharma that is the dominant condition of the truths.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ni bden pa'i bdag po'i chos la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /🔽shes rab gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ni bden pa'i bdag po'i chos la chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /🔽shes rab gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second category is the factor conducive to penetrative insight that is endowed with the great patience that definitely contemplates the Dharma, which is characterized by the patience that definitely contemplates the Dharma that is the dominant condition of the truths.

original: 'jig rten chos mchog ni ma gtogs te 'jig rten chos mchog ni rang bzhin gyis skad cig nyid yin pas rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos mchog ni ma gtogs te 'jig rten chos mchog ni rang bzhin gyis skad cig nyid yin pas rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme mundane factors are excluded, because they are naturally momentary and do not form a series.

original: de yang skyes pa dus de nyid pa yin gyis sngon ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang skyes pa dus de nyid pa yin gyis sngon ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are produced in the present moment, not previously.

original: de la dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: With regard to that, the aspiration for the wholesome factors is taken up.🔽The factors conducive to penetration are the fourfold state that is conducive to liberation.

original: gang thar pa'i don du byed pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i bstan pa'i cha dang mthun pa de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang thar pa'i don du byed pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i bstan pa'i cha dang mthun pa de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'di ltar / lhag pa'i skal ba can dang / lhag pa'i mos pa can dang / lhag pa'i 'dod pa dang / lhag pa'i rtogs pa can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lhag pa'i skal ba can dang / lhag pa'i mos pa can dang / lhag pa'i 'dod pa dang / lhag pa'i rtogs pa can no //
translated: the one with superior spiritual lineage, the one with superior devotion, the one with superior aspiration, and the one with superior understanding.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang nye bar bzung ste /🔽gang thar pa'i don du byed pa de ni lhag pa'i skal pa can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang nye bar bzung ste / gang thar pa'i don du byed pa de ni lhag pa'i skal pa can no //
translated: The aspiration for the wholesome factors is taken up.🔽The one with superior spiritual lineage is the one who is conducive to liberation.

original: grol ba dang ldan pa'i bstan pa la lhag par mos pa dang lhan pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i mos pa can no //
analyzed: grol ba dang ldan pa'i bstan pa la lhag par mos pa dang lhan pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i mos pa can no //
translated: The one with superior devotion is the one who has superior devotion to the teaching that is conducive to liberation.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i thar pa la dmigs pa mang du yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i 'dod pa can no //🔽skye ba de nyid du nges par 'byed pa'i @258a * //
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i thar pa la dmigs pa mang du yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i 'dod pa can no // skye ba de nyid du nges par 'byed pa'i @258a * //
translated: The one who frequently brings to mind the liberation that is endowed with joy is the one with superior desire.

original: cha dang mthun pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i rtogs pa can no //
analyzed: cha dang mthun pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i rtogs pa can no //
translated: The one who generates the factors conducive to penetration in that very birth is the one with superior understanding.

original: nges par 'byed pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Penetration is of six types:

original: 'di ltar / rjes su mthun pa pa dang / khyad du 'phags pa pa dang / mngon du byed pa can dang / gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba can dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar / rjes su mthun pa pa dang / khyad du 'phags pa pa dang / mngon du byed pa can dang / gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba can dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa'o ;
translated: 1) concordant, 2) superior, 3) manifest, 4) dedicated to another birth, 5) single birth, and 6) single sitting.

original: / de la gang dang po nyid du bden pa dmigs pa'i rnam pa dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu skye ba de ni rjes su mthun pa pa'o //
analyzed: / de la gang dang po nyid du bden pa dmigs pa'i rnam pa dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu skye ba de ni rjes su mthun pa pa'o //
translated: The one who initially generates the small roots of virtue that are the aspects of observing the truths is the concordant.

original: gang 'bring de ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'bring de ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: The one who generates the middling is the superior.

original: chung ngu las khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ngu las khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is superior to the small.

original: gang bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir skye ba nyid du chen po yang dag par 'jug pa de ni mngon du byed pa can no //🔽de ni yang dag rigs ma nges pa rnams khyad par can gyi byang chub phyir yongs su bsngo ba dang / mkhan po med pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba ni gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: gang bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir skye ba nyid du chen po yang dag par 'jug pa de ni mngon du byed pa can no // de ni yang dag rigs ma nges pa rnams khyad par can gyi byang chub phyir yongs su bsngo ba dang / mkhan po med pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba ni gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The one who is engaged in the Great Vehicle in order to manifest the truth is the one who manifests.🔽The one who is engaged in the Great Vehicle in order to manifest the truth in another life is the one who is engaged elsewhere.

original: gang skye ba de nyid du bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir yang dag par 'jug pa de ni skye ba gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba de nyid du bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir yang dag par 'jug pa de ni skye ba gcig pa'o //
translated: The one who is engaged in the Great Vehicle in order to manifest the truth in that very life is the one who is engaged in one life.

original: gang stan gcig la bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir yang dag par 'jug pa de ni stan gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang stan gcig la bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir yang dag par 'jug pa de ni stan gcig pa'o //
translated: The one who is engaged in the Great Vehicle in order to manifest the truth in one sitting is the one who is engaged in one sitting.

original: sbyor ba las gang zag rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba las gang zag rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two types of persons in terms of practice:

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: the one who follows trust and the one who follows the teaching.

original: de la gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rtul po gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa la rjes su brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rtul po gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa la rjes su brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Those who are of dull faculty and who have accumulated the collections are followers of faith, because they apply themselves to realize the truths in dependence on the teachings of others.

original: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rnon po rang nyid kyis bden pa'i bdag pos chos 'di la rjes su brten nas mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de ni chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshogs bsags pa dbang po rnon po rang nyid kyis bden pa'i bdag pos chos 'di la rjes su brten nas mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de ni chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Those who are of sharp faculty and who have accumulated the collections are followers of reality, because they apply themselves to realize the truths by themselves in dependence on the teachings.

original: 'bras bu'i dbye bas gang zag bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dbye bas gang zag bcu gsum ste /
translated: There are thirteen types of person due to the classification of their results.

original: 'di ltar dad pas lhag par mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / lus kyis mngon du byed pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pas lhag par mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / lus kyis mngon du byed pa dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
translated: Thus there are those resolute in faith, those obtaining by insight, those physically liberated, those liberated by wisdom, those liberated by both parts, those entering for the result of stream enterer,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i ched du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang /
translated: those who have entered the stream, those who are entering the result of a once-returner, those who are a once-returner, those who are entering the result of a non-returner, those who are a non-returner, those who are entering the result of an arhat, and those who are an arhat.
